string: 宮廷のごひいきのようね。少なくとも当分は

original: Mind yourself.
string: お気を付けて

original: Well met, brother.
string: こんにちは

original: If there's any way I can be of service, please let me know.
string: 何か役に立てる事があったら、是非教えてくれよ

original: Lord Harkon has searched for his daughter for so long. He must be very grateful.
string: ハルコン卿はずっと長い間娘さんを捜してきた。本当に感謝しているでしょうね

original: Once saw Harkon rip a man in half. He's powerful like you wouldn't believe.
string: ハルコンが男を真っ二つにするのを見た事がある。信じられないほど強いのよ

original: Let someone else rule. I just want to kill and feed.
string: 支配は他の誰かに任せるわ。私はただ殺して食べたいだけ

original: It is an honor to serve Harkon, is it not?
string: ハルコンに仕えるのは名誉な事だろう？

original: You would dare address me?
string: 誰に口を利いている？

original: Present yourself to Lord Harkon at once.
string: 今すぐハルコン卿に会いに行け

original: I leave politics to others. I serve the lord of the castle.
string: 権力闘争には興味がないの。私が仕えるのはあくまでもこの城の主よ

original: I have everything I need right here.
string: ここにいればなんの不足もないわ

original: Find your own thrall. This one's mine.
string: 他をあたって。これは私の従徒よ

original: Leave me in peace.
string: ほっといてちょうだい

original: I'm a loyal servant of the lord of the castle, nothing more.
string: 俺は城主の忠実なしもべだ。それ以上の者じゃない

original: Sit down and enjoy yourself.
string: まあ掛けてくつろいでくれ

original: The feast never ends here in Castle Volkihar.
string: ここヴォルキハル城では日夜宴が催されている

original: There's plenty for all.
string: 不自由などない

original: First Serana, now you find a Moth Priest. I'm sure Lord Harkon is very pleased with you... for now.
string: セラーナの次は聖蚕の僧侶か。ハルコン卿はきっと君の事がお気に入りだな… 今のところは

original: My Lord.
string: ご主人様

original: Well met, sister.
string: こんにちは

original: Hello there.
string: やあ、こんにちは

original: Very good. I'll just... I'll be going now.
string: いいですとも。ちょうどその… 行こうと思ってたんです

original: In the unlikely event that I ever require you for some reason, I shall find you. Until then I see no reason for us to be speaking.
string: 万が一何かの用事ができた時は、こちらから君を見つけるよ。それまで君とおしゃべりする理由はないな

original: No, I just... I thought perhaps...
string: いいえ。僕はただ… たぶんこうじゃないかと…

original: I don't recall addressing you, worm.
string: お前に話しかけた覚えはないぞ、虫ケラ

original: Vingalmo, is there... can I do anything for you?
string: ヴィンガルモ、何かその… 手伝う事はないですか？

original: Yes, Feran. Of course. I'll see to it.
string: はい、フェラン。やっておきます

original: I don't want to hear about it. I want what I asked for.
string: それについては何も聞きたくない。ほしいのはお願いしたものだけだ

original: Ah, yes. That. There were... well, complications.
string: ああ、そうでした。実はその… ちょっと面倒がありまして

original: Ronthil, where is the last batch of alchemy ingredients I asked you for?
string: ロンシル、頼んでいた最後の錬金術用の素材はどこにある？

original: Yes, of course.
string: ええ、もちろん

original: No, I don't need anything right now. Please stop asking.
string: いや、今は何もいらない。ちょっと口をつぐんでくれ

original: Can I assist you? You know I live to serve.
string: 手伝いましょうか？ そのためにいるんですから

original: What?
string: 何？

original: Do you... do you need anything, Feran?
string: 何かその… 必要なものはないですか、フェラン？

original: Wonderful. Carry on, then.
string: 素晴らしい。ではその続きを

original: No, sire. I have not.
string: いいえ。まだです

original: And you haven't forgotten what you need to do, have you?
string: 自分の仕事は忘れてないな？

original: I am well, sire.
string: 元気です

original: My dear Salonia, how are you?
string: 愛しのサロニア、ご機嫌いかがかな？

original: Oh, I see. I just assumed he'd sent for both of us. How awkward for you.
string: なるほど。我々両方を呼びつけたものかと。あいにくだったな

original: What? What meeting? I wasn't informed of any such thing!
string: 何？ 会合だって？ そんな話はまったく聞いてないぞ！

original: Surprised you weren't at the last meeting with our Lord, Vingalmo. Too busy plotting to overthrow him to show up?
string: 王との前回の会合にいなかったとは意外だな、ヴィンガルモ。謀反をくわだてるのに忙しくて、出られなかったのか？

original: And you'd do well to be more careful of whom you engage in witty banter.
string: 軽妙なおしゃべりの相手はもっと慎重に選んだ方がいいね

original: You'd do well to watch that tongue, elf.
string: 口の利き方に気をつけるんだな、エルフめが

original: I didn't even think you knew what a book was, my brutish friend.
string: 野蛮な君が本というものを知ってるとはまさに意外だな

original: Orthjolf, I'm surprised!
string: オースユルフ、驚いたよ！

original: Well, well. Where've you been, Vingalmo? Nose stuck in a book all day?
string: おやおや、どこにいたんだ、ヴィンガルモ？ 一日中本にでも埋もれていたか？

original: Arkay says it's good that we're here, but I don't know... Something about this place doesn't feel right.
string: アーケイは我々がここにいるのは良い事だと言うが、どうかな… この場所は何か嫌な感じがする

original: What? No, no. Yes, I see. All right.
string: えっ？ いえ、いいえ、はい。分かりました

original: Right. I'll settle in and then Arkay and I will start to put things right. Don't you worry.
string: よし。落ち着いたら、アーケイと共に何とかしよう。もう心配いらない

original: Here we are.
string: 着いたか

original: It begins again.
string: また始まったか

original: I fear for what is to come.
string: 何が待ち受けているのか…

original: Well, this isn't exactly a palace, is it? Still, it's sturdy, secure, and seems defensible.
string: まあ、宮殿には見えないわよね？ でも、頑丈で安全で、守りも固いわよ

original: I suppose I'd rather be here than most other places in Skyrim. If Isran needs me, it must be pretty bad.
string: スカイリムにあるどんな宮殿よりも、ここの方がいいわ。イスランに呼ばれるなんて、最悪の状況って事だもの

original: I wonder what we're up against here.
string: 一体、何と戦わなくちゃいけないのかしら

original: Any advice for a new vampire hunter?
string: 新米の吸血鬼ハンターに助言は？

original: There's only one thing worth remembering.
string: 覚えておく価値がある事はひとつだけだ

original: When it comes to vampires, if you're sloppy or careless, you're dead. And good people will die because of you.
string: 吸血鬼に対処する時の、軽率な行動は死を意味する。君のせいで無実の者が死ぬかも知れない

original: I've lasted this long because I don't take chances, I cover my tracks, and I keep my eyes open. If you're smart, you'll do the same.
string: 私がこれほど長生きできたのは、リスクを冒さず、痕跡を残さず、常に注意を怠らなかったからだ。君が賢明なら、同じ事をすべきだな

original: I knew it would come to this one day. I knew, and no one believed.
string: いつかこうなるのは分かっていた。でも誰もそれを信じようとはしなかったのだ

original: Be on your guard at all times. Avoid sleep if you can... Sleep is for the weak.
string: 警戒を常に怠るなよ。できれば眠らない方がいい… 眠るのは弱者だけだ

original: Even with all my preparations, we can't be too careful. The monsters could strike at us at any moment.
string: できるだけ準備はしたが、念には念を入れないとな。バケモノがいつ襲ってくるか分かったものじゃない

original: The vampires will show us no mercy. They've proven that.
string: 吸血鬼達は容赦なしだぞ。歴史がそれを証明している

original: If we're going to survive this, we're going to have to be as ruthless as our enemies.
string: この戦いを生き抜きたいなら、敵と同じぐらい非情に徹しなければならない

original: Hope you're getting along with Isran. He takes some getting used to.
string: イスランとは、うまくやれてる？ 彼、慣れないうちは難しいタイプだから

original: I like what Isran has done with the place. It's good to see someone else who's really prepared.
string: あそこでは、イスランはいい仕事をしたわね。自分の他にも有事に備えている人がいると分かって嬉しいわ

original: Very few people appreciate all the horrible things that can happen to you if you're not being cautious.
string: 注意が足りないせいで起こる不幸は、大抵の人にとって有難くないものよ

original: There are at least thirty different ways of being attacked and killed in your own home at any given moment.
string: 家の中にいる時も、突然襲われて殺される危険は常に30個以上あるのよ

original: I think we have a better chance of surviving here, don't you?
string: ここでは死なずに済む可能性が高そうじゃない？

original: Cozy little place, isn't this?
string: 居心地のいい場所だな

original: This is fine for now, but we can't stay holed up here forever.
string: 今はいいが、いつまでもここに立てこもってもいられない

original: Our sense of what's right is what separates us from the vampires. Don't forget that.
string: 吸血鬼と我々の違いは何を正しいとするかだ。忘れるな

original: We can't give up. There's no one else to stand against these monsters.
string: あきらめるわけにはいかない。あの化け物達に抗えるのは我々だけだ

original: We'll stop these monsters. We have to; we're the only ones who can.
string: 奴らを止めてみせる。我々がやるしかない

original: Arkay's been watching over me for years now. He says he's not too sure about you yet, though.
string: アーケイは何年も前から、俺を守ってくれている。あんたの事は、まだ分からんと言ってるがな

original: I once killed thirty vampires with my bare hands, you know. Ask Arkay, he'll tell you.
string: 昔、吸血鬼30人を素手で殺した事があるんだ。嘘だと思ったら、アーケイに聞いてみろ

original: Don't you worry about me. I've been through worse. I'll come out of this just fine.
string: 心配するな。もっとひどい状況も生き延びてきたんだ。今度も切り抜けてみせる

original: It is my sworn duty to see Arkay's wrath delivered to all the undead. It's usually a good bit of fun, too.
string: アーケイの怒りがアンデッドを滅ぼすのを見届ける事が使命なんだ。何より楽しいしな

original: How can I help?
string: 何かできる事はあるか？

original: Well met, friend.
string: やあ友よ

original: Arkay be with you, my friend.
string: 友よ、アーケイの加護がありますように

original: What can I do for you?
string: ご用は何だい？

original: Need something?
string: 何か探してるのかい？

original: What is it?
string: 何だ？

original: Is something wrong?
string: 何か問題でも？

original: Got to keep alert. We don't want to get caught napping like the Vigilants did.
string: 用心しないとな。番人達のように寝込みを襲われたらたまらない

original: I don't think the vampires would be stupid enough to attack us here, but you never know.
string: 吸血鬼がここで私達を襲撃するほど愚かだとは思わないけど、どうかしらね

original: I'm glad we're finally taking the fight to those monsters.
string: ついにあの怪物どもに戦いを仕掛けるのか。うれしいな

original: I hope the vampires try to attack us here. A lot easier than hunting them down in their holes.
string: 吸血鬼がここで我々を襲撃するといいのに。穴の中で追跡するよりずっと簡単だ

original: Isran knows how to fight those monsters. He's been preparing for this day for a long time.
string: イスランはあの怪物どもとの戦い方を知っている。長い間この日に備えてきたんだ

original: Now that the Dawnguard are back, the vampires' reign of terror is about to end.
string: ドーンガードが戻った今、吸血鬼の恐怖支配が終わるのも間近だ

original: I was wondering when I'd see you again.
string: いつまた会えるか、気になっていた

original: Here I am. Human as ever.
string: これがわたし。元の人間の姿ですの

original: It's like the world is alive again. Just like me.
string: わたしと一緒に、世界にも生命が戻ったような思いですわ

original: You're not a vampire anymore?
string: 吸血鬼ではなくなったのか？

original: All clean. I feel like I can breathe again for the first time since I was turned.
string: 清々しいですわ。まるで、姿を変えられてから初めて呼吸するような気分

original: The world is alive, and so am I, for once.
string: 世界もわたしも、今は生命に溢れているみたい

original: There you are. I'm... I'm back.
string: あなた。わたし… 還ってまいりましたわ

original: I'll see you when I'm done. For now, I need to just do this.
string: 終わったらすぐ行きますわ。今はこれを済ませてしまいたいの

original: Good luck.
string: 幸運を祈る

original: I'll see you soon.
string: また会いましょう

original: I want to come with you.
string: 一緒に行かせてほしい

original: I know you do, but this is something I need to do alone.
string: 分かっておりますのよ、けれどもこれは一人でやらなくてはいけない事なのです

original: I'll see you again. Soon.
string: また、近いうちに会いましょう

original: What can I do to help?
string: 何か手伝えることは？

original: Sorine needs help with her project to improve our crossbows. And if that doesn't interest you...
string: ソリーヌがクロスボウの改良を手伝ってくれる人を探してる。それに興味がないなら…

original: Speak with Isran. He has something for you.
string: イスランに聞けば、何かあるだろう

original: Speak with Gunmar. He has something for you.
string: ガンマーに聞けば、何かあるだろう

original: Speak with Florentius. He has something for you.
string: フロレンティウスに聞けば、何かあるだろう

original: Speak with Isran. He has something for you.
string: イスランに聞けば、何かあるだろう

original: Speak with Gunmar. He has something for you.
string: ガンマーに聞けば、何かあるだろう

original: Speak with Florentius. He has something for you.
string: フロレンティウスに聞けば、何かあるだろう

original: Speak with Sorine. She has something for you.
string: ソリーヌに聞けば、何かあるだろう

original: Speak with Orthjolf. He has something for you.
string: オースユルフと話すといい。何かあるはずだ

original: Speak with Vingalmo. He has something for you.
string: ヴィンガルモと話すといい。何かあるようだ

original: Speak with Feran Sadri. He has something for you.
string: フェラン・サドリと話すといい。何かあるはずだ

original: Speak with Garan Marethi. He has something for you.
string: ガラン・マレシと話すといい。何かあるだろう

original: Speak with Fura Bloodmouth. She has something for you.
string: フーラ・ブラッドマウスと話すといい。何かあるはずだ

original: And you carried out my instructions to kill the victim in view of others and while wearing the Dawnguard uniform. Very good.
string: ちゃんと指示を守って、ドーンガードの制服を着て人目につくところで殺したんだな。いいぞ

original: But you did not follow instructions to kill the victim in view of others while wearing the Dawnguard uniform.
string: でも指示を守らなかったな。ドーンガードの制服を着て、人目につくところで殺せと言ったはずだ

original: The letter left on the corpse shall have to suffice. It will no doubt be found.
string: まあ、死体に残した手紙が見つかるはずだから、それで十分だが

original: I see you chose a suitably high profile target. Well done.
string: ちゃんと人目につく標的を選んだようだな。よくやった

original: I had hoped you would have chosen a higher profile target. But the deed is done, and it's effect secured.
string: もっと人目につく標的を選べばよかったのに。でも済んだ事を言ってもしょうがない。それに成功は約束されてるしな

original: It is done. I've slain someone on the streets of <Alias=City>.
string: 言われた通りにやった。<Alias=City>の路上で人を殺めた

original: Very good. That should, for a time, direct the people's anger towards the Dawnguard and away from us.
string: よし。これでしばらく人々の怒りの目はこちらから離れてドーンガードに向けられるだろう

original: I heard you might need help.
string: 困っているらしいと聞いた

original: The Dawnguard have increased their operations and have been aggressively recruiting.
string: ドーンガードはその活動範囲を広げ、積極的に構成員を募集している

original: We need to put a damper on their efforts and give those trouble makers something to worry about other than harassing our interests.
string: 奴らの努力に水を差さねばならん。あの厄介者達に悩みの種を植えつけて、我々の利益を害するのをやめさせるんだ

original: You are to make a public show of murdering someone. Do it in the streets for all to see. The higher the profile the better.
string: 君には公衆の面前で誰かを殺してほしい。みんなの目がある大通りでやるんだ。目立てば目立つほど望ましい

original: Make it seem you are a member of the Dawnguard, thus sowing confusion among the herd. Wear this armor and plant this note on the victim.
string: ドーンガードのメンバーになりすまし、大衆を混乱させるんだ。この鎧を着て、それからこのメモを犠牲者の死体に仕込んでおけ

original: The <Alias=Boss> at <Alias=Dungeon> has been dealt with.
string: <Alias=Dungeon>の<Alias=Boss>を片付けた

original: Good job.
string: よくやったわ

original: At first you may pity the thin-bloods. But after disposing of a few, you realize they aren't worth the worry.
string: 最初は血の薄い者達を哀れむかも知れない。でも数人殺した後には、彼らが心配に値しないと分かるわ

original: You have done well.
string: よくやってくれた

original: It may seem cruel that we hold our thin-blooded kin in low esteem. But our needs must come before theirs.
string: 血の薄い同族を蔑むのは残酷に思えるかも知れん。だが彼らより我らの需要が優先されるべきだ

original: What can I do to help?
string: 何か手伝えることは？

original: A bunch of feral vampires are running wild, upsetting the mortals.
string: 野生化した吸血鬼の群れがはびこり、定命の者達を混乱させている

original: When the prey is riled, it makes things difficult for us.
string: 獲物をいら立たせれば、ややこしい事態になるわ

original: Go cull the brutish beasts before the problem gets out of hand.
string: 問題が手に負えなくなる前に、野蛮な獣達を処分してきなさい

original: A cadre of lesser beasts has become a nuisance, taking too bold an approach to their feeding.
string: 劣等なけだものの一味が厄介になってきた。獲物への接近があまりに大胆すぎる

original: The herd is becoming distressed, which makes it more difficult for us to slip in and out undetected.
string: 民衆の動揺がこれ以上続けば、我らが気づかれずに出入りするのがより困難になるだろう

original: It is time to cull the weak.
string: 弱者を処分する時だ

original: I have returned from <Alias=Dungeon> with the <Alias=Remains>.
string: <Alias=Dungeon>から<Alias=Remains>を持ち帰った

original: Wonderful. I'll make the necessary preparations for infusion into the Chalice presently.
string: 素晴らしい。では聖杯に注ぐものをすぐ準備する事にしよう

original: What can I do to help?
string: 何か手伝えることは？

original: I've been performing a little research on the Blood Chalice.
string: 血の聖杯に関してちょっとした研究を続けてきたんだ

original: I believe we can prolong its salutary effects if we infuse it with potent vampiric blood.
string: 吸血鬼の上質な血を聖杯に注げば、その効用を延長させる事ができるはずだよ

original: The potency of the Blood Chalice is beginning to wane. We must infuse it with more power if we are to keep it's fullest effects.
string: 血の聖杯の効果が薄れ始めている。効果を最大限にするには、もっと力の源を注がなければ

original: I've located the petrified remains of an elder vampire. Bring them to me, and I should be able to extend the effects granted by the Blood Chalice.
string: 太古の吸血鬼が石化した遺体の在処を見つけた。遺体を持ってきてくれたら、血の聖杯の効果を延長させる事ができるはずだ

original: I've located additional petrified remains of an elder vampire. Bring them to me, and I'll extend the effects granted by the Blood Chalice.
string: 太古の吸血鬼が石化した遺体の手がかりをまた見つけたぞ。それを持ってきてくれたら、血の聖杯の効果を延長させる事ができるはずだ

original: I have killed the <Alias=Vampire> at <Alias=Dungeon>.
string: <Alias=Dungeon>の<Alias=Vampire>を倒した

original: Good work. It's always best to deal with a problem by ripping it out at the root.
string: よくやったわ。問題は根源を引き裂く事で対処するに限るわね

original: Good. I prefer to nip budding problems before they reach full bloom. I trust it wasn't too much of an effort on your part.
string: よろしい。問題は早めに摘み取っておきたい。お前にとってはさほどの手間ではないだろう

original: What can I do to help?
string: 何か手伝えることは？

original: A feral-blooded has holed up with a group of bandits. Likely wants to create a nest of broodlings.
string: 野蛮な血の者が山賊の一団と一緒に潜伏したわ。おそらく同族の隠れ場所を作りたいのね

original: One of the feral brood has joined a group of bandits, presumably with aims to grant the gift to the entire lot of them.
string: 野蛮な血の者の一人が山賊の一団に加わった。おそらく彼ら全員に血の力を授けるのが目的だ

original: A feral-blooded has holed up with a group of necromancers. Likely wants to create a nest of broodlings.
string: 野蛮な血の者が死霊術師の一団と一緒に潜伏したわ。おそらく同族の隠れ場所を作りたいのね

original: One of the feral brood has joined a group of nercromancers, presumably with aims to grant the gift to the entire lot of them.
string: 野蛮な血の者の一人が死霊術師の一団に加わった。おそらく彼ら全員に血の力を授けるのが目的だ

original: Have to say, I'm pretty impressed.
string: 正直言って、かなり感心した

original: See the Resonators up there? Strike them in the right order, and the doors should open.
string: あそこの共鳴装置が見える？ あれを正しい順番で叩けば、扉は開くはずだよ

original: Get it wrong, and... well. You've seen what happened when I tried it.
string: 間違えれば… ええと。あたしが試した時の結果は知ってるよね

original: See those things in the alcoves up there? 'Kinetic Resonators', the dwarves called them. Strike them in the right order, and the doors should open.
string: あそこのくぼみにあるものが見える？ ドワーフは“動力共鳴装置”と呼んでいるんだ。正しい順番で叩けば、扉は開くはずだよ

original: Get it wrong, and... well. You've seen what happened when I tried it.
string: 間違えれば… ええと。あたしが試した時の結果は知ってるよね

original: I mentioned that there was one more danger. Here it is.
string: もう一つ危険があると言ったよね。これだよ

original: Hold up. We... need to talk.
string: 待って。話す必要が… あるんじゃないかな

original: None of the others ever made it this far.
string: ここまで来られた奴は他にいないよ

original: Quite a place, huh? Was even more impressive before it all fell to pieces.
string: すごい場所だろう？ 崩壊する前はもっと素晴らしかったんだ

original: Damn things are like flies. No matter how many you kill...
string: いまいましい、ハエみたいな奴らだ。いくら殺しても…

original: Take good care of it for me.
string: 大事に扱ってね

original: Hey, there's my bow! There, out on the log. Wondered what happened to it.
string: 見て、あたしの弓だ！ あそこの丸太の上。どうなったかと思ってたんだよ

original: Go on.
string: 続けてくれ

original: The soul of a dragon is as resilient as its owner's scaly hide.
string: ドラゴンの魂は、それを宿すうろこ状の皮と同じぐらい回復力がある

original: It's possible that your killing blow has merely displaced Durnehviir's physical form while he reconstitutes himself.
string: あなたのとどめの一撃は単にダーネヴィールの物理形態を置き換えただけで、復活中の可能性もあるわ

original: What makes you say that?
string: どうしてわかる？

original: Volumes written on Durnehviir allege that he can't be slain by normal means. It appears they were mistaken.
string: ダーネヴィールの記述がある巻では、通常の手段では殺せないと断言している。間違いだったようね

original: Unless...
string: もしくは…

original: What happened to the dragon?
string: ドラゴンはどうなった？

original: Forgive my astonishment, but I never thought I'd witness the death of that dragon.
string: 驚いてごめんなさい、でもあのドラゴンの死を見るとは思いもしなかったの

original: I'll kill Harkon.
string: ハルコンを殺すつもりだ

original: If you believe that, then you're a bigger fool than I originally suspected. Don't you think I weighed that option before I enacted my plans?
string: それを信じるなら、私が当初にらんだよりも上を行く愚か者ね。私が計画を実行する前にその選択肢を考えなかったと思う？

original: I would never allow that to happen.
string: そんなことはさせない

original: And how exactly do you plan on stopping him?
string: では、厳密にはどうやって彼を止めるつもり？

original: And how exactly do you plan on completing the prophecy without the death of my daughter?
string: では、厳密には娘を死なせずにどうやってお告げを実現させるつもり？

original: I would never allow that to happen.
string: そんなことはさせない

original: I've been keeping her safe.
string: 彼女の安全を守る、護衛だ

original: Safe? You call bringing her here safe? Has she explained nothing to you?
string: 安全？ 彼女をここへ連れてきて安全だと言うの？ 彼女は何も説明しなかった？

original: Coming from one who murders vampires as a trade, I find it hard to believe your intentions are noble.
string: 吸血鬼殺しを職業とする者から出る言葉として聞けば、あなたの意図が高潔だとは信じがたいわ

original: This is no ruse. I want to keep her safe.
string: だますつもりはない。彼女を守りたいだけだ

original: Mother!
string: お母様！

original: You. Come forward. I would speak with you.
string: あなた。こちらへ来なさい。話しましょう…

original: No, you don't...
string: そんな、違いますわ…

original: Wait a moment... you've brought a stranger here? Have you lost your mind?
string: ちょっと待って… よそ者をここへ連れてきたの？ 正気なの？

original: No, you've got it all wrong. We're here to stop him... to make everything right.
string: 違いますわ、そうではありませんの。わたし達は父を止めるために… すべてを正すためにここへ来ましたのよ

original: No, you've got it all wrong. We're here to complete the prophecy our way, not his.
string: それは誤解ですわ。お父様のやり方ではなく、わたし達なりのやり方で予言を成就させるために来ましたのよ

original: I must have failed. Harkon's found a way to decipher the prophecy, hasn't he.
string: 失敗したに違いないわ。ハルコンはお告げの解読方法を見つけたのね

original: He doesn't know we're here. I don't have time to explain.
string: わたし達がここにいるのをお父様は知りませんわ。説明している時間はありませんの

original: Serana? What are you doing here? Where's your father?
string: セラーナ？ ここで何をしているの？ あなたの父親はどこ？

original: Is it really you? I can't believe it!
string: 本物ですの？ 信じられませんわ！

original: How do we get inside? We have to talk.
string: どうすれば中に入れますの？ 話がありますのよ

original: Is it really you? I can't believe it!
string: 本物なの？ 信じられないわ！

original: You wanted to speak with me?
string: 話があると聞いた

original: So how has it come to pass that a vampire of mixed blood is in the company of my daughter?
string: それで、吸血鬼の血が入った者がなぜ私の娘に同行する事になったの？

original: So how has it come to pass that a vampire hunter is in the company of my daughter?
string: それで、吸血鬼ハンターがなぜ私の娘に同行する事になったの？

original: It pains me to think you'd travel with Serana under the guise of her protector in an effort to hunt me down.
string: あなたが私を捜し当てるために保護者を装ってセラーナと旅した… そう考えると胸が痛むわ

original: Did you have anything to ask before you depart?
string: 出発の前に何か聞く事はあった？

original: What did you want?
string: 用件はなに？

original: Idiot! I can't get to the scroll with Durnehviir attacking us!
string: 馬鹿者！ ダーネヴィールに攻撃されながら書を手に入れる事はできないわ！

original: Focus on the dragon!
string: ドラゴンに集中して！

original: The Elder Scroll is just a bit further.
string: 星霜の書はあとほんの少し先よ

original: Only a single spire remains. Be careful, I'm almost certain the final Keeper will be prepared for your assault.
string: 残りは尖塔一つだけよ。慎重にね。最後の番人があなたの襲撃に備えているのはほぼ確実よ

original: You're doing well, but two of the spires remain intact.
string: いい調子ね、でもまだ二つの尖塔が手つかずのままよ

original: If you want that scroll, the barrier needs to come down.
string: 書がほしければ、障壁を崩す必要があるわ

original: The sooner we get the scroll home, the sooner we deal with my father.
string: 早く書を持ち帰る事ができましたら、それだけ早く父と決着をつけられますのよ

original: I'm glad we found the scroll, but I... I wish she could come with us.
string: 書が見つかったのは嬉しいですわ、でも… 母にも一緒に来てほしかった

original: Come on, let's go home.
string: さあ、帰りましょう

original: Kill that beast!
string: あいつを殺して！

original: We have to keep my mother alive!
string: お母様を守りますのよ！

original: Come on, she's leading us to the scroll.
string: 行きましょう。母が書の在りかまで案内して下さいますわ

original: The barrier should be gone now. Let's head back.
string: これで障壁は消えたはずですわ。戻りましょう

original: Let's kill those... Keeper things and get back to the prison.
string: さあ… 番人どもを片づけて、牢屋へと戻りましょう

original: The sooner we get out of this place, the better.
string: できるだけ早くここから出た方がよろしくてよ

original: I'm glad you're here. I don't think I could be doing this alone.
string: あなたがいてくれてよかった。独りでは無理だったと思いますの

original: I can't believe we found my mother alive... well, you know what I mean.
string: 生きている母に会えたなんて信じられませんわ… この気持ち、お分かりいただけて？

original: Look at this place. I can't imagine choosing to come here. My mother must have been terrified.
string: ご覧になって。好きこのんでこんな所に来る人なんておりますかしら？ 母は無理強いされたに違いありませんわ

original: Let's keep moving. I feel like we're being watched.
string: 先に進みましょう。誰かに見張られてる気がいたしますの

original: I'd heard stories about the Soul Cairn, but never thought I'd see it myself. So far it's... about what I imagined.
string: ソウル・ケルンの事は話に聞いていましたけれど、この目で見る事になるとは思いませんでしたわ。今のところは、おおむね想像した通りの場所ですわね

original: Look at the sky. What kind of a place is this?
string: 空をご覧になって。ここは一体どういう場所なの？

original: I feel terrible for the dead who end up here for eternity. Seems awful. Like they're still suffering.
string: こんな所で永遠に過ごさなければならないと思いますとお寒いですわね。死んだあとも苦しみが続いてるようなものですわよ

original: You'd think a vampire would be right at home in this place. You'd be wrong. Let's just find my mother and get out of here, quickly.
string: 吸血鬼にはかえって居心地がよさそうですって？ それは誤解ですわ。とにかく早いところ母を探し出してここからおさらばしましょう

original: The air, the ground... this is all wrong.
string: 空気も、地面も… 何もかも間違ってますわ

original: It is done. <Alias=Spouse> has been welcomed into the family.
string: <Alias=Spouse>が血を分けた家族となった

original: Excellent. I trust she'll find her situation more accommodating, now that she is a member of the family.
string: 素晴らしい。彼女は今や家族の一員だから、肩の荷も少しはおりるだろう

original: Excellent. I trust he'll find his situation more accommodating, now that he is a member of the family.
string: 素晴らしい。彼は今や家族の一員だから、肩の荷も少しはおりるだろう

original: You'll need to trust me. The family is safer this way.
string: 信じてほしい。こうした方が家族は安全だ

original: I see... I... I understand. Thank you
string: ああ… 分かった。ありがとう

original: Hello.
string: やあ

original: I... I feel... different. What happened?
string: 違う… 感じがする。何が起きた？

original: May I strongly suggest that you make a visit to this spouse of yours and "invite" her to the family by offering her Harkon's Gift.
string: 君の伴侶を訪問して、彼女を家族に“招待”する事を強く勧めるよ。ハルコンの贈り物を彼女に捧げるんだ

original: It is the greatest token we can bestow upon those we love and wish to see protected.
string: 我々が愛し守るべき者達に捧げられる最高の贈り物をね

original: Put her mind to rest, allay her fear through vampiric seduction and when she is in a pliant condition, embrace her and bite her on the neck.
string: 彼女の心を落ち着かせて、吸血鬼の誘惑でその恐れを鎮める。そして彼女が従順になったら、抱きしめて首筋に噛みつけばいい

original: Nature will take care of the rest.
string: その後は自然の成り行きに任せるんだ

original: May I strongly suggest that you make a visit to this spouse of yours. And "invite" him to the family by offering him Harkon's Gift.
string: 君の伴侶を訪問して、彼を家族に“招待”する事を強く勧めるよ。ハルコンの贈り物を彼に捧げるんだ

original: It is the greatest token we can bestow upon those we love and wish to see protected.
string: 我々が愛し守るべき者達に捧げられる最高の贈り物をね

original: Put his mind to rest, allay his fear through vampiric seduction and when he is in a pliant condition, embrace him and bite him on the neck.
string: 彼の心を落ち着かせて、吸血鬼の誘惑でその恐れを鎮める。そして彼が従順になったら、抱きしめて首筋に噛みつけばいい

original: Nature will do the rest.
string: その後は自然の成り行きに任せるんだ

original: I understand the concern.
string: 理解できる懸念だ

original: Good. I suspected you might possess some intellect.
string: いいね。君に知性があるのか疑ってたよ

original: You try my patience, <Alias=QuestGiver>.
string: 我慢の限界を試されている気分だ、<Alias=QuestGiver>

original: My sincerest pardons, I but look after your own peace of mind.
string: 悪いね、でも君の心の平穏って奴が気になったんだ

original: Why, you would be distraught with emotion, perhaps even to the point of questioning your loyalty to this Court. And we ours to you.
string: 君は感情を抑えきれず取り乱すだろう。もしかしたらこの宮廷への忠誠が揺らぐかも知れない。そして我々は君の心変わりを疑うというわけだ

original: An unattended attachment, such as found in your beloved wife creates... an opportunity for unnecessary agitation.
string: 君の愛する奥さんもしっかりつなぎとめておかないと… 余計な考えを起こす者が現れるかも知れない

original: Should your blushing bride go missing, perhaps unable to bear the thought of living with a... a monster...
string: 清らかな君の花嫁がいなくなったらどうする？ 一緒に住むのが耐えられなくなって… その… バケモノとね

original: An unattended attachment, such as found in your beloved husband creates... an opportunity for unnecessary agitation.
string: 君の愛する旦那さんも、しっかりつなぎとめておかないと… 余計な考えを起こす者が現れるかも知れない

original: Should your husband go missing, perhaps unable to bear the thought of living with a... a monster...
string: 夫がいなくなったらどうする？ 一緒に住むのが耐えられなくなって… その… バケモノとね

original: Yes. I am married.
string: ああ、結婚している

original: Marriage is a fine institution, however, one that does present certain difficulties for such as like ourselves.
string: 結婚とは素晴らしい慣習だが、確かに問題もある。我々の場合もそうだが

original: And that's any of your business because... ?
string: そちらに関係のある話なのか？

original: Do I detect a hint of reproach? I am only looking out for your best interests. And perhaps, a small measure of my own.
string: もしかして気に食わないのかな？ 君のためを思っての事だが… まあ、ちょっとは私のためでもあるけど

original: What can I do to help?
string: 何か手伝えることは？

original: It's come to my inescapable attention that you, my dear friend, are married.
string: 友よ、君は結婚してるね。私の目はごまかせないよ

original: Now, this Chalice needs to be filled directly from the bloodspring that is the source of Redwater Den. But that's not enough.
string: さて、この聖杯はレッドウォーターの隠れ家の水源である血の泉から直接満たす必要がある。だがそれだけではない

original: Once that's done, the blood of a powerful vampire needs to be added to it.
string: それが済んだら、強力な吸血鬼の血をそこに加えなければならない

original: Keep in mind that Redwater Den has fallen into... well, let's just say less reputable members of society now dwell there.
string: 覚えておけ、レッドウォーターの隠れ家は… まあ、社会であまり信頼できん者達のすみかになっているとだけ言っておこう

original: It's your choice whether to attempt to deal with them or force your way through.
string: そいつらを相手に取引してみるか、強引に突破してみるかは自由だ

original: Hurry back. You don't want to keep Lord Harkon waiting.
string: 急いで戻れ。ハルコン卿を待たせたくはないだろう

original: And here we are.
string: さあ着いたぞ

original: Well, then...  Best of luck to you.
string: そうか… なら幸運を祈る

original: Indeed. He's off to Redwater Den.
string: いかにも。彼はレッドウォーターの隠れ家へ向かった

original: Indeed. She's off to Redwater Den.
string: いかにも。彼女はレッドウォーターの隠れ家へ向かった

original: Really?
string: 本当か？

original: Our friend here has been ordered to fill the Chalice.
string: この友人が聖杯を満たすよう命じられた

original: Lord Harkon's orders, Orthjolf. Calm yourself.
string: ハルコン卿のご命令だ、オースユルフ。落ち着け

original: What're you up to, Garan?
string: 何を考えてる、ガラン？

original: The Chalice? Why?
string: 聖杯が？ なぜだ？

original: Excuse us. I need to fetch the Bloodstone Chalice.
string: 失礼。ブラッドストーンの聖杯を取ってこなければ

original: Lord Harkon has never cared to use the Chalice, relying on his more than adequate powers until now.
string: ハルコン卿は自分のあり余る力を当てにして、今まで一度も聖杯を使おうとしなかった

original: This is an intriguing change.
string: 興味深い変化だな

original: I have a message from Harkon.
string: ハルコンからの伝言がある

original: Lord Harkon. Remember your place.
string: ハルコン卿。立場をおわきまえに

original: Now, what is our Lord's wish?
string: さあ、我らが主は何をお望みで？

original: And I suppose you're the one Tolan says is actually doing something about this mess.
string: 君がこの惨状を何とかしてくれるらしいな。トランから聞いたが

original: These Vigilants are nothing but talk.
string: ここの番人達は口先だけなんだ

original: I trust your journey was successful?
string: 旅はうまくいったのかな？

original: It's good to see you again.
string: また会えて光栄だよ

original: Yes, how may I serve you, milord?
string: 旦那様、ご用は何ですか？

original: Yes, how may I serve you, milady?
string: 奥様、ご用は何ですか？

original: I am but your humble servant, milord.
string: 旦那様、私はあなたの忠実なしもべです

original: I am but your humble servant, milady.
string: 奥様、私はあなたの忠実なしもべです

original: Explain this "ritual."
string: その“儀式”について説明してほしい

original: Just get to it!
string: 細かいことはいいから早く！

original: Normally, the study of a scroll's meaning can take months or even years. Even then, there are no guarantees.
string: 書の解読には通常数ヶ月、時には数年を要する。だが時間をかけたからといって成功は保証されていない

original: This is generally performed at the Imperial Library, but as history has shown us, that isn't always possible.
string: 解読作業は主に帝国図書館で行われるが、歴史を見れば分かるように、それが不可能な場合もあるんだ

original: Scattered across Tamriel are secluded locations known only as Ancestor Glades. There's one in Skyrim, in the Pine Forest.
string: タムリエルのあちこちには、先人の湿地と呼ばれる人里離れた場所が存在している。スカイリムにおいては、パイン・フォレストにその一つがある

original: Performing the Ritual of the Ancestor Moth within the glade should provide the answers you seek.
string: その湿地内で聖蚕の儀式を行えば、探している答えが見つかるだろう

original: It involves carefully removing the bark from a Canticle Tree which will in turn attract Ancestor Moths to you.
string: それにはカンティクルの木から樹皮を慎重にはがす作業が含まれる。そうする事によって聖蚕が集まってくるんだ

original: Once enough of the moths are following, they'll provide you with the second sight needed to decipher the scrolls.
string: 聖蚕が十分集まれば、書の解読に必要な第二の視覚を身につける事ができる

original: In keeping with tradition, you must use a specific tool in the Ancestor Glade, an implement known as a Draw Knife.
string: 伝統に従って、ドローナイフと呼ばれる特別な道具を先人の湿地で使用するんだ

original: Every Moth Priest is taught this ritual, but few ever get the chance to perform it... you should consider yourself fortunate if it works for you.
string: 聖蚕の僧侶はみんなこの儀式について教わるが、実行する者はほとんどいない… うまくいったら幸いだよ

original: From what I saw in the vision, the Elder Scroll which foreshadows the defiance of the gods with the blood of mortals is the key to the prophecy.
string: 私が見たものから判断すると、定命の者の血による神への反逆を予兆する星霜の書が、予言の根幹となるはずだ

original: Go on.
string: 続けてくれ

original: Oh thank you, milord. Thank you!
string: 旦那様… ありがとうございます！

original: Oh thank you, milady. Thank you!
string: 奥様… ありがとうございます！

original: Then we have no further need of you.
string: ならばもう用済みだ

original: Although I would gladly die by your hand, perhaps I could offer an alternative way to read the scrolls?
string: あなた様の手にかかって死ぬのは本望ですが、書を読む別の方法をできれば教えて差し上げたいです

original: I don't suppose there's a cure.
string: 治療する方法はないんだろうな

original: If only such a miracle existed, I'd overcome the impossible in order to secure it if it meant pleasing you.
string: そんな奇跡が起こせるなら、不可能を可能にしてあなた様を喜ばせるのに…

original: You're blind!
string: 目が見えないのか！？

original: Oh please, milord. Please... forgive me!
string: 旦那様、お願いです… お許しを！

original: Oh please, milady. Please... forgive me!
string: 奥様、お願いです… お許しを！

original: What are you talking about?
string: 何の話をしてるんだ？

original: I'm afraid in my haste to read the first scroll, I neglected the time I needed to prepare. The failure is purely mine to bear.
string: 最初の書を早く読みたくて、ちゃんとした準備を怠ったのです。自業自得ですよ

original: As you can see from my bandages, it's not that I'm unwilling, it's that I'm physically unable.
string: この包帯を見ればお分かりだと思いますが、やりたくないのではなくできない体なんです

original: I've brought the Elder Scrolls.
string: 星霜の書を持ってきた

original: I'm afraid I won't be able to help you with the scrolls any longer, milord.
string: 旦那様、書の件に関してはもうお手伝いできそうにありません

original: Please, don't be angry with me.
string: お怒りにならないで下さい

original: I'm afraid I won't be able to help you with the scrolls any longer, milady.
string: 奥様、書の件に関してはもうお手伝いできそうにありません

original: Please, don't be angry with me.
string: お怒りにならないで下さい

original: Explain this "ritual."
string: その“儀式”について説明してほしい

original: Don't worry about that. Just tell me.
string: それはいいから、聞かせてほしい

original: What do I need to do?
string: 何をすればいい？

original: I can't guarantee you'd be free from harm. Becoming blind could be the least of your worries.
string: 君に危害が及ばない保証はない。何も見えなくなるのは、心配事の中でも一番ましな方かも知れないよ

original: Then we're finished.
string: ならばおしまいだ

original: No, there's another way. The question is, how much are you willing to risk to find Auriel's Bow?
string: いや、他にも方法はある。問題は、アーリエルの弓を見つけるために君がどれだけの危険を冒せるかだ

original: Can anything be done to help you?
string: 助けられる方法は何かないのか？

original: No. It'll have to run its course, and there's always the chance I may never recover.
string: いや、運命には逆らえないだろう。それに回復不能になるのは常にありうる話だ

original: That covering on your eyes. Are you-
string: その目隠しのようなもの、まさか…

original: Blind? Yes. I'm afraid so.
string: 目が見えない？ 残念だがその通りだ

original: Why? What's happened?
string: どうして？ 何があった？

original: It's my fault. In my haste to read the first scroll, I neglected the careful preparation required.
string: 失敗したんだよ。最初の書を早く読みたくて、ちゃんとした準備を怠ったんだ

original: I thought I'd be able to allay the after effects, but I was wrong. Now I'm paying for it.
string: 後遺症を和らげる事ができると思ったが、それは間違いだった。自業自得だよ

original: I've brought the Elder Scrolls.
string: 星霜の書を持ってきた

original: I'm sorry, my friend. I can no longer be of use in this matter.
string: 悪いがこの件に関してはもうお役に立てないよ

original: Welcome to the politics of Lord Harkon's court.
string: ハルコン卿の宮廷の政略争いへようこそ、だな

original: Vingalmo and Orthjolf both long for our Lord's throne, but cannot make overt moves against him.
string: ヴィンガルモとオースユルフは我らの主の玉座を切望している。だが露骨な行動は取れない

original: Each sought to gain power by using his underling to kill you and keep the Chalice for himself.
string: ゆえにそれぞれが手下を使ってお前を殺し、聖杯を自分のものにして政権を握ろうとした

original: By ensuring the Chalice reaches our Lord, you have increased his power over them, and at the same time deprived them of their little pets.
string: お前は我らの主へ聖杯を確実に届ける事で、彼らに対する主の支配力を強め、同時に彼らの小さなペットを剥奪した

original: You've done Lord Harkon two great services. Take what you've learned to heart, and be careful who you trust.
string: つまりお前はハルコン卿へ二つの大きな貢献をしたのだ。学び得た事を肝に銘じ、信頼する相手は慎重に選べ

original: Now, I believe that Lord Harkon wishes to speak with you.
string: さて、ハルコン卿がお前と話したがっている事だろう

original: I killed them both.
string: 両方とも手にかけた

original: As well you should have.
string: お前もそうするべきだった

original: They tried to kill me!
string: 殺されそうになった！

original: Well of course they did.
string: 彼らは当然そうした

original: I see you have returned. Lord Harkon will be pleased.
string: 戻ったようだな。ハルコン卿はお喜びになるだろう

original: You met Stalf and Salonia, I assume? Lord Harkon and I suspected they might follow you there.
string: スタルフとサロニアには会ったな？ ハルコン卿と自分は彼らがお前の後を追うと思っていた

original: Vingalmo and Orthjolf are Harkon's primary advisors. I'm sure they're quite surprised to learn that you're taking the Chalice.
string: ヴィンガルモとオースユルフはハルコンの第一の相談役だ。お前が聖杯を受けると聞けばさぞ驚くだろう

original: Well that's just fine. Orthjolf told me to finish off anyone who got in the way.
string: 大丈夫だ。オースユルフは邪魔する奴全員を始末しろと言っていた

original: Idiot. You didn't really think I'd let you walk out of here either, did you? Vingalmo wants you both dead.
string: ばかね。ここから立ち去らせるはずがないでしょう？ ヴィンガルモは二人両方の死をお望みよ

original: Wait, what? That's not what we agreed. We take it back together.
string: ちょっと待った… 何だって？ 話が違うぞ。一緒にそれを取り戻すはずじゃないか

original: We're just lucky I was here to return the Chalice to Vingalmo, so he could make sure Harkon gets it back.
string: ハルコンが確実に聖杯を取り戻せるよう、私がヴィンガルモへ返しに来ていたのは単なる幸運よ

original: Yeah, too bad. Lord Harkon's new favorite, dead so soon after joining the family.
string: ああ、残念だね。ハルコン卿の新しいお気に入りが、家族の一員になってそんなにすぐ死んでしまったなんて

original: It's really too bad, you know. The little accident you had here, completely unexpected...
string: 本当に残念ね。ここで起きた、完全に予想外のささいな出来事が…

original: I've destroyed the <Alias=Vampire> at <Alias=Dungeon>.
string: <Alias=Dungeon>の<Alias=Vampire>を倒した

original: Excellent. That's one less beast and nest of broodlings we needn't worry about any longer.
string: 素晴らしい。これで危険な化け物一家を一つ減らせたわけだな

original: We need to destroy him before he turns his comrades into a brood of vampires.
string: 仲間達を吸血鬼の一団に変えてしまう前に仕留める必要がある

original: He's holed up with a group of a bandits.
string: 山賊の一団と共に立てこもっている

original: He's holed up with a group of a necromancers.
string: 死霊術師の一団と共に立てこもっている

original: What can I do to help?
string: 何か手伝えることは？

original: I've found another beast hiding from the light of day.
string: 日の光から隠れている化け物をまたしても見つけた

original: The <Alias=Boss> at <Alias=Dungeon> has been destroyed.
string: <Alias=Dungeon>の<Alias=Boss>を倒した

original: Very good, though I suspect there's more wherever he came from.
string: うまくいったな。もっとも、奴の仲間がまだまだいそうだが

original: We cannot afford to relax.
string: 気を抜いている余裕はない

original: What can I do to help?
string: 何か手伝えることは？

original: I've discovered the whereabouts of a vampire lair.
string: 吸血鬼の巣窟の位置を特定した

original: Destroying the head vampire is usually sufficient to scatter its minions, though it's best to destroy every last one of them.
string: 大抵は頭目格の吸血鬼を倒せば手下どもは四散するが、最後の1体まで根絶やしにするのが最善ではある

original: I've killed the vampire masquerading as a <Alias=Target>.
string: <Alias=Target>になりすましている吸血鬼を倒した

original: Very good. That's one less monster we need to worry about.
string: よし。悩みの種の化け物を1体減らせたな

original: Though there's plenty more where he came from. Be ever watchful.
string: 仲間はまだ大勢いるはずだ。気を抜くなよ

original: What can I do to help?
string: 何か手伝えることは？

original: I've located the whereabouts of a vampire masquerading as a common citizen.
string: 一般市民になりすましている吸血鬼の居場所が判明した

original: Track him down and dispose of him.
string: その男を追い詰めて始末してくれ

original: Tread lightly. The law is unaware of the danger and will treat you as a criminal if you are caught.
string: 行動は隠密にな。司法側はこの危険に気づいていないため、見られたら罪人扱いだ

original: This is the power that I offer!
string: この力が手に入るのだぞ？

original: Now, make your choice!
string: さあ、選ぶがいい！

original: Have you decided? I am not a patient man.
string: 決めたのか？ 私は決して気の長い男ではない

original: We usually feed on our visitors, but perhaps we'll make an exception in your case.
string: 大抵の訪問者は糧とするのだが、お前の場合は例外としてやってもいいかも知れんな

original: After so many centuries, I feared the Elder Scroll and my daughter were lost to me.
string: 何百年もの時が過ぎ、私は星霜の書と娘は二度と戻って来ないのではないかと恐れた

original: You have brought my daughter back safely, and for that I am grateful.
string: 娘を無事に連れ戻してくれた事には感謝している

original: Unnnhhhh...
string: ウウウン…

original: You wanted to speak to me?
string: 話があると聞いた

original: Yes, I did. When I told you that I was grateful for my daughter's safe return, I told the truth. But I did not tell you everything.
string: そうだな。娘が無事に戻って感謝している、というのは事実だ。だがその先がある

original: Are you going to help?
string: 手を貸してくれるか？

original: Well, I certainly can't help any less than the Vigilants of Stendarr, now can I?
string: まあ、私もステンダールの番人とそれほど変わりはないがな。そうだろう？

original: Yes, I've been aiding Tolan.
string: ああ、トランに協力してきた

original: It certainly seems the Vigilants of Stendarr can't help themselves. No surprise there.
string: ステンダールの番人は手詰まりのようだな。あの体たらくでは驚くに値しないが

original: So, it is real...
string: 本物なんだね…

original: Well, don't just stand there!
string: ほら、突っ立ってないで！

original: Goodbye
string: それでは

original: I think I could use your help.
string: 手を貸してもらえないか

original: What is it now?
string: 今度は何？

original: Was there something else?
string: 他に何かあった？

original: Well, go on! What are you waiting for?
string: さあ、ほら！ 何を待っているの？

original: This one's mine!
string: これはあたしのものだよ！

original: Come on!
string: かかっておいで！

original: Here we go...
string: 行くよ…

original: I've destroyed the <Alias=Vampire> at <Alias=Dungeon>.
string: <Alias=Dungeon>の<Alias=Vampire>を倒した

original: For those who cherish memories of loved ones, their compassion often conceals the beast.
string: 愛する者の想い出を大事にする者の思いやりこそが、化け物を隠す一助となっている事がしばしばある

original: Our compassion compels us to destroy it.
string: 我らの思いやりは、その化け物を退治してやる事だ

original: Perhaps you care to explain this letter then?
string: この手紙について説明してもらいたい

original: I see you've already taken it upon yourself to gather the information you seek.
string: 求める情報は自分で集める責任を引き受けたらしいね

original: Where'd you say this vampire was hiding?
string: 例の吸血鬼の潜伏先はどこだったか？

original: That letter's the last I've heard of him and mentions where he is. Now please, leave me alone.
string: あれが彼から届いた最後の手紙だ。居場所が書いてある。さあ、もう一人にしてくれ

original: That letter's the last I've heard of her and mentions where she is. Now please, leave me alone.
string: あれが彼女から届いた最後の手紙だ。居場所が書いてある。さあ、もう一人にしてくれ

original: I'll get rough with you if I have to.
string: 必要ならば実力行使もいとわない

original: All right, calm down... Here, take this.
string: 分かった、落ち着いて… さあ、これを

original: I'll get rough with you if I have to. (Intimidate)
string: 必要ならば実力行使もいとわない(威圧)

original: You don't scare me. Let's go.
string: 脅しは必要ない。行こう

original: I'll get rough with you if I have to. (Brawl)
string: 必要ならば実力行使もいとわない(殴り合い)

original: You don't scare me.
string: 脅しには乗らない

original: I'll get rough with you if I have to. (Intimidate)
string: 必要ならば実力行使もいとわない(威圧)

original: Perhaps some coin will jog your memory? (<BribeCost> gold)
string: 金銭が少々あれば、思い出してもらえるかな？(<BribeCost> ゴールド)

original: Well... we weren't the closest of friends... Here, take this.
string: まあ… 親友でもなかったしな… さあ、これを

original: Afraid my memory can't be bought with what you've got there.
string: 悪いけどそこに持っているものでは記憶がよみがえらないな

original: Make this easier for you, tell me what I want to know. (Persuade)
string: 聞きたいことを話してくれた方が楽だぞ(説得)

original: All right... Here, take this.
string: 分かった… これをどうぞ

original: Like I said. I don't know what you're talking about.
string: 言ったろう。何の話か分からないね

original: I'm looking for a vampire.
string: 吸血鬼を探している

original: I don't know what you're talking about.
string: 何の話か分からないな

original: What can I do to help?
string: 何か手伝えることは？

original: I've learned of a possible monster.
string: 隠れおおせている化け物がいるらしいと聞きつけた

original: And while I do not know its exact whereabouts, I do have information suggesting someone who does.
string: 正確な居場所は知らないが、知っているであろう人物の手がかりは得ている

original: Pay a visit to the beast's last known contact. Do what you must to find where it's hiding now.
string: 奴が最後に会ったと分かっている人物を訪ね、どこに隠れているかをどうにかして聞き出すんだ

original: Then root out the monster, and destroy it.
string: その上で、化け物を追い詰めて倒せ

original: I'll have to think about it.
string: 考えさせてくれ

original: Indeed. It is no small thing to submit yourself to the flesh sculptor's knife.
string: そうよね。肉体改造医のナイフに身を委ねるのは容易ではないわ

original: Are you sure you know what you're doing?
string: 自信をもってやっているのか？

original: I have not always been a ragged beggar. I learned my art from the masters of the art of flesh sculpture.
string: ずっとみすぼらしい物乞いだったわけじゃない。肉体改造の達人から技術を教わったのよ

original: I studied with the Faculty of Chirurgeons in Cloudrest. I walked with the Hollow-Faced Men of Nohotogrha for three years.
string: クラウドレストの外科教授陣に学んだわ。ノホトグラの穴あき顔男どもと三年間一緒に過ごしながら

original: I count the nobility of both the Empire and the Dominion among my clients.
string: 私は帝国と自治領両方の貴族を顧客としているの

original: And yet, I have fallen so low that I must justify myself to a wanderer in the sewers of this backwater of the world.
string: それでもこれほど落ちぶれたからには、世界の果ての下水道に住む放浪者を自称せざるを得ないわね

original: Yes, I'd like you to change my appearance. (<Global=DLC1SurgeryCost> gold)
string: 外見を変えてくれ(<Global=DLC1SurgeryCost> ゴールド)

original: Hmm. Very well. Just tell me what you desire - beauty or hideous deformity, nothing is beyond my skill.
string: ふーん。結構よ。望みを教えて… 美か、恐ろしい変形か。私の技術で不可能な事はないわ

original: Despite my present low estate, I am no beggar. Begone until you have the coin to warrant my skills.
string: 今の地位が低くとも、物乞いではないわ。私の技術を受けられる現金ができるまで消えなさい

original: Why, are you interested in my services? I warn you, my skills do not come cheaply.
string: あら、私の仕事に興味があるの？ 言っておくけど、私の技術は安くないわよ

original: I do not practice my art for free, however. I doubt you can afford my services. You have the smell of the vagabond about you.
string: ただし、無料では施術しないわよ。支払えるとは思えないわ。あなたからは放浪者の匂いがするもの

original: I understand you know how to change someone's appearance.
string: 人の外見を変える技を知っていると聞いた

original: Change it? I can remake your face, if that's what you desire.
string: 変えるの？ お望みなら、あなたの顔を作り直せるわよ

original: This is true, but my techniques only work on the living. You've chosen a different path to remake yourself.
string: これは本当よ、でも私の技術は生者にしか使えない。あなたは自分を作り変える別の道をすでに選んだ

original: Heard anything about a moth priest passing through?
string: 聖蚕の僧侶が立ち寄ったとかいう話は？

original: My business is my own. Just tell me what I need to know.
string: こちらの問題だ。質問に答えるだけにしてくれ

original: The College of Winterhold seems like a good place to start.
string: ひとまずはウィンターホールド大学に向かうべきか

original: I'm not afraid of you!
string: お前なんか怖くないぞ！

original: If you think I'll help you, you're mistaken.
string: 手を貸してもらえると思ってるならそれは間違いだ

original: Your kind are a blight upon Tamriel, monster!
string: お前らはタムリエルの破滅の元凶だ。バケモノめ！

original: What is your command?
string: ご命令は？

original: Greetings, master. What do you need?
string: 主様、ご用は何ですか？

original: Ah, you are here. Good.
string: おお、来たのか。よいぞ

original: Excuse me, but I must address the court.
string: 後にしろ。臣下達に下達をせねばならんのでな

original: Well done! Somehow I knew it would be you and Serana who found our moth priest.
string: 上出来だ。聖蚕の僧侶を見つけるのはお前とセラーナだろうと、何故か確信があったのだ

original: That was... not as useful as I would have liked. Even so, you did well.
string: どうもあれは… 期待していたほど有用ではなかったな。それでも上出来には変わらない

original: What are you waiting for? Get out there and find a moth priest!
string: 何を待っている？ 出かけていって聖蚕の僧侶を探すのだ！

original: I think my father wanted to see you. Have you talked to him yet?
string: 父があなたに会いたがっていたと思いますけれど、もう話はいたしましたの？

original: I have ordered the court to assemble. I have a new task for us all to carry out, and that includes you.
string: 臣下の者達に集まるよう指示した。我々全員でなすべき事がある。お前を含めてな

original: Come now, and hear my proclamation.
string: さあ、我が宣言を聞くがいい

original: How will vampires gain power over the sun?
string: 吸血鬼がどうやって太陽を司るつもりなのか？

original: I don't know yet. The Moth Priest died before finishing the transcription, but he did name the Elder Scrolls that contained the prophecy.
string: まだ分からん。聖蚕の僧侶は写本を終える前に死んでしまったが、予言が書かれた星霜の書の名は記されていた

original: The scroll you found with Serana is one of those scrolls of prophecy. Now that it is back within my grasp, we can read the scroll and learn more.
string: セラーナがもっていた星霜の書は予言が書かれたものの一つだった。我が手中に戻ったので内容を確かめられる

original: As you know, vampires are powerful, but we have limits. Our great enemy is the sun, and until recently it's an enemy we've had no way to fight.
string: 知っての通り、吸血鬼は強大な力をもつが、限界もある。最大の敵は太陽であり、最近までは戦う術のない相手だった

original: For centuries I searched for an answer to this problem. I found an old prophecy written by a Moth Priest, those scholars who read the Elder Scrolls.
string: 私は何世紀もこの問題の解決方法を探してきた。そして星霜の書を読んだという学者達、聖蚕の僧侶の一人が記した古い予言を発見した

original: The prophecy tells of a time in which vampires will gain power over the sun, and will no longer fear its tyranny.
string: 予言には吸血鬼達が太陽をも制し、その横暴を恐れなくなる時代について書かれていた

original: I believe the secret to unraveling that prophecy is written in Serana's Elder Scroll.
string: その予言の真実を突き止める鍵となる秘密が、セラーナの星霜の書に書かれているようなのだ

original: Scions of the night! Hear my words!
string: 夜の末えい達よ！ 我が言葉を聞け！

original: The prophesied time is at last upon us. Soon we will claim dominion over the sun itself, and forge a new realm of eternal darkness.
string: 予言の時がようやく訪れた。我々は程なくして太陽そのものを支配し、永遠の闇に覆われた新たな領域を作り出す事となるであろう

original: Now that I have reclaimed one of my Elder Scrolls, we must find a Moth Priest to read it.
string: 今ここに星霜の書の一つを取り戻せた、ゆえに聖蚕の僧侶を見つけて読ませる必要がある

original: I have spread false rumors about the discovery of an Elder Scroll in Skyrim to lure a Moth Priest here.
string: 聖蚕の僧侶をおびき寄せるため、スカイリムで星霜の書が発見されたとの偽の噂を流しておいた

original: Now it is time to see if those efforts have borne fruit. Go forth, and search the land for rumors of a Moth Priest within our borders.
string: その努力の甲斐があったかどうかを見てみなければならん。各地に足を運び、領域内に聖蚕の僧侶が来ていないか噂を確かめるのだ

original: Look to the cities. Speak to innkeepers, carriage drivers, anyone who would meet a traveler.
string: 街に行き、宿屋の主人、馬車の御者、旅人に出会いそうな者達と話してこい

original: Go now, and carry out this task. This is my command!
string: お前に命ずる。行け、そして使命を果たせ！

original: I need to find a Moth Priest.
string: 聖蚕の僧侶を探している

original: Does he have the Scroll? Is everything ready?
string: 書は彼が持っているな。準備は万全なのか？

original: For the reading? Yeah. Just let the old man know when you're ready.
string: 解読のために？ そうか。では準備ができたらこの年寄りに教えてくれ

original: It's important that I find him right away. (Persuade)
string: すぐにその彼を見つけないといけない(説得)

original: Heard anything about a Moth Priest passing through?
string: 聖蚕の僧侶が立ち寄ったとかいう話は？

original: Where is he now?
string: 今はどこに？

original: Know anything about a Moth Priest visiting Dragon Bridge?
string: 聖蚕の僧侶がドラゴン・ブリッジに立ち寄ったとかいう話は？

original: Know anything about a Moth Priest visiting Dragon Bridge?
string: 聖蚕の僧侶がドラゴン・ブリッジに立ち寄ったとかいう話は？

original: Know anything about a Moth Priest visiting Dragon Bridge?
string: 聖蚕の僧侶がドラゴン・ブリッジに立ち寄ったとかいう話は？

original: Know anything about a Moth Priest visiting Dragon Bridge?
string: 聖蚕の僧侶がドラゴン・ブリッジに立ち寄ったとかいう話は？

original: You can find us at Fort Dawnguard, near Stendarr's Beacon.
string: 我々はステンダールの灯近くのドーンガード砦にいる

original: Very well. I'll hurry on my way there before more of those vampires turn up.
string: 分かった。吸血鬼達がぞろぞろ現れる前にすぐそこに向かおう

original: We're called the Dawnguard. We're fighting a vampire conspiracy.
string: 我々はドーンガード。吸血鬼らの陰謀と戦っている

original: We're called the Dawnguard, and we need you to read an Elder Scroll.
string: 我々はドーンガードという。読んでもらいたい星霜の書がある

original: You have an Elder Scroll? Remarkable!
string: 星霜の書を持ってるのか？ すごいじゃないか！

original: If my knowledge of history serves me, I recall that the Dawnguard was an ancient order of vampire hunters.
string: 私の歴史観が確かなら、ドーンガードは吸血鬼ハンター達が集ういにしえの組織だったはずだ

original: I will be happy to assist you with your Elder Scroll. Just tell me where I need to go.
string: 星霜の書の事なら喜んで協力するよ。行くべき場所があればどこだろうと言ってくれ

original: Now tell me, whom do you represent, and what do you want with me?
string: さて、教えてくれ。君は誰の使いで私に何の用があるんだ？

original: Are you alright?
string: 大丈夫か？

original: I'm quite alright, thanks to you. Dexion Evicus is my name. I'm a Moth Priest of the White Gold Tower.
string: 君のおかげで大丈夫だよ。デキソン・エヴィカス… 白金の塔の聖蚕の僧侶だ

original: These vampires claimed they had some purpose in store for me, but they wouldn't say what. Probably hoping to ransom me, the fools.
string: この吸血鬼達は私に対して何か企んでると言ってたが、詳しくは語らなかった。おそらく身代金目当てだろう。愚か者どもめ

original: Are you prepared to read the Elder Scroll?
string: 星霜の書を読む用意はできているか？

original: Oh, most certainly! Let's find out what secrets the scroll can tell.
string: もちろんだとも！ 書に隠された秘密を探ろうじゃないか

original: Have my companions made you feel welcome?
string: 仲間たちが歓迎してくれたか？

original: It's not exactly the hospitality I'm used to, but your man Isran has seen to my needs well enough.
string: こういうおもてなしには不慣れだが、君の友達のイスランはとてもよくしてくれているよ

original: And might I add, this is a remarkable fortress. I have colleagues back home that would love to study this place in detail.
string: それにしても、ここは素晴らしい砦だね。故郷の仲間にも是非ともじっくり見せてやりたいよ

original: Glad you made it here safely, Dexion.
string: 無事に辿り着いてくれて何よりだ、デキソン

original: Ah, my rescuer! It's good to see you again.
string: おや、私の救世主じゃないか！ また会えてうれしいよ

original: I must rest now. The reading has made me weary.
string: 休息が必要だな。書を読んだせいでクタクタだよ

original: Come on, old man. You should get some rest.
string: ご老体よ。少々休んだ方がいいぞ

original: I'm back from <Alias=Dungeon> with the <Alias=Item>.
string: <Alias=Dungeon>から<Alias=Item>を持ち帰った

original: You're back and alive to boot! Fantastic.
string: 生きて戻ってくるなんて、素晴らしいわ！

original: Ooh, good. I was just starting to get bored.
string: わあ、素敵。待つのに退屈してたところよ

original: Let's see what you've got there.
string: 見せてちょうだい

original: Back already? Can't wait.
string: もう戻ってきたの？ 早く見せて

original: You never disappoint. What've you got there?
string: 期待を裏切らないわね。何を見つけたの？

original: We've been so terribly fortunate. I can't wait to see what's in these drawings.
string: 最高にツイてるわ。この図面に何が描かれてるのか、早く確認したい

original: I think even Gunmar's been impressed with what we've managed to do with the Dwemer drawings. Let's see what we can do with these ones!
string: ドゥーマーの図面から作り出したものには、あのガンマーでさえ驚いたはずよ。今度はどんな発見があるのかしら！

original: What can I do to help?
string: 何か手伝えることは？

original: I want to add some punch to our crossbow capabilities, I've done all I can on my own. I need a little inspiration.
string: クロスボウの威力を改良したいんだけど、思いつく事は全部試してしまったの。何か新しいアイデアがほしいのよ

original: I've always been fascinated with Dwemer artifacts. I take them apart, poke around in their guts, and try to figure things out - with mixed results.
string: ドゥーマーの造った物には、いつも驚かされるわ。分解して、中の部品をいじり回して調べるんだけど、うまく理解できる事ばかりじゃないの

original: But as luck would have it, I've tracked down the location of some actual Dwemer diagram drawings!
string: でも、ツイてる事に、ドゥーマーの描いた設計図そのものがある場所を突き止めたの！

original: So, if you'd be a dear and collect those plans for me?
string: その図面を持ってきてもらえたら、助かるんだけど？

original: I've got more leads on additional Dwemer plans.
string: 新しいドゥーマーの設計図の手がかりを掴んだの

original: Those last ones helped me immensely. If you could collect this one for me, it's sure to result in extraordinary success!
string: 前に見つかった分は、すごく役に立ったわ。また見つけてきてくれたら、驚きの成果が挙げられると思うの！

original: Ready for more? I certainly am.
string: 次を探してきてくれる？ 待ちきれないわ

original: Be a dear and fetch me another set of Dwemer diagrams?
string: 他のドゥーマーの設計図も持ってきてくれないかしら？

original: It's amazing what I'm able to learn from studying these Dwemer plans.
string: ドゥーマーの図面から学べる事は計り知れないわ

original: Want to head out there and collect some more?
string: 他の図面も探してきてくれる気はない？

original: I'm starting to think you like this as much as I do!
string: あなたも楽しくなってきたんじゃない？

original: Here's the location of the next set of Dwemer diagrams. Thanks!
string: 次のドゥーマーの図面がある場所はここよ。お願いね！

original: Alright! One more set of dwemer plans to go.
string: さて！ ドゥーマーの図面も、残り1組よ

original: Think I'll be sad when we're done collecting these. Who knows though, maybe more plans will turn up in the future.
string: 全部集まったら、寂しくなると思うわ。また将来他の図面がどこかで見つかるかも知れないけどね

original: But I can't wait to see these drawings. Go on, get out of here!
string: それでも、最後の図面を早く見てみたいわ。さあ、行ってきて！

original: I've located more dwemer plans.
string: 新しいドゥーマーの図面のある場所が分かったの

original: Be a dear and collect these diagrams for me?
string: 図面を探してきてくれないかしら？

original: Finish them!
string: 奴らを殺せ！

original: An impressive display, but a wasted effort. You delay nothing but your own deaths!
string: いい態度だ。しかし、死ぬのが少し遅くなるだけだ！

original: Did you really come here expecting to claim Auriel's Bow?
string: ここに来ればアーリエルの弓が手に入ると、本気で思ったのか？

original: You've done exactly as I predicted and brought your fetching companion to me.
string: 確かにお前は言った通りの仕事を終え、魅力的な人物を連れ帰ってきた

original: Which, I'm sorry to say, means your usefulness is at an end!
string: つまり、お前はもう用済みだという事だ！

original: You're welcome.
string: どういたしまして

original: You risked everything to get Auri-El's Bow, and in turn, you've restored the Chantry.
string: すべてを投げ打ってアーリエルの弓を手に入れ、礼拝所を立て直してくれた

original: I can't think of a more deserving champion to carry it than you.
string: これだけの手柄を挙げられる勇者は他にいないだろう

original: If you wish to learn more about the bow, or obtain Sunhallowed Arrows for it, I'd be more than happy to help. You've but to ask.
string: あの弓の事が知りたい時や、あの弓で使う太陽神の矢がほしい時は、いつでも言ってくれ。喜んで力になろう

original: The Betrayed weren't to blame.
string: 裏切られし者のせいではなかった

original: What? What are you talking about?
string: 何だって？ 何を言ってるんだ？

original: So, the deed has been done.
string: 為すべき事が為されたのだな

original: The restoration of this wayshrine means that Vyrthur must be dead and the Betrayed no longer have control over him.
string: この祠が再建されたという事は、ヴィルスールは死に、裏切られし者に操られる事もなくなったわけだ

original: What will happen to you now?
string: そちらはこれからどうする？

original: Even with Vyrthur gone and the Inner Sanctum destroyed, my duty as a Knight-Paladin of Auri-El remains.
string: ヴィルスールまでもが連れ去られ、最奥聖域が破壊された今でも、アーリエルの騎士司祭としての使命は続いている

original: I've been sworn to protect this vale and everything it represents until I die.
string: 命が尽きるまで、この峡谷とここにまつわるすべてを守り抜かねばならない

original: What is the Chantry of Auri-El?
string: アーリエルの礼拝所とは？

original: This is, or was, the epicenter of our religion. Most of the snow elf people worshipped Auri-El.
string: ここは我らの信仰の中心地だった。ほとんどのスノーエルフはアーリエルを信じていたのだ

original: The Chantry was constructed near the beginning of the First Era to provide a retreat for those that wished to become enlightened.
string: 悟りを開こうとする者達が集まる場所としてこの礼拝所が造られたのは、第一紀の始めの事だ

original: Why weren't the snow elves here affected?
string: ここにいるスノーエルフが影響を受けていないのは？

original: The Chantry is quite isolated, so it took some time for word of the dwarves' offer to reach us here.
string: 礼拝所は周囲から孤立していて、ドワーフからの申し出がここに届くには時間がかかった

original: By the time the compact had been completed, it was too late for us to even attempt to intervene.
string: 盟約が成立した頃には、すでに我々が手出しできない状況だったのだ

original: That's why I'm here for the Elder Scroll.
string: だからこそ星霜の書を探しに来た

original: You think I'd have the audacity to place my own daughter in that tomb for the protection of her Elder Scroll alone?
string: 私が娘を、彼女の星霜の書を守るためだけにあの墓へ置くほど厚かましいと思う？

original: The scrolls are merely a means to an end. The key to the Tyranny of the Sun is Serana herself.
string: 書は目的達成の手段にすぎない。太陽の専制への鍵はセラーナ自身よ

original: It's important that I find him right away. (Persuade)
string: すぐにその彼を見つけないといけない(説得)

original: Where is he now?
string: 今はどこに？

original: Who were your people?
string: 同族について聞かせてほしい

original: We were once a wealthy and prosperous society that occupied a portion of Skyrim.
string: 我が同胞はかつて、スカイリムの一部を支配する豊かで高貴な種族だった

original: Unfortunately, we were constantly at war with the Nords who claimed the land as their ancestral home.
string: しかし悲しい事に、ここが祖先の土地だと主張するノルドとの間で戦争が絶えなかった

original: What do you do?
string: どんな仕事なんだ？

original: So are you here as a client? Shall I remake your face?
string: それで、顧客として来たの？ 顔を作り変えましょうか？

original: But, my techniques only work on the living, not those that have crossed over into undeath.
string: でも、私の技術は生者にしか使えない。アンデッドへ足を踏み入れた者には無理よ

original: You must be the face sculptor I've heard about.
string: 話に聞いた顔面改造医か

original: Yes. I once practiced my art in the salons and manors of Tamriel's great and good. Now, the scum of Skyrim are my only clients.
string: ええ。かつてはタムリエルの名士達のサロンや邸宅で施術していたわ。今では、スカイリムのクズが唯一の顧客よ

original: But no matter. The greatest artists are never recognized in their own time.
string: でも関係ないわ。最も偉大な芸術家は決して生前には認められないものよ

original: What are you talking about?
string: 何の話をしてるんだ？

original: I assumed you were here to see me about your face. To have it sculpted into something more... artful than Nature has bestowed upon you.
string: 自分の顔の件で私に会いに来たんでしょう。何かもっと… 自然が授けたよりも技巧的な顔へ改造するために

original: What do you want?
string: 何をすればいい？

original: Hmm, I suppose I can work with your face. After all, the sculptor cannot always choose the finest clay.
string: ふむ、あなたの顔を何とかできそうね。結局、彫刻家がいつも最高の土を選べるわけじゃないもの

original: What have you done to yourself? I can't work with you in this state, night-walker.
string: 自分に何をしたの？ この状態では取り扱えないわよ、ナイトウォーカー

original: Take my advice, don't listen to that talk of the "face sculptor" down in the Ragged Flagon. "Face butcher" is more like it from what I've heard.
string: 忠告するわ、ラグド・フラゴンにいる“顔面改造医”の話は聞いちゃだめよ。聞いた限りでは、むしろ“顔面破壊屋”の方が近いわ

original: People say there's someone in Riften that can... change your face. Make you look completely different. Do you believe that?
string: うわさではリフテンに… 顔を変えられる者がいるらしい。外見を完全に変えるんだ。信じられるか？

original: Are you saying Harkon means to kill her?
string: ハルコンは彼女を殺すつもりだと？

original: If Harkon obtained Auriel's Bow and Serana's blood was used to taint the weapon, the Tyranny of the Sun would be complete.
string: もしハルコンがアーリエルの弓を手に入れて、セラーナの血で武器を染めれば、太陽の専制は完成する

original: In his eyes, she'd be dying for the good of all vampires.
string: 彼の考えでは、彼女はすべての吸血鬼のために死ぬ事になる

original: My business is my own. Just tell me what I need to know.
string: こちらの問題だ。質問に答えるだけにしてくれ

original: I need to find a Moth Priest.
string: 聖蚕の僧侶を探している

original: You'll also want to find Gunmar. Big brute of a Nord, hates vampires almost as much as I do.
string: ガンマーも見つけた方がいいな。冷酷なノルドの巨漢で、私と同じぐらい吸血鬼を憎んでいる

original: Got it into his head years back that his experience with animals would help. Trolls in particular, from what I hear.
string: 数年前から動物との触れ合いが大事だと信じるようになってな… 特にトロールとの交流が重要らしい

original: Last I knew he was out scouring Skyrim for more beasts to tame.
string: 最後に消息を聞いた時は、飼い慣らす野獣をさらに求めてスカイリムを探索していたとの事だ

original: Bring the two of them back here, and we can get started on coming up with a plan.
string: 彼ら二人をここに連れてくるんだ。計画を立てるのはそれからになる

original: She'll help us?
string: 協力してくれるのか？

original: Might need a little convincing, but she should.
string: 多少説得は必要だが、彼女にはそうすべきだな

original: Where can I find the people we need?
string: 必要な面々はどこに？

original: Right to the point, aren't you. I like that. Not like those fools in the order.
string: 短刀直入だな。好ましい事だ。教団の能なしどもとは大違いだよ

original: We should keep it small. Too many people, and we'll draw unwanted attention to ourselves.
string: 集団の規模は小さい方がいい。人が多すぎると余計な注目を浴びてしまう

original: I think we'll want Sorine Jurard. Breton girl, whip-smart and good with tinkering. Fascination with the Dwemer. Weapons in particular.
string: ソリーヌ・シュラルドを仲間にしよう。手先が器用でとても賢いブレトンの娘だ。ドゥーマーの文化に魅せられていて、特に彼らの武器への興味があるらしい

original: Last I knew, she was out in the Reach, convinced she was about to find the biggest dwarven ruins yet.
string: 最後に消息を聞いた時は、彼女はリーチにいた。ドワーフの最大の遺跡を発見できると見込んでいたようだ

original: If they're bold enough to attack us here, then this may be bigger than I thought. I have good men here, but...
string: 奴らが大胆にもここを襲撃するなら、状況は思ってたより悲観的だな。ここにも優れた人材はそろっているが…

original: There are people I've met and worked with over the years. We need their skills, their talents, if we're going to survive this.
string: ここ何年かの間に私が知り合い協力し合った人々がいる。この状況を切り抜けるには、彼らの技術と才能が必要だ

original: If you can find them, we might have a chance.
string: 君が彼らを見つけてくれたなら、我々にも勝算が立つかも知れない

original: We have to do something.
string: 何とかしなければ

original: Well of course we do. I'm old, not stupid.
string: もちろんやっている。私は年寄りだが愚か者ではない

original: We're just going to need some help.
string: ただ、我々には助けの手が必要なんだ

original: So you're just going to give up?
string: あっさりあきらめるのか？

original: When did I say that?
string: そんな事をいつ言った？

original: We just need... we need help.
string: ただ… 我々は助けを必要としているだけだ

original: I warned them. I knew something like this would happen eventually. But they didn't listen, and look where it's gotten them.
string: 彼らには警告したんだ。今回のような事態がいつか起こる事は分かっていたからな。でも彼らは警告に耳を傾けなかった。そしてご覧の有り様だよ

original: This attack... it's unlike the vampires. Do we at least know what they were after, or is this completely a lost cause?
string: 今回の襲撃は… どうも吸血鬼らしくない。我々は少なくとも奴らの狙いが分かっているのか？ それともこれはまったく勝ち目のない戦いなのか？

original: Oh, Serana. If you'd only open your eyes.
string: ああ、セラーナ。どうか目を覚まして

original: The moment your father discovers your role in the prophecy, that he needs your blood, you'd be in terrible danger.
string: あなたの父がお告げの中のあなたの役割に、あなたの血が必要な事に気づいた瞬間に、恐ろしい危険にさらされるのよ

original: So to protect me you decided to shut me away from everything I cared about?
string: でしたら、わたしを守るために好きなものを一つ残らず取りあげたっておっしゃいますの？

original: You never asked me if hiding me in that tomb was the best course of action, you just expected me to follow you blindly.
string: あのお墓にわたしを隠す事が最善の方法と、何一つ教えもしないで、ただ黙って言う通りにすればいいとでも思っていたのではなくて？

original: Both of you were obsessed with your own paths. Your motivations might have been different, but in the end, I'm still just a pawn to you, too.
string: お父様もお母様も自分の道を譲らなかった。理由はたぶんそれぞれ違っていたのでしょうけど、結局は二人ともわたしをただの道具としか見ておりませんのよ

original: How dare you! I gave up everything I cared about to protect you from that fanatic you call a father!
string: よくもそんな事を！ あなたが父と呼ぶ狂信者から守るために、すべてを諦めたのよ！

original: This "stranger" has done more for me in the brief time I've known him than you've done in centuries!
string: その“よそ者”の彼は、お母様が何世紀もの間にしてくれた以上の事を、わずかな間にしてくれましたのよ！

original: This "stranger" has done more for me in the brief time I've known her than you've done in centuries!
string: その“よそ者”の彼女は、お母様が何世紀もの間にしてくれた以上の事を、わずかな間にしてくれましたのよ！

original: This stranger aligns himself with those that would hunt you down and slay you like an animal, yet I should entrust you to him?
string: このよそ者はあなたを追いつめて動物のように殺す者達と手を組んでいるのよ。それなのにあなたを預けるべきだと？

original: This stranger aligns herself with those that would hunt you down and slay you like an animal, yet I should entrust you to her?
string: このよそ者はあなたを追いつめて動物のように殺す者達と手を組んでいるのよ。それなのにあなたを預けるべきだと？

original: This stranger may call himself vampire, but he knows nothing of our struggle. Why should I entrust you to him?
string: このよそ者が吸血鬼を名乗ったとしても、私達の苦悩を何一つ知らないのよ。どうしてあなたを任せられる？

original: This stranger may call herself vampire, but she knows nothing of our struggle. Why should I entrust you to her?
string: このよそ者が吸血鬼を名乗ったとしても、私達の苦悩を何一つ知らないのよ。どうしてあなたを任せられる？

original: We'll return soon.
string: すぐに戻る

original: One more word of warning. There's a dragon that calls itself Durnehviir roaming the Cairn. Be wary of him.
string: もう一つ警告するわ。ダーネヴィールと名乗るドラゴンがケルンをうろついている。用心して

original: The Ideal Masters have charged him with overseeing the Keepers, and will undoubtedly intervene if you're perceived as a threat.
string: アイディール・マスターに、番人を監視する任務を負わされているの。あなたを脅威と感知すれば間違いなく邪魔に入るはずよ

original: What do we need to do?
string: 何をすればいい？

original: You need to locate the tallest of the rocky spires that surround these ruins.
string: この遺跡を囲む岩のような尖塔のうち一番高いものを探す必要があるわ

original: At their bases, the barrier's energy is being drawn from unfortunate souls that have been exiled here.
string: その根元では、ここに追放されてきた不運な魂から障壁のエネルギーを吸収しているの

original: Destroy the Keepers that are tending them, and it should bring the barrier down.
string: それを見張っている番人達を倒せば、障壁は崩れるはずよ

original: What is your decision?
string: どう判断するんだ？

original: Your intentions are still somewhat unclear to me.
string: あなたの意図はどこか不透明なままだわ

original: But for Serana's sake, I'll assist you in any way that I can.
string: でもセラーナのために、どんな手段を使っても支援するわよ

original: I'll meet you back there.
string: 戻って向こうで合流しよう

original: Hey... we did pretty well for ourselves here. Good work.
string: なかなかうまくできたんじゃないかしら。お見事ね

original: I'll take this one back to the castle.
string: これは城に持って帰っておくわ

original: This will put my father in a great mood. You should come enjoy it while it lasts.
string: これで父は上機嫌になるはずよ。曇らないうちが花だけど

original: Off the northern coast of Skyrim, due west of Solitude.
string: スカイリムの北海岸、ソリチュードのほぼ西…

original: I'll set out at once, then.
string: 直ちに出発します

original: I command you to travel to Castle Volkihar.
string: ヴォルキハル城に行け

original: Certainly. Where can I find this castle?
string: もちろんです。その城はどこにあるのですか？

original: By the divines! It's as if my eyes have been opened! I am blinded by the light of your majesty. I... I must obey you.
string: おお、神々よ！ 覚醒とはこの事です！ あなた様の威光の強さで目が見えない… ご用を何なりと

original: What would you have of me, master?
string: 主様、ご用は何ですか？

original: Hello.
string: やあ

original: Help!
string: 助けて！

original: My love! I knew you'd come for me! I just knew it!
string: 愛しの君よ！ やっぱり来てくれたな！ 思った通りだ！

original: You came for me? How did you know? I thought I was going to die in here. Thank you!
string: 助けに来てくれたのか？ なぜ分かったんだ？ ここで死ぬと思ったよ。ありがとう！

original: Don't worry about me, I'll be fine!
string: 心配しないで、大丈夫だ！

original: I've rescued <Alias=Prisoner> from <Alias=Dungeon>.
string: <Alias=Prisoner>を<Alias=Dungeon>から救出した

original: I know! Arkay told me of your success!
string: やっぱり、やってくれたな！ アーケイの言った通りだ！

original: Arkay's never clear on life and death. Is she still alive? There's always hope...
string: アーケイは生や死をはっきり言わない。彼女は生きてるのか？ まだ希望はあるはずだ…

original: Arkay is so hard to understand when it comes to life and death. Is he still alive? There's always hope...
string: 生や死に関しては、アーケイの言葉は分かりにくい。彼は生きてるのか？ まだ希望はあるはずだ…

original: A vicious night stalker rules over a group of bandits - seeks to gain leverage over the righteous.
string: 夜の闇に住む邪悪な者が山賊を率いて、善良な人々の世界を脅かしている

original: A vicious night stalker rules over a group of necromancers - seeks to gain leverage over the righteous.
string: 夜の闇に住む邪悪な者が死霊術師の集団を率いて、善良な人々の世界を脅かしている

original: Your wife, kidnapped!
string: 奥さんが、さらわれた！

original: Your husband, kidnapped!
string: 旦那さんが、さらわれた！

original: Your friend, kidnapped!
string: 友達が、さらわれた！

original: What can I do to help?
string: 何か手伝えることは？

original: Arkay has some grave news, friend.
string: アーケイから悪い報せが届いたんだ

original: I've destroyed the vampire in the Jarl of <Alias=Capital>'s court.
string: <Alias=Capital>の首長の特別顧問に紛れていた吸血鬼を始末した

original: Good. Maybe now they'll afford the vampire threat a tad bit more respect, eh?
string: よし。これで彼らも吸血鬼の脅威を少しは真剣に考えるだろう

original: What can I do to help?
string: 何か手伝えることは？

original: The Jarl's in danger. A vampire plays as a visiting "advisor" to the court. Destroy it before it's able to complete its foul business.
string: 首長に危険が迫っている。吸血鬼が1匹、宮廷で“特別顧問”の地位に就いているんだ。奴の汚い企みが完遂する前に、始末してほしい

original: But be warned. The Jarl's guards are unaware of the threat, and will treat violence against this "advisor" as a crime.
string: だが注意しろよ。首長の衛兵達はその企みに気づいていない。もし“特別顧問”に危害を加えようとしたら、それは犯罪行為とみなされるだろう

original: Convince the Jarl of the threat and he'll let you destroy the creature. If not, then do your best not to get caught.
string: まずは吸血鬼の脅威を首長に知らせる事だ。そうすれば堂々と奴の首をとれる。それが無理なら、捕まらないよう最善を尽くせ

original: Quickly now! The longer you delay, the more danger the Jarl is in.
string: 急ぐんだ！ ぐずぐずしてたらそれだけ首長の身の危険は大きくなるぞ

original: You are in danger. A vampire has infiltrated your court.
string: 吸血鬼が宮廷の一員になりすましているため、危険だ

original: That's quite a bold claim. I'd need proof before I could possibly accept it.
string: かなり大胆な要求だな。たとえ受け入れるとしても、その前に証拠が必要だ

original: Well... I trust you'll take care of this unwanted visitor. My guards will not interfere with you carrying out my justice.
string: なるほど… この招かれざる客を処理してくれるな。お前が私の正義を執行するのに衛兵は干渉しない

original: You are in danger. A vampire has infiltrated your court. (Give letter)
string: 吸血鬼が宮廷の一員になりすましているため、危険だ(手紙を渡す)

original: Are you able to give us the scroll now?
string: これで星霜の書をもらえるのか？

original: Yes. Please, follow me.
string: ええ。お願い、ついてきて

original: Keep watch for Durnehviir. With the prison's barrier down, he's almost certain to investigate.
string: ダーネヴィールに警戒して。牢獄の障壁が壊れた今、調査しに来るのはほぼ確実よ

original: You managed to destroy all three Keepers? Very impressive.
string: 三人の番人をすべて倒したの？ 本当に見事だわ

original: You hate him that much?
string: そこまで憎んでいるのか？

original: You must understand that he's no longer the man I married all that time ago.
string: 彼はもう、私がずっと昔に結婚した男ではない事を理解してちょうだい

original: He's obsessed... insane. Everyone around him fears him as they would a rabid dog.
string: 彼は取りつかれて… 正気を失っているわ。周囲の皆が、狂犬を恐れるように彼を恐れている

original: For all of this to end, he must die.
string: このすべてを終えるには、彼が死ぬしかない

original: And if Harkon failed?
string: ハルコンがしくじった場合は？

original: The only way I'd even consider returning to Tamriel was if Harkon were not only to fail, but to be destroyed.
string: タムリエルへの帰還を検討するとすれば、その唯一の道はハルコンが失脚するだけでなく、死ぬ事よ

original: You said "even if I could." Why?
string: “たとえできたとしても”、というのはどういう意味だ？

original: Like Serana, I am a Daughter of Coldharbour, an vampire offspring of Molag Bal.
string: セラーナと同じく、私もコールドハーバーの娘。モラグ・バルの吸血鬼の子孫よ

original: My presence in Tamriel would simply double the risk that Harkon could complete the prophecy.
string: 私がタムリエルに存在すれば、ハルコンがお告げを実現する危険を倍増するだけ

original: Why don't you come back with us?
string: 我々と一緒に戻ってはどうだ？

original: Even if I could, it would only serve to hinder your efforts.
string: たとえできたとしても、あなたの努力の妨げにしかならないわ

original: Harkon would likely sense my return to Tamriel. The last thing you need right now is a trail for him to follow.
string: おそらくハルコンは私のタムリエルへの帰還に感づく。今、彼にその跡を追わせる事だけは避けるべきよ

original: We're not sure, but they have an Elder Scroll.
string: 確証はないものの、彼らは星霜の書を持っているようだ

original: By the Eight...
string: なんて事だ、八大神よ…

original: All right, look. I'll consider it, but I can't just leave this bear to prey on more innocent people.
string: よし、分かった。一考はする、だがあのクマにこれ以上無実の人々を襲わせるわけにもいかない

original: Once it's dealt with, then perhaps I'll see what Isran expects of me.
string: あれを退治できたら、イスランに耳を貸してやってもいい

original: By the Eight...
string: なんて事だ、八大神よ…

original: All right. I'll hear out Isran, see if there's anything I can do to help.
string: 分かった。イスランの言い分を聞いて、力になれるかどうか考えよう

original: Where do you expect me to go?
string: どこに行けばいいのだ？

original: We're up against vampires.
string: 敵は吸血鬼だ

original: Vampires?
string: 吸血鬼だと？

original: That... well, that might change things.
string: そうか…それなら話が変わってくるな

original: Tell me more about what's going on.
string: 何が起きているのか、聞かせてくれ

original: Isran needs your help.
string: イスランが力を借りたがっている

original: Isran? Needing someone else's help? Never thought I'd hear that.
string: あのイスランが？ 他人に助けを求めるだと？ 前代未聞だな

original: I'm afraid he's a few years too late. I've moved on. I have more important business to attend to.
string: 数年前に言ってくれればな。あいにく新しい暮らしに移ってしまって、外せない用事がある

original: Besides, he can handle anything alone! He assured me so himself. What could he possibly need my help with?
string: だいたい、自分でどうとでもできるだろう！ 奴からそう言われたよ。助力がほしくなるほど、困るような事があるのか？

original: You there, hold fast!
string: そこのお前、待て！

original: I've tracked this damned bear for two weeks; I'll not let it have any more victims.
string: あのくそったれなクマをもう2週間も追い続けている。これ以上犠牲を出させてたまるものか

original: We're meeting at Fort Dawnguard.
string: ドーンガード砦で合流予定だ

original: Ah. Been working more on his secret hideout, has he? It'll be interesting to see how much progress he's made.
string: ああ、ずっと秘密の隠れ家で仕事してたのね？ どれだけ進んだか、見るのが楽しみだわ

original: I'll finish up here and head in that direction soon as I can. See you there.
string: できるだけ早くここを終らせて、そっちへ向かうわ。後で会いましょう

original: All right. If nothing else, I suppose it wouldn't hurt to learn more about what's going on so I can better defend myself.
string: 分かった。どうしてもというなら、状況を詳しく知って自分を守るために、行ってみてもいいわよ

original: But I'm not just going to abandon what I've been working on here. It's too useful. I need at least one intact dwarven gyro.
string: でもね、ここでの仕事を放り出す事はできないの。とても役立つはずだから。それには傷のないドゥーマーのジャイロが必要だわ

original: So either I need to find the satchel those mudcrabs stole, or I need another gyro from someplace. You wouldn't happen to have one, would you?
string: つまり、マッドクラブに盗まれた袋を探し出すか、代わりのジャイロを手に入れなくちゃいけないという事。あなたは持ってない？

original: We're not sure, but Isran is concerned.
string: わからないが、イスランが気にかけているようだ

original: In case you haven't noticed, Isran is always concerned about something. That's what got us working together in the first place.
string: 気づいてるかも知れないけど、イスランは常に何かを気にかけてるの。私達が協力して働けるのは、それが理由よ

original: Still, if he sent you to find me, it may actually be pretty bad.
string: それでも、あなたをここによこしたという事は、状況は悪いみたいね

original: They have an Elder Scroll.
string: 星霜の書の一つを手にしているようだ

original: I... Well, that's actually something I never would've anticipated. Interesting.
string: うーん… それは少しも予想していなかったわ。興味深いわね

original: I'm not sure what they would do with one, but in this case Isran is probably correct in thinking it isn't good.
string: 彼らがどうするつもりか知らないけど、この場合はイスランが正しいと思う。つまり、良くないって事

original: Vampires threaten all of Skyrim. We need your help.
string: 吸血鬼がスカイリム全土を脅かしている。力を貸してほしい

original: Vampires? Really?
string: 吸血鬼？ 本当なの？

original: Oh, and I suppose now he remembers that I proposed no less than three different scenarios that involved vampires overrunning the population.
string: そういえば、吸血鬼が人口の大多数を占めるようになるまでのシナリオを何通りも提示した事があるけど、今は信じてくれてるんでしょうね

original: Well, what are they up to?
string: それで、今の状況は？

original: You had a falling out?
string: 仲違いしたのか？

original: Yes, that was my point. I felt it was rather clear.
string: そう、そういう事よ。単純明快だと思うけど

original: Look, what is it you want from me?
string: それで、そっちの要求は何なの？

original: Isran asked me to find you.
string: イスランに言われて訪ねに来た

original: Isran? Wants me?
string: イスランが？ 私に？

original: No, you must be mistaken. He made it exceedingly clear the last time we spoke that he had no interest in my help.
string: きっと何かの間違いだわ。前に話した時、手助けは必要ないとはっきり言われたもの

original: I find it hard to believe he's changed his mind. He said some very hurtful things to me before I left.
string: 彼の気が変わったとは思えない。ひどく傷つくような事まで言われたのよ

original: Anyway, I'm quite happy in my current pursuits. So if you'll excuse me...
string: とにかく、私は今の仕事に満足してるから。じゃあ、失礼…

original: I understand that, but I really can't leave here without at least one usable piece of dwarven equipment.
string: それは分かったけど、ドワーフの道具が1つでも作れなければ、ここを離れるわけにはいかないわ

original: A single gyro would be enough, I think. Believe me, this is useful stuff.
string: ジャイロがたった1つあればいいはずよ。それで本当に役立つものができるの

original: Isran and I still need your help.
string: イスラン共々、まだ手を貸してほしいと思っている

original: If Isran is really asking for me, it must be serious. I'll help. Where do you need me to go?
string: イスランが私を必要としているなら、かなり深刻な事態ね。手を貸さなくちゃ。どこへ行けばいいの？

original: So you'll help us?
string: 手を貸してくれると？

original: You haven't seen a sack full of dwarven gyros lying around, have you? I'd swear I left it right here.
string: この辺りに、ドゥーマーのジャイロが入った袋はなかった？ 確かにここに置いたんだけど

original: Do you think mudcrabs might've taken it? I saw one the other day... Wouldn't be surprised if it followed me here.
string: マッドクラブに取られたのかしら？ この前、見かけたから… あの時、ここまでついて来たのかも知れないわ

original: Just look around, will you?
string: ちょっと、辺りを見てきてくれない？

original: Do you know where these other scrolls are?
string: 他の星霜の書のありかは？

original: My traitor wife stole one of them away and then disappeared.
string: 妻が私を裏切り、その一つを盗み出して行方をくらました
