original: As for the other, the last that I heard, it was lost in the bowels of a Dwemer ruin.
string: もう一方については、最後に聞いた話ではドゥーマーの廃墟で失われたとの事だ

original: It seems our work is not yet done. But I have waited this long, and we are so very close now. I can wait a bit longer.
string: まだやるべき事があるようだな。だがこうも長い間待たされ、あと一歩となったのであれば、もう少しくらいは待ってもいいだろう

original: Then you may begin your reading.
string: 解読を始めてほしい

original: Of course, master.
string: もちろんです、主様

original: You must read an Elder Scroll.
string: 星霜の書を読んでもらいたい

original: Ah, yes, the Elder Scroll! I admit, I'm looking forward to this.
string: ああ、星霜の書ですね！ 正直言って、とても楽しみですよ

original: I have a new task for you, thrall.
string: 新たな使命を与える

original: Of course. What is it that you need me to do?
string: もちろんです。ご用は何でしょうか？

original: Master, I have done as you asked and traveled here.
string: 主様、ご命令を遂行してここに参りました

original: Well, your thrall awaits and we have given him the Elder Scroll. Command him to read it, and let us hear the words of prophecy together.
string: お前の従徒が待っている。星霜の書を渡してあるので読むように指示してやれ。予言の言葉を共に聞くとしよう

original: I have made the Moth Priest my thrall.
string: 聖蚕の僧侶を下僕にした

original: Yes, I see that. I trust his capture was not too difficult a task?
string: そのようだな。捕獲はさほど難しくはなかったのだろうな？

original: Isran's at Fort Dawnguard.
string: イスランはドーンガード砦にいる

original: He's been working on that place for years now. Never lets anyone in.
string: 奴はもう何年もあれに手を加え続けている。誰も中には入れようとしない

original: His own little fortress. Well, I guess I'll get to see what he's been up to all this time.
string: 自分だけの要塞というわけだ。まあ、今まで何を企んでたのかを確かめる、いい機会になるな

original: I'll meet you there.
string: 現地で待ち合わせよう

original: How did you know?
string: どうしてそれを？

original: If Isran is anything, he's stubborn.
string: イスランは石頭の頑固者だよ

original: Yes, he said to meet him at Fort Dawnguard.
string: ああ、ドーンガード砦に来てくれと言っていた

original: Of course he did.
string: もちろんだ

original: Don't know how well I'd have managed by myself. You have my thanks.
string: 自力ではどうなるか分からなかった。ありがたい

original: You've helped me, so I suppose the least I can do is find out what Isran wants. He's still at that fort near Stendarr's Beacon, I assume?
string: 助けてもらったわけだし、イスランの望みを確かめるくらいはお安いご用だ。まだステンダールの灯の近くの砦にいるのだろうか？

original: For two weeks I've tracked that bear, and now find that you've killed it on your own.
string: あのクマを2週間も追っていたんだが、1人で仕留めてしまったのか

original: I'm not sure whether that makes you brave or foolish. What brings you here?
string: 勇敢なのか向こう見ずなのか分からんな。ここにはどうして？

original: Watch yourself. This bear is vicious.
string: 用心しろ。実に凶暴なクマだ

original: We need to stop this creature before it kills again.
string: これ以上犠牲が出る前に、あのけだものを止めないと

original: Serana believes in me, why won't you?
string: セラーナに信用されているのに、信用できないのか？

original: Serana?
string: セラーナ？

original: This is all well and good, but do we actually know anything about what they're doing? What do we do now?
string: うまく行ったけど、彼らが何してるか分かる？ この後はどうすればいいの？

original: If anyone is going to stand in their way, it's going to be us.
string: 奴らを止める事ができるのは、我々だけだ

original: And they have an Elder Scroll.
string: そして奴らは星霜の書を持っている

original: I'm sure you've heard a bit of what we're up against. Powerful vampires, unlike anything we've seen before.
string: 我々の敵について少しは耳にした事があるはずだ。我々がこれまで見た事のないほど、手強い吸血鬼の事を

original: All right Isran, you've got us all here. Now what do you want?
string: イスラン、来てやったぞ。お次は何だ？

original: Please, we need your help.
string: お願いだから協力してほしい

original: Look, I've just gotten myself out of quite a mess here, in case you haven't noticed, and while I appreciate your help, I...
string: 分からないのか、やっと大きな問題が片づいたばかりなんだ。助けてくれたのは感謝するが、そんな事…

original: What's that? No, that's not what I...  Yes, but... Are you sure? Really?
string: 何だって？ いえ、そういう意味では… はい、しかし… そんな、本当ですか？

original: Fine. Arkay says it's a good idea for me to go. I don't agree, but he's not the sort of fellow you can just ignore.
string: いいだろう。アーケイは言っている、行くべきだと。賛成しないが、あの方の言葉に背く事はできない

original: I'll see you at Fort Dawnguard, then. Don't worry, Arkay will show me the way.
string: では、ドーンガード砦で会おう。問題ない。アーケイが導いてくれる

original: Isran needs your help.
string: イスランが力を借りたがっている

original: Isran? My help?
string: イスラン？ 手を貸せと？

original: Is this... some kind of a joke? Did Arkay put you up to this?
string: それは… 何かの冗談か？ アーケイにそうしろと言われたのか？

original: Isran's done nothing but mock me. He's never given me the respect I deserve.
string: イスランにはバカにされてばかりだ。あるべき敬意が全く感じられない

original: You can meet me at Fort Dawnguard.
string: ドーンガード砦で合流しよう

original: I suppose I could... what, praytell, is there?
string: 何か… 教えてくれ、一体何をすれば？

original: I knew it! I knew Arkay would save me. I asked for help, and he sent you!
string: やっぱり！ アーケイが救ってくれた。彼に助けを求めたから、あんたが来たんだ

original: You are a very welcome addition to this dreary place, my friend. I owe both you and Arkay a great deal.
string: この退屈な場所にようこそ、友よ。アーケイとあんたには大きな借りがある

original: I'm sure I'll manage to repay him later, but you... What can I do to thank you?
string: アーケイにはいずれ恩返しができると思うが、あんたには… 何をすればいい？

original: No, and I'm not going to waste men looking. We're fighting a war against your kind, and I intend to win it.
string: ダメだ。そんな事に人員を割くのは無理だ。我々は君達の種族と戦ってるんだぞ。そして私はその戦いに勝つつもりでいる

original: You want to find him, try talking to anyone who'd meet a traveler. Innkeepers and carriage drivers in the big cities maybe. But you're on your own.
string: 彼を見つけたいなら、旅人を相手にする連中をあたればいい。大きな街の宿屋の主人とか、馬車の御者とか… 君自身の足でこなすんだ

original: Do you know where he's staying now?
string: 彼が今どこにいるか知っておりますの？

original: Some Imperial scholar arrived in Skyrim a few days ago. I was staking out the road when I saw him pass by. Maybe that's your Moth Priest.
string: 数日前に帝国の学者がスカイリムにやってきた。路上で張り込みをしていたら、彼が通り過ぎるのが見えたんだ。多分あれは君の探している聖蚕の僧侶だろう

original: Who can?
string: 誰なら可能なのか？

original: Well, the Moth Priests are the only ones I've heard of who can do it. They spend years preparing before they start reading, though.
string: 読めるらしいと聞いているのは聖蚕の僧侶くらいですわ。読み始めるまでに何年も準備に費やすそうですけど

original: Not that it helps us anyway, because they're all half a continent away in Cyrodiil.
string: いずれにせよ、大陸の反対側のシロディールにいるから役に立ちませんわね

original: So, in case you didn't notice the giant thing on my back, I have the Elder Scroll with me.
string: 背負っているモノに気づいていらっしゃらない場合を考えて言いますが、星霜の書を持ち歩いているのです

original: Whatever it says, it will have something that can help us stop my father.
string: 何が書かれているにせよ、父を止めるのに利用できるはずですわ

original: But of course, neither of us can read it.
string: もちろん、わたしどもはどちらも読めないわけですが

original: Thank you for your kindness. I'll remember it the next time I'm feeling hungry.
string: ご親切にありがとう。次にお腹がすいた時には今のを思い出す事にいたしますわ

original: You hear me? Don't feel like a guest, because you're not. You're a resource. You're an asset.
string: 聞こえたか？ 来客のように振る舞うのはやめろ。君は客ではなく人材なんだ。何かの役に立て

original: In the meantime, don't make me regret my sudden outburst of tolerance and generosity, because if you do, your friend here is going to pay for it.
string: それと、私が突然寛容の念に駆られた事を後悔させないでくれ。後悔したら、迷惑を被るのはここにいる君の友達なんだぞ

original: It can stay for now, but if it so much as lays a finger on anyone here, I'll hold you responsible. Got it?
string: 奴がここにいるのは構わないが、ここの誰かに少しでも危害を加えたら、それは君のせいだ。いいな？

original: Because we're going to need her help.
string: 彼女の助けが必要になるからだ

original: Why, because of that story about the prophecy? About some vampire trying to put the sun out?
string: あの予言の事か？ 吸血鬼が太陽を消そうとしているという？

original: Do you actually believe any of that?
string: あんな話をちょっとでも信じてるのか？

original: No, you're right. We just have to convince the others you're on our side.
string: いや、その通りだ。君が味方だと残りの者を説得すればいい

original: Well, let's move then. I'm nothing if not persuasive.
string: さあ、先を急ぎましょう。わたしは説得力には自信がございますのよ

original: What sort of prophecy?
string: 予言とは？

original: It's pointless and vague, like all prophecies. The part he latched onto said that vampires would no longer need to fear the sun.
string: 例にもれず、予言とは話があいまいで見えないもの。父がその中で注目したのは、吸血鬼が太陽を恐れずにすむようになるという一節でしたの

original: That's what he's after. He wants to control the sun, have vampires control the world.
string: 父の狙いはそこなのです。太陽を操り、吸血鬼に世界全体を支配させたいと考えています

original: What about it?
string: それが何か？

original: It all comes back to my father.
string: すべては父にまつわる話なのです

original: I'm guessing you figured this part out already, but my father's not exactly a good person. Even by vampire standards.
string: もう薄々感づいているとは思いますが、父は吸血鬼の基準でも好人物とは言えませんわ

original: He wasn't always like that, though. There was... a turn. He stumbled onto this obscure prophecy and just kind of lost himself in it.
string: でも昔からそうではなかったのです。ある時、埋もれた予言を見つけて、没頭してしまってからですのよ

original: What are you doing here?
string: ここで何をしてるんだ？

original: I'd rather not be here either, but I needed to talk to you.
string: わたしもここに来たくはなかったのですが、話したい事がありまして

original: It's important, so please just listen before your friend, here, loses his patience.
string: 大事な事ですから、そこのお友達がかんしゃくを起こす前に黙って聞いて下さいませ

original: It's... well, it's about me. And the Elder Scroll that was buried with me.
string: 話は… わたしの事、および、一緒に埋まっていた星霜の書の事なのですが…

original: I'm impressed you could find a Moth Priest so quickly.
string: 驚いたな。聖蚕の僧侶をそんなに早く見つけるなんて

original: You probably weren't expecting to see me again.
string: わたしとまた会うとは思っていなかったのでしょうね

original: Thank the divines for you!
string: 神々に感謝を！

original: You arrived just in time. I think those vampires were getting hungry.
string: ちょうどいい時に来てくれた。あの吸血鬼どもも腹を空かせてたところだよ

original: I owe you a debt for the timely rescue.
string: タイミングよく助けてくれてありがとう。君には借りができたな

original: Ah, hello there!
string: やあ！

original: What can I do for you?
string: ご用は何だい？

original: My trip to Skyrim has become quite the adventure!
string: スカイリムへの旅がちょっとした冒険になったよ！

original: A Moth Priest? What in Oblivion do you need a Moth Priest for?
string: 聖蚕の僧侶だと？ 一体どうしてそんなものが必要になるんだ？

original: Fine, fine. No need to get your breeches in a twist.
string: そうか、そうか。そんなにムキにならなくてもいいだろう

original: The obvious answer is to go to the Imperial City. The Moth Priests make their home in the White Gold Tower.
string: 帝都に行け、というのが当然の答えだ。聖蚕の僧侶達は白金の塔に住んでいる

original: Sometimes they go out looking for Elder Scrolls. Lucky for you, there's a Moth Priest in Skyrim right now, doing just that.
string: 連中は時に、星霜の書を求めて遠出する。幸いこのスカイリムにもまさしくそんな聖蚕の僧侶が来ている

original: He stopped in to do some research in the library, then left for Dragon Bridge. If you hurry, you might catch him there.
string: 図書館で調べ物をしに立ち寄った後に、ドラゴン・ブリッジに向かったようだ。急げば向こうで追いつけるかもな

original: Have I heard anything? It was the talk of the city for three days straight.
string: 何か聞いてないかって？ 街はその話題で持ちきりだよ、もう3日もね

original: Ain't too often we get a visitor like that.
string: ああいう客人は珍しいからな

original: Not as much as I would like. Even after spending decades of my life in study of the Elder Scrolls, they remain a great mystery to me.
string: 望みどおりというわけではないがね。生涯の数十年を星霜の書の研究に費やしたが、まだ分からない事が多すぎる

original: It's true for most of my brothers in the order as well. We don't really know where the scrolls came from or who wrote them.
string: 聖蚕会の仲間達も同様だ。書がどこの誰によって書かれたのか、我々の中で知っている者はいないよ

original: What we do know is that some are born with the special gift to read the Elder Scrolls.
string: 分かっているのは、星霜の書を読む才能を持って生まれてくる者達がいるという事

original: These chosen few can divine events of the past and future within the scrolls, though in time, it drives us to blindness.
string: 選ばれしそのわずかな者達は、書に記された過去と未来の出来事を読み取る事ができる。ただしそれと引き換えに、何も見えなくなる運命が待ち受けているが

original: I'm afraid there's not much more to tell. Even today, the Elder Scrolls remain a great enigma.
string: これ以上話せる事はないよ。今日においても尚、星霜の書は大きな謎に包まれているからね

original: It is the great spire at the heart of the Imperial City, among the tallest towers in all of Tamriel.
string: 帝都の中心部にある巨大な塔だ。タムリエルで最も高い塔のひとつだよ

original: The lower floors are home to the Imperial Council, and the Order of Moth Priests occupies the middle floors.
string: その下層部は帝国議会の本拠地で、中層部は聖蚕会が占有している

original: The tower suffered damage in the recent war with the Aldmeri Dominion, and is not what it once was.
string: 最近のアルドメリ自治領との戦争で損傷を受けたせいで、塔は以前の姿を失ってしまったが

original: I hope one day to see it restored to its former glory.
string: いつか修復されて過去の勇姿をまた見せてくれるといいね

original: It is our sacred duty to study the Elder Scrolls.
string: 星霜の書の研究は、我々に課せられた神聖な任務だ

original: We read these ancient scrolls of prophecy in order to divine the future, and we use that knowledge to aid the Emperor.
string: 予言が書かれたいにしえの巻物から、我々は未来を読み取る。そしてその知識を皇帝のために使うんだよ

original: Sometimes we venture out into the world in search of more scrolls for our library at the White-Gold Tower.
string: 白金の塔の書庫に加える巻物を探して、時に我々は世界中を旅する事もある

original: That is the very purpose that first brought me to Skyrim.
string: 私がスカイリムに来たそもそもの理由がそれなんだよ

original: What else would you like to know?
string: 他に何が知りたいのですか？

original: Oh, he just left a short while ago. He said he'd finished up his work and it was time to move on.
string: ああ、そいつなら少し前に出てったよ。仕事が済んだから引き払うと言ってね

original: That's all I can tell you. He asked me not to let anyone know where he was going. I suppose he didn't want the attention.
string: それ以上は言えないよ。行き先は誰にも教えないでくれと言われてるんでね。余計な関心をひきたくなかったんだろうさ

original: Ah, well, in that case I'll tell you what I know.
string: なるほど、そういう事なら特別に教えてやるよ

original: He took the road southwest out of town, and said he was going to be crossing over the Dragon Bridge. That's all that he told me. I hope it helps.
string: そいつは町を出て南西に向かったよ。ドラゴン・ブリッジを渡ると言ってな。それ以上の事は教えてくれなかった。お役に立てたならいいが

original: Any idea how you're going to find a Moth Priest? Skyrim's a pretty big place.
string: この広いスカイリムで、聖蚕の僧侶1人を探し出すのは大変ですわ。何か目星はございますの？

original: Actually, now that I think of it... I'm going to come along with you.
string: 実際問題、考えてみたのですけれど… あなたと一緒に行く事にしましたわ

original: I've been really wanting to get out and explore a bit.
string: 外に出て、歩き回ってみたくてたまらなくなりましたのよ

original: Now, if everyone will please be quiet, I must concentrate.
string: みんな静かにしてくれるかな… 集中したいんだ

original: I see a vision before me, an image of a great bow. I know this weapon! It is Auriel's Bow!
string: 見えるぞ… 巨大な弓が見える。この武器には見覚えがあるぞ！ アーリエルの弓だ！

original: Now a voice whispers, saying "Among the night's children, a dread lord will rise."
string: 声がささやく… 「夜の子供達の中から、ドレッド・ロードが現れる」

original: In an age of strife, when dragons return to the realm of men, darkness will mingle with light and the night and day will be as one.
string: 戦いの時代、ドラゴン達が人間の国に舞い戻る時、闇と光が混ざり、夜と昼はひとつになる

original: The voice fades and the words begin to shimmer and distort. But wait, there is more here.
string: 声がかすれて言葉が歪み始めている。でもちょっと待った… まだ続きがある

original: The secret of the bow's power is written elsewhere. I think there is more to the prophecy, recorded in other scrolls.
string: 弓の力の秘密はどこか別のところに書かれている。他の書に記録された予言の続きがあるようだ

original: Yes, I see them now... One contains the ancient secrets of the dragons, and the other speaks of the potency of ancient blood.
string: 見えてきたぞ… 書のひとつにはドラゴンに関するいにしえの秘密が含まれ、もうひとつには古き血が持つ力の事が記されている

original: My vision darkens, and I see no more.
string: 暗くてもう見えないよ

original: To know the complete prophecy, we must have the other two scrolls.
string: 予言をすべて知るには、残りの2巻の書が必要だな

original: Well, back before I... you know. The College of Winterhold was the first place I'd think to go for any kind of magic or historical thing.
string: まあ以前は… 色々と。最初に行こうと考えたのはウィンターホールド大学でしたわ。魔法や歴史を学ぼうと思いましたの

original: The wizards know about all kinds of things that people probably shouldn't know about.
string: ウィザードは普通の人達が知るべきではない事を色々とご存知ですものね

original: I serve my master's will.
string: 主様の仰せのとおりに

original: But my master is dead, and his enemies will pay!
string: だが私の主様は死んだ。かの敵どもは報いを受けるぞ！

original: Never much cared for folks who can't mind their own business.
string: 他人の事をあれこれ詮索する連中は虫が好かないんだが

original: Sorry, but that Moth Priest's comings and goings are none of my business, and none of yours either.
string: 悪いがその聖蚕の僧侶がどこから来てどこに行こうが、こっちには関係のない話さ。あんたにもな

original: I can see that.
string: なるほどな

original: He said he was heading for Dragon Bridge next. I hope that helps you.
string: 次はドラゴン・ブリッジに向かうと言ってたよ。お役に立てたならいいが

original: It's like I said, I'm not going to talk about it.
string: 言っただろう？ その話はしないって

original: Suits me just fine.
string: せいせいしたよ

original: An' maybe it won't.
string: 多分ダメだね

original: Ah yes, I remember your Moth Priest now.
string: ああそうだ。あんたの探してる聖蚕の僧侶の事を思い出したよ

original: He wanted me to take him out to Dragon Bridge, but I told him it ain't one of my stops.
string: ドラゴン・ブリッジに行きたいって言われたけど、そこはコース外だから断ったんだ

original: Can't help you, friend. I might remember better if my pockets weren't so light.
string: 悪いが力になれないね。懐が温かくなったらもうちょっと思い出せるんだが

original: Now that I think on it, I did see your priest.
string: よく考えたら、確かにその司祭を見たよ

original: He tried to hire me for a trip to Dragon Bridge, but I told him that ain't one of my stops.
string: ドラゴン・ブリッジに行きたいって言われたけど、そこはコース外だから断ったんだ

original: Might be that I have, but I can't say for sure.
string: そうかも知れないが、確かな事は言えないね

original: I got enough troubles on my mind just tryin' to scrape by out here.
string: ここで何とか暮らしていく事で頭が一杯なんだ

original: That's one of them Imperial scholars, right? Old man with a gray robe?
string: 帝国の学者さんかい？ 灰色のローブを着たじいさんか？

original: I will share that knowledge with you gladly, master. What do you wish to know?
string: 主様、その知識を喜んであなたと共有します。何が知りたいのですか？

original: Very well.
string: よろしい

original: Hold it. If you're going downstairs, you keep your weapons to yourself or we'll be getting better acquainted.
string: 待て、下に下りるなら武器をしまえ。さもないと仲良くする事になるぞ

original: Haran manages the inn in Winterhold. A forsaken place under the shadow of the mages guild. She will help us keep an eye on the mages.
string: ハランはウィンターホールドで宿屋を営んでいる。魔術師ギルドの近くにある廃れたところだ。彼女が魔術師達を監視するのを手伝ってくれるだろう

original: Valindor of Riften has his ears in places that we'd love to listening in. Joining our family should increase our possibilities in the south.
string: リフテンのヴァリンドルは我々のいい耳になってくれるぞ。仲間に加えれば南での活動の可能性が広がる

original: A pathetic creature in her present condition, but the gift will embolden her. And her lowly state suits her to being our eyes and ears in Markarth.
string: 今はただの惨めな生き物だが、贈り物を与えれば彼女も元気になるだろう。それに彼女の卑しい身分は、マルカルスで我々の目や耳になるのには適任だ

original: Understood.
string: 分かった

original: When you offer the embrace, do so away from prying eyes. Our new sibling will then likely require rest while his blood undergoes the change.
string: 抱きしめる時は人目を避けるように。おそらく我々の新しい同胞は、血が変化する間休息を必要とするだろう

original: Return to me when your part is done.
string: やるべき事が済んだら戻ってきてくれ

original: When you offer the embrace, do so away from prying eyes. Our new sibling will then likely require rest while her blood undergoes the change.
string: 抱きしめる時は人目を避けるように。おそらく我々の新しい同胞は、血が変化する間休息を必要とするだろう

original: Return to me when your part is done.
string: やるべき事が済んだら戻ってきてくれ

original: Why am I able to bestow the gift of Harkon's blood?
string: 自分もハルコンの血の恩恵を他人に授けられるのはどうしてか？

original: I have found such a soul and the stars appear cooperative.
string: よき星に導かれた、素晴らしい魂を見つけたぞ

original: While the blessed state of undeath can be "accidentally" conferred - consider the brutish creatures you find wailing in dank hovels in the wild...
string: 不死の祝福は“図らずも”授けられるが… 荒野のジメジメしたあばら屋で泣き叫ぶ野蛮な者達を見てみなよ…

original: Only those who can trace their ancestry through Harkon's mortal blood line can faithfully accept the power conferred by his Vampiric blood.
string: ハルコンの血を持つ定命の者だけが、吸血鬼としての彼の力が授けし力を忠実に受け継ぐ事ができるんだ

original: And among those, it seems, only when the heavens show the correct aspects.
string: さらにその者にあっても、天が正しき様相を見せている時のみに限られるが

original: Can't anyone become a vampire if bitten by one?
string: 噛まれたら誰でも吸血鬼になりうるのでは？

original: Because he himself bestowed upon you a portion of his vitality when he infused you with his own blood the night you returned with Serana.
string: 彼自身が君に彼の力の一部を授けたからだよ。セラーナと一緒に戻ってきた夜に、彼の血を君はもらっただろう

original: A small measure of his blood now and forever flows through your veins.
string: 彼の血は少量でも、永遠に君の血管を流れ続けるんだ

original: Why am I able to bestow the gift of Harkon's blood?
string: 自分もハルコンの血の恩恵を他人に授けられるのはどうしてか？

original: Put his mind to rest, allay his fear through vampiric seduction and when he is in a pliant condition, embrace him and bite him on the neck.
string: 彼の心を落ち着かせて、吸血鬼の誘惑でその恐れを鎮める。そして彼が従順になったら、抱きしめて首筋に噛みつけばいい

original: How do I turn him into a vampire?
string: 彼を吸血鬼に変えるにはどうすれば？

original: Put her mind to rest, allay her fear through vampiric seduction and when she is in a pliant condition, embrace her and bite her on the neck.
string: 彼女の心を落ち着かせて、吸血鬼の誘惑でその恐れを鎮める。そして彼女が従順になったら、抱きしめて首筋に噛みつけばいい

original: How do I turn her into a vampire?
string: 彼女を吸血鬼に変えるにはどうすれば？

original: Our blood grants us power to calm and relax. If you currently lack the gift, forgo feeding for a day and that power will come naturally.
string: 我々の血は心の平穏をもたらす力を授けてくれる。もし今その力を感じないなら、血の分配を1日控えれば自然と戻ってくるはずだ

original: Once your thrall is suitably sedated, you will be able to impart the gift without resistance.
string: 君の従徒がちゃんと落ち着いたら、贈り物を容易に授ける事ができるだろう

original: (grunt)
string: うう…

original: (grunt)
string: うう…

original: I don't feel... right... I'm going to lay down... for awhile...
string: 何か… おかしい… 少しの間… 横になるよ…

original: Something's happened, I can't quite remember...
string: 何かが起きたのか？ はっきり思い出せない…

original: They're a splinter group of the "Vigilants of Stendarr." A bit more ambitious, it seems.
string: 彼らは“ステンダールの番人”の分派よ。もう少し野心が強いようだけど

original: The Dawnguard are apparently focused on exterminating vampires, noble and brute alike.
string: ドーンガードは吸血鬼の根絶に重点を置いている、貴族もけだものも一様にな

original: Not a serious threat, but we can't leave them completely unchecked or they may become one.
string: 深刻な脅威ではないが、完全に放置していればそうなるかも知れない

original: A more "serious" group of the Vigilants of Stendarr. Sometimes when you skin a skeever, you find he has a more aggressive mate.
string: 攻撃的な、ステンダールの番人においてもより“危険な”集団よ。スキーヴァーの皮をはぐ時のあなたみたいに

original: The Dawnguard apparently like killing vampires.
string: ドーンガードは吸血鬼を殺すのが好きなようね

original: Almost as much as we like killing them.
string: 私達が彼らを殺すのが好きなのと同じくらいに

original: Can't anyone become a vampire if bitten by one?
string: 噛まれたら誰でも吸血鬼になりうるのでは？

original: What can I do to help?
string: 何か手伝えることは？

original: I've found a new candidate, ripe for Harkon's Gift. I'm sending you to welcome this soul into our family.
string: ハルコンの贈り物を捧げる新たな候補者を見つけたぞ。我々の家族にしてやってくれ

original: He simply said "It is time."
string: “時が満ちた”とだけ

original: Well, well. He wants the Chalice, then.
string: なるほど。彼の望みは聖杯か

original: You've heard of the Bloodstone Chalice?
string: ブラッドストーンの聖杯を知っているか？

original: Please, take the bow... it's yours.
string: この弓はお前のものだ… 持っていってくれ

original: So, the deed has been done. My brother is dead.
string: 為すべき事は為され、我が兄弟は死んだ

original: Questions? I expected as much.
string: 質問はあるか？ 分からない事も多いだろう

original: You've nothing to fear from me. Please, we have much to discuss.
string: 恐れる必要は何もない。話したい事がたくさんある

original: May Auri-El's brilliance illuminate your path.
string: アーリエルの光が行く手を照らさん事を

original: May Auri-El's light guide you in your darkest hours.
string: 苦難の時も、アーリエルの光の導きがあらん事を

original: May Auri-El's warmth imbue your body with strength.
string: その身がアーリエルの力で満たされん事を

original: May Auri-El's glow shield you from your enemy.
string: アーリエルの光の盾がその身を守らん事を

original: May Auri-El's radiance fill your heart with joy.
string: アーリエルの光がその心を喜びで満たさん事を

original: I'll be off then.
string: それでは、先を急ぐか

original: This may be the last time we're able to converse. If you have any questions before you leave, I suggest you ask them.
string: 話ができるのは、これが最後になるかも知れない。分からない事があれば、今聞いておいた方がいいぞ

original: Otherwise, all I can do now is grant you my hopes for a safe journey.
string: 質問がないなら、旅の無事を祈って送り出すだけだ

original: So I need to fill this at each wayshrine?
string: それぞれの祠でこれを一杯にすればいいと？

original: Once you've located a wayshrine, there will be a spectral Prelate tending to it.
string: 祠を見つけたら、そこを守っている形なき司教がいるはずだ

original: They will allow you to draw the waters from the shrine's basin as if you've been enlightened.
string: 悟りを開いた者と同じように祠の水瓶から水を汲む事を許してくれるだろう

original: These caves must be massive.
string: ずいぶん大きな洞窟のようだ

original: Caves? Oh, no. The Chantry encompasses far more than a few caves, as you'll soon discover.
string: 洞窟？ いや、それは大きな勘違いだ。今に分かる。この礼拝所はただの洞窟の集まりなどではない

original: But before I send you on your way, you'll need the Initiate's Ewer.
string: 送り出す前に、新人の水差しが必要だな

original: How many more wayshrines are there?
string: 祠はあといくつあるんだ？

original: There are five in total, spread far apart across the Chantry.
string: 全部で5つある。広大な礼拝所のあちこちに散らばっているんだ

original: I know how it all sounds, but if there was another way I'd have done it long ago.
string: おかしな話に聞こえるだろうが、他の方法があればとっくにそうしている

original: Well, once the Initiate's enlightenment was complete, he'd bring the ewer to the Chantry's Inner Sanctum.
string: 新人が完全に悟りを開くと、水差しを持って最奥聖域に向かう事になっていたのだ

original: Pouring the contents of the ewer into the sacred basin of the Sanctum would allow him to enter for an audience with the Arch-Curate himself.
string: 聖域にある水瓶に水差しの水を注ぐと、最高司祭と直々に面会できる仕組みとなっている

original: Once the Initiate completed his mantras, he'd dip a ceremonial ewer in the basin at the wayshrine's center and proceed to the next wayshrine.
string: 新人は真言を得た後、祠の中央にある水瓶に水差しを浸し、次の祠へ向かうという儀式を行っていた

original: Prelates of these shrines were charged with teaching the mantras of Auri-El to our Initiates.
string: 祠の聖職者は皆、入信者達にアーリエルの真言を教える役割を担っていた

original: This structure is known as a wayshrine. They were used for meditation and for transport when the Chantry was a place of enlightenment.
string: この建造物は祠だ。かつて礼拝所が悟りを開くための場所だった頃、瞑想や移動のために使われていたのだ

original: Have you tried getting into the Inner Sanctum?
string: 最奥聖域に入ろうと試みたのか？

original: Leaving the wayshrines unguarded would be violating my sacred duty as a Knight-Paladin of Auriel.
string: アーリエルの騎士司祭として、祠の守護という聖なる使命を無視してここを離れる事はできない

original: And an assault on the Betrayed guarding the Inner Sanctum would only end with my death.
string: それに、裏切られし者が守る最奥聖域に攻め込んだところで、無駄死にするだけだ

original: You don't even know if he's alive.
string: 生きているかどうかもわからないな

original: He's alive. I've seen him.
string: 彼は生きている。姿を見た

original: But something's wrong. He never looks as though he's in pain or under duress. He just... stands there and watches, as though waiting.
string: しかし、何か変だった。苦痛を感じていたり、脅されていたりするようには見えなかった。ただ… 何かを待つように立っていただけだ

original: Didn't you fight back?
string: 反撃しなかったのか？

original: The Chantry was a place of peaceful worship. I led a small group of paladins, but we were no match for the Betrayed's sheer numbers.
string: かつての礼拝所は祈りのための平和な場所だった。小さな司祭団を率いていたが、裏切られし者に数で圧倒されてしまったのだ

original: They slaughtered everyone and stormed the Inner Sanctum where I believe they corrupted Vyrthur.
string: 皆を殺し、奴らは最奥聖域に攻め込んだ。ヴィルスールはそこで奴らの手に落ちたのだろう

original: Do I have a choice?
string: 選択肢はあるのか？

original: Absolutely. You could turn around and travel back from wherever you started empty handed, or you could assist me.
string: その通りだ。何も持たずに旅を始めた場所に帰ってもいいし、頼みを聞いてくれてもいい

original: What type of assistance do you need?
string: 手を貸すにはどうすればいい？

original: I need you to kill Arch-Curate Vyrthur... my brother.
string: 兄弟を… 最高司祭のヴィルスールを殺してほしい

original: Kill your brother, why?
string: 兄弟を殺せと？ 理由は？

original: The kinship between us is gone. I don't understand what he's become, but he's no longer the brother I once knew.
string: もはや我らが絆は失われてしまった。何者になってしまったのかは分からないが、今の彼を兄弟とは思えない

original: It was the Betrayed... they did something to him, I just don't know why Auri-El would allow this to happen.
string: 裏切られし者の仕業であろうな… 奴らに何かされたのだ。アーリエルはなぜこんな事を許すのだろうか

original: How did you know?
string: どうしてそれを？

original: For the thousands of years I've served as the Chantry's sentinel, there hasn't been a single visitor here for any other reason.
string: 礼拝所の守り人として何千年も過ごしてきたが、それ以外の理由で訪ねてきた者は誰もいない

original: They request Auriel's Bow, and I request their assistance. It's been repeated so many times, I can't imagine it any other way.
string: 誰もがアーリエルの弓を求め、こちらは見返りに手伝いを頼む。数えきれないほど繰り返して、もはや他のやりとりなど想像もできない

original: Snow elves? You're a Falmer?
string: スノーエルフ？ ファルメルなのか？

original: I prefer snow elf. The name "Falmer" usually holds a negative meaning to most travelers.
string: スノーエルフと呼んでくれ。多くの旅人にとって“ファルメル”という名は良い意味を持たない

original: Those twisted creatures you call Falmer, I call the Betrayed.
string: お前達がファルメルと呼ぶ邪悪な生き物の事は、裏切られし者と呼んでいる

original: This cave is a temple to Auriel?
string: この洞窟はアーリエルの聖堂なのか？

original: Auriel, Auri-El, Alkosh, Akatosh... so many different names for the sovereign of the snow elves.
string: アーリエル、アルコシュ、アカトシュ… 呼び名は様々だがすべて同じ、スノーエルフの守護神アーリエルだ

original: Who are you?
string: お前は誰だ？

original: I am Knight-Paladin Gelebor. Welcome to the Great Chantry of Auri-El.
string: 騎士司祭のギレボルだ。アーリエルの大礼拝所へようこそ

original: What is this bloodspring?
string: 血の泉とは？

original: An ancient font, full of power. As much as it looks like blood, sadly it is not. Can you imagine if it were? We'd never need to hunt again.
string: 力に満ちた古代の瓶。血に見えるが、不幸にも違う。そうだった場合を想像できるか？ 二度と狩りの必要はなかっただろう

original: Still, its liquid is powerful, full of magic. Others have noticed, though they have never fully realized its potential.
string: それでも、強力で魔力にあふれる液体だ。気づいた者もいたが、その潜在力を十分には理解しなかった

original: All right, you've heard what it has to say. Now tell me, is there any reason I shouldn't kill this bloodsucking fiend right now?
string: 分かった。君は奴の言い分を聞いたというわけだな。では教えてくれ。その血を吸う悪魔を今すぐ殺さない理由が少しでもあるのか？

original: What do you mean by allaying fear through vampiric seduction?
string: 吸血鬼の誘惑で恐れを鎮める、というのは？

original: Hello.
string: やあ

original: You've given me a great gift friend. The night air hums and the shadows are full of color.
string: 素晴らしいよ。こんなにも夜の空気が新鮮で、暗がりには色彩があふれているなんて

original: Make use of my coffin whenever you like. My home is your home.
string: 棺は自分のものだと思って、自由に使ってくれてかまわないからね

original: Great gift of blood you've given me. Blood that boils in my veins. Gives me strength.
string: 偉大な血の贈り物だわ。血管の中で沸き立つ血。力を与えてくれる

original: You can use my coffin whenever you like.
string: 私の棺はいつでも使ってちょうだい

original: I never knew the darkness held such colors, or the night air smelled so sweet. You have given me a great gift.
string: 暗闇がこんなにも色彩豊かで、夜の空気がこれほどまでかぐわしいとは。すばらしいプレゼントをありがとう

original: Please, make use of my coffin whenever the need arises.
string: どうか私の棺を使ってほしい。必要なときにはいつでも

original: My best beloved! I never knew the night held such vibrant color, or that the air vibrated so. And at times, it's as if the very shadows whisper.
string: 最愛の人よ！ 夜がこれほどまでに鮮やかな色を秘め、大気がこうも活き活きとしているなんて！ そして時には、影そのものがささやきかけてくるかのよう…

original: It is a cherished gift you have given me. To see the world this way, through your eyes. It will only bring us closer.
string: この恩恵は実に大切なもので、こうして愛する人と同じ目で世界を見つめられることで、我々の距離はさらに縮まることでしょう…

original: Hello.
string: やあ

original: It's impressive.
string: 見ごたえあるな

original: It's something all right.
string: これは何やらありそうですわね

original: Why didn't you tell me it was so huge?
string: これほど巨大なら、事前に言ってくれても…

original: I didn't want you to think I was one of those... you know, the women who just sit in their castle all day?
string: よくいるあの… お城に一日中座っている部類の女だと思われたくなかったのです

original: I don't know. Coming from a place like this, well... it's not really me. I hope you can believe that.
string: 分かりませんわ。こんな場所から出てきたとなると… 本当にわたしだと信じてもらえるといいのですが

original: Someone you don't want to see?
string: 会いたくない人でもいるとか？

original: My father and I don't really get along.
string: 父との折り合いがよくないのです

original: Ugh, saying it out loud makes it sound so... common. "Little girl who doesn't get along with her father." Read that story a hundred times.
string: 言葉にするとあまりにもありがちですわね。「お父さんとぎくしゃくしている女の子」の話なら百回は読みましたわ

original: Why wouldn't you be safe there?
string: どうして安全じゃないんだ？

original: Let's just say that my mother and father had a bit of a falling out.
string: わたしの父母がちょっとした仲違いをした、とだけ言っておきますわ

original: Don't worry, I'm not in any danger or anything like that. It'll just be more unpleasant to run into my father.
string: 別段、危険にさらされてるわけではございませんの。父に会うのがそれだけ不愉快な出来事になるだけで

original: Tell me about your home.
string: 家について聞かせてほしい

original: It's on an island near Solitude. Hopefully we can find a boat to take us there.
string: ソリチュードの近くの島にございますわ。渡るのに使える小船でもあるといいのですが

original: It's my family home. Not the most welcoming place, but depending on who's around, I'll be safe there.
string: わたしの家族の家です。そこまで歓迎されないかも知れませんが、誰がいるかによっては安全なはず

original: This is it. Home sweet... castle.
string: これですわ。懐かしの… 我が城

original: This is your home?
string: これが家なのか？

original: Why were you locked away?
string: 幽閉されていた理由は？

original: I'd... rather not get into that with you. If that's all right.
string: それは… できれば触れたくありませんわ。お分かり頂けて？

original: I'm sorry, it's not that... it's just that I don't know who I can trust just yet.
string: ごめんなさい、他意はございませんの… 誰を信用していいのか、分からないのです

original: Let's get to my home, and I'll have a better sense of where we all stand.
string: 家に着けば、我々がどういう状況にいるのかがもう少し分かるはずですわ

original: How long were you in there?
string: あの中にはいつ頃から？

original: Good question. Hard to say.
string: いい質問ですわね。断言はできませんが

original: I... I can't really tell.
string: わたしには… 何とも言えませんわ

original: I feel like it was a long time. Who is Skyrim's High King?
string: 長い時間に思えてなりませんわね。スカイリムの今の王はどなたですの？

original: Where do you want to go?
string: どこに行きたいんだ？

original: I wasn't told where to take you.
string: どこに行けばいいか聞いてなかった

original: Your lack of planning fills me with confidence.
string: その無計画ぶり、頼もしすぎましてよ

original: I don't think he knew much of anything.
string: ほとんど何もわかっていなかった気がする

original: Figures I'd be woken by a couple of know-nothings. So where are we off to, now?
string: つまり、何も知らない人達に起こされたわけですのね。それで、これからどこに行きますの？

original: No. We expected some kind of artifact.
string: いや、何らかの秘宝が眠っているものと

original: And instead you found me. So what's your next step, now that I'm here?
string: 代わりにわたしを見つけたわけですのね。それで、次はどうしますの？ わたしはここにおりますのよ？

original: Nobody. I just walked in here.
string: 別に誰でもない。たまたま通りがかっただけだ

original: You're lucky to be alive, then. I'm guessing you don't have a plan for where to go next, then?
string: でしたら、まだ生きてる事に感謝なさって。次にどこへ行くかも分からないのでしょう？

original: That's not really your business.
string: あんたには関係のないことだ

original: I see. Where are you taking me, then? Is that much my business?
string: 分かりましたわ。それで、どこに連れて行く気かしら？ わたしに関係のある所ですの？

original: A man named Isran.
string: イスランという名の男だ

original: I... don't know who that is. Did he... mention my father at all?
string: その人の事は… 存じませんわ。父の事、何かおっしゃって？

original: I was sent to retrieve something from this cave.
string: この洞窟から何かを持ち帰るように言われた

original: That something... was probably me.
string: その何かとは… おそらくわたし自身の事ですわね

original: My name is Serana. Who sent you here?
string: わたしはセラーナ。あなた、誰に言われていらっしゃったの？

original: Unh... where is... who sent you here?
string: ああ… ここは… あなた、誰に言われていらっしゃったの？

original: Unh... who are you?
string: ああ… あなたはどちら様？

original: It appears I have you to thank for turning my daughter against me.
string: 娘を心変わりさせたのはお前の仕業のようだな

original: I knew it was only a matter of time before she'd return with hatred in her heart.
string: 娘がその心に憎しみを宿して戻るのも、時間の問題だとは分かっていた

original: It appears I have you to thank for turning my daughter against me.
string: 娘を心変わりさせたのはお前の仕業のようだな

original: I knew it was only a matter of time before your ambition outgrew your loyalty.
string: お前の野心が忠誠心を追い落とすのも、時間の問題だとは分かっていた

original: What's on your mind?
string: 何を考えている？

original: That Moth Priest, Dexion. He said we needed two other Elder Scrolls. I think I know where we can start looking.
string: 聖蚕の僧侶デキソンは、星霜の書がもう二つ必要になると言っていましたけれど、どこにありそうかの見当ならつきますわよ

original: Can't it wait?
string: 後じゃだめなのか？

original: Well, you could waste a lot of time trying to figure out our next move, or you could let me help.
string: 次にどうすべきかを決めるのに多大な時間を浪費してもいいでしょうし、わたしの助言に耳を貸すのもよくてよ

original: Your choice.
string: あなた次第ですわ

original: Years of mocking, of dismissal... and now suddenly here you are, begging for help.
string: 何年もの間あざけり疎外してたくせに… 突然やってきて助けを求めるのか？

original: Yes, you've explained yourself. I'm supposed to just throw myself in front of you all and offer protection, am I?
string: ああ、言いたい事は分かった。君達みんなの前に身を投げ出して、守ってくれというわけだな？

original: Isran, these vampires are different. I know you've disagreed with the Order in the past...
string: イスラン、今回の吸血鬼は別物だ。かつて教団と対立したのは知っているが…

original: Why not just scream at the top of your lungs "Here we are, monsters! We're oh so tasty! Come and get us!"
string: 声の限りに叫べばいいじゃないか。「こっちだ、バケモノめ！ 俺達は美味いぞ！ 食べに来いよ！」とな

original: Look at these fools, so concerned with tending their precious "beacon."
string: この能なしどもを見ろ。自分達の大事な“のろし”の世話に必死になっている

original: Well what did you expect, Tolan? Didn't I tell you? Didn't I warn you this would happen?
string: トラン、何を期待してたんだ？ 言っただろう？ こうなるぞと警告したはずだぞ

original: So where is this Elder Scroll?
string: その星霜の書はどこに？

original: We need to find my mother, Valerica.
string: わたしの母、ヴァレリカを見つけなくては

original: She'll definitely know where it is, and if we're lucky, she actually has it herself.
string: 母ならそのありかを絶対に知っていますわ。もしかしたら持っているかも

original: Isn't that pretty risky, staying around the castle?
string: 城の周囲をうろつくのは危険じゃないのか？

original: Oh, absolutely. But my mother's not a coward.
string: そのとおりですわ。でも母は卑怯者ではございませんの

original: That is... I don't think we'll actually trip over her there. But it's worth a look.
string: つまり… そこへ行っても母に会えるとは思わないのですけど、調べる価値はありそうですわ

original: There's an unused inlet on the northern side of the island that was used by the previous owners to bring supplies into the castle.
string: 島の北側に放棄された入り江がありますの。前の所有者達が城に荷物を持ち込む時に使っていた場所なのですけれど

original: An old escape tunnel from the castle exits there. I think that's our way in.
string: 昔の脱出用トンネルが城からそこまでつながっていますわ。あそこから入れるはずですわよ

original: In Castle Volkihar?
string: ヴォルキハル城の城内に隠れている？

original: Wait... that almost makes sense!
string: お待ちになって… きっとそうですわ！

original: There's a courtyard in the castle. I used to help her tend a garden there.
string: お城には中庭があって、母がその庭園の世話をするのをよく手伝いましたわ

original: All of the ingredients for our potions came from there. She used to say that my father couldn't stand the place. Too... peaceful.
string: うちの薬の材料はみんなそこで採っておりましたの。母いわく、父はその場所が大嫌いだったようですわ。ちょっと… 和やかすぎるから

original: Wait... that almost makes sense!
string: ちょっと待って… きっとそうだわ！

original: I used to help my mother tend a garden in the courtyard here.
string: 母がここの中庭の庭園を世話するのをよく手伝いましたわ

original: All of the ingredients for our potions came from there. She used to say that my father couldn't stand the place. Too... peaceful.
string: うちの薬の材料はみんなそこで採ってたの。彼女いわく、父はその場所が大嫌いだったみたい。ちょっと… 和やかすぎるから

original: How about right here, in the castle?
string: この城の中は？

original: Sealed away like you were?
string: 同じように封じ込められている？

original: I don't think so. She said she wanted to stay awake in case the situation was resolved.
string: そうかしら。状況が改善した時に備えて目は覚ましておきたいと母は言っておりましたわ

original: It had to be one of us, and, well, she's so much more powerful than I am. It just made sense for her to be out here.
string: きっとわたし達の味方ですのよ。そして母はわたしよりずっと力がある。ここにいる事自体が彼女にとって意味があったのですわ

original: Anything else?
string: 他に何の理由がありまして？

original: Feel the last word of Soul Tearing within yourself: "Zol" - the unlife that results when a soul is imprisoned in dead flesh.
string: ソウル・ティアリングの最後の一語、“ゾル”を感じよ。魂が死した肉体に幽閉された時に生じる、不死の事だ

original: Hear now the second word of Soul Tearing: "Vaaz"- meaning to tear your enemy's soul from its living vessel.
string: ソウル・ティアリングの2つめの一語、“ヴァーズ”を聞くがいい。敵の魂をその生ける器から引き裂く事を意味する

original: As promised, I now teach you the first word of Soul Tearing: "Rii" - the essence of your enemy's life force.
string: 約束どおり、ソウル・ティアリングの最初の一語、“リィ”を教えよう。敵の命の粋を意味する

original: You have kept your side of the bargain, now let me fulfill mine.
string: そなたは約束を守ってくれた。今度は我の番だ

original: I can feel my strength returning each time I am set free from that prison!
string: あの監獄から解き放たれるたびに、力が戻ってくるのが分かる！

original: Ah! The free air of Vus at long last!
string: ああ、ヴスの自由な空気よ！ 待ちかねたぞ！

original: I rejoice in my freedom, if only for a moment.
string: 一瞬とはいえ、この自由を喜ぶとしよう

original: The skies of Keizaal are mine again!
string: ケイザールの空は再び我がものとなった！

original: You give me freedom from the enslavement of the Ideal Masters. Thank you.
string: アイディール・マスターどもの束縛から自由を得る事ができた。ありがたい

original: You share her blood.
string: あなたの血を使ったらどうだ？

original: Hmmm. Not bad. We'd better hope that's good enough. Mistakes with these kinds of portals can be... gruesome.
string: あらまあ、悪くないですわね。それで事足りると願いたいですわ。こういった転移門で手違いをしてしまうと… それはおぞましい結果になる事がございますのよ

original: Anyway, enough of that. Let's get started.
string: とにかく、そろそろ始めましょう

original: What's wrong?
string: どうした？

original: We're also going to need a sample of her blood. Which... if we could get that, we wouldn't even be trying to do this in the first place.
string: 彼女の血も少し必要みたいですわ。それが手に入るくらいなら、こんな手順はそもそも必要ないというのに

original: What do we need?
string: 何が必要だ？

original: A handful of soul gem shards, some finely-ground bone meal, a good bit of purified void salts...
string: 魂石の破片をいくつか、細かく引いた骨の粉、浄化された虚無の塩をかなりの量…

original: Oh... damn it...
string: ああ… 何て事ですの…

original: If she made it there, we'll find her.
string: 彼女の足取りを追えば、見つかるさ

original: That circle in the center of the room is definitely some type of portal.
string: 部屋の中央の円が何らかの転移門なのは間違いなさそうですわね

original: If I'm reading this right, there's a formula here that should give us safe passage into the Soul Cairn.
string: 読み間違いでなければ、ソウル・ケルンへと無事に入るための手順が記されていますわ

original: Why did she care where used souls went?
string: 消耗した魂の行き先を気にかける理由は？

original: The Soul Cairn is home to very powerful beings. Necromancers send them souls, and receive powers of their own in return.
string: ソウル・ケルンには強大な力を持つ存在が複数いる。死霊術師はそれらに魂を送り、見返りとして力を得ている

original: My mother spent a lot of time trying to contact them directly, to travel to the Soul Cairn itself.
string: 母はそういった存在と接触をとれないか、つまりソウル・ケルン自体に行けないかという検討にかなりの時間を費やしましたわ

original: What's this "Soul Cairn" that she mentions?
string: その“ソウル・ケルン”とやらはいったい？

original: I only know what she told me.
string: 聞かされた話しか知りませんわ

original: She had a theory about soul gems. That the souls inside of them don't just vanish when they're used... they end up in the Soul Cairn.
string: 母は魂石に関する仮説を話してくれましたわ。中の魂が消費されてもただ消えるのではなく、ソウル・ケルンの中に送られるのかも知れないと

original: I've found your mother's notes.
string: 母親の日記を見つけた

original: You did? Let me see them.
string: そうですの？ 見せてもらえて？

original: And what's this thing?
string: それにしても、これはなんなのかしら？

original: Look at all this. She must have spent years collecting these components.
string: ご覧になって。母は何年もかけてこういう部品を集めていたに違いありませんわ

original: You are prey, like all mortals. I banish you!
string: お前は獲物だ、定命の者の例に漏れずな。立ち去るがいい！

original: I've collected all the Amulets of Night Power.
string: 夜の力のアミュレットをすべて集めた

original: Excellent! I'm sure you'll put those to good use.
string: 素晴らしい！ 君ならきっと有効に利用してくれるはずだな

original: Understood.
string: 分かった

original: Good luck.
string: 幸運を祈る

original: Will I be able to keep these amulets?
string: アミュレットはそのままもらっていいのか？

original: Of course. I wouldn't be telling you where to find them if I desired them for myself.
string: もちろんさ。自分のものにするなら君にそれらのありかを教えてないよ

original: Of course. I wouldn't be telling you where to find it if I desired it for myself.
string: もちろんさ。自分のものにするなら君にそのありかを教えてないよ

original: Will I be able to keep this amulet?
string: アミュレットはそのままもらっていいのか？

original: Where did these amulets come from?
string: それらのアミュレットの出どころは？

original: Depends on who you ask. Some say Molag-Bal himself gave these amulets to ancient powerful vampire lords. Some say this is just a myth.
string: 聞く相手によるね。モラグ・バルが大昔の有力な吸血鬼の王達に自らこのアミュレットを授けたという話もある。ただの神話にすぎないという人もいる

original: Harkon disbelieved in their existence, though perhaps he felt slighted they were not already in his possession and only feigns indifference.
string: ハルコン自身はその存在を疑ってるよ。でも多分、彼はアミュレットが自分のものではない事が気に食わないんだ。だから無関心を装ってるのさ

original: What do these amulets do?
string: そのアミュレットの効果は？

original: The amulets increase the effectiveness of your vampiric powers.
string: アミュレットは君の吸血鬼としての力を高めてくれるんだ

original: Is there anything I can do to help?
string: 何か手を貸せることはあるか？

original: I've located the last known resting place of a set of ancient Amulets of Night Power.
string: 太古の夜の力のアミュレット一式が眠る最後の場所が分かったぞ

original: They should be among our kind, not laying about unguarded for mortals to find.
string: 我々の同族が所有してるんだ。定命の者達の目につかないようにしっかり保管されているよ

original: I've located one of the lost ancient Amulets of Night Power.
string: 太古の夜の力のアミュレットのひとつがどこにあるか分かったぞ

original: It should be among our kind, not laying about unguarded for mortals to find.
string: 我々の同族が所有してるんだ。定命の者達の目につかないようにしっかり保管されているよ

original: Where did these rings come from?
string: それらの指輪の出どころは？

original: Depends on who you ask. Some say Molag-Bal himself gave these rings to ancient powerful vampire lords. Some say that is just a myth.
string: 聞く相手によるね。モラグ・バルが大昔の有力な吸血鬼の王達に自らこの指輪を授けたという話もある。ただの神話にすぎないという人もいる

original: Harkon himself disbelieved in their existence, though perhaps he felt slighted they were not already in his possession and only feigns indifference.
string: ハルコン自身はその存在を疑ってるよ。でも多分、彼は指輪が自分のものではない事が気に食わないんだ。だから無関心を装ってるのさ

original: Understood.
string: 分かった

original: Best of luck to you.
string: 幸運を祈るよ

original: Will I be able to keep these rings?
string: 指輪はそのままもらっていいのか？

original: Of course, I wouldn't be telling you where to find them if I desired them for myself.
string: もちろんさ。自分のものにするなら君にそれらのありかを教えてないよ

original: Of course, I wouldn't be telling you where to find it if I desired it for myself.
string: もちろんさ。自分のものにするなら君にそのありかを教えてないよ

original: Will I be able to keep the ring?
string: 指輪はそのままもらっていいのか？

original: What do these rings do?
string: その指輪の効果は？

original: They increase the abilities of your vampiric powers.
string: 君の吸血鬼としての力を高めてくれるんだ

original: I've collected all the Rings of Blood Magic.
string: 血の魔法の指輪をすべて集めた

original: Well done! I trust you'll put those to good use then.
string: よくやった！ 君ならきっと有効に利用してくれるはずだ

original: What can I do to help?
string: 何か手伝えることは？

original: I've discovered the whereabouts of a set of ancient Rings of Blood Magic.
string: 太古の血の魔法の指輪一式がどこにあるか分かったぞ

original: They belong among our kind, not gathering mold in some vagabond's treasure pile.
string: 我々の同族が所有してるんだ。放浪人の宝の山の中でカビを生やしたりなどしてないよ

original: I've discovered the whereabouts of one of the ancient Rings of Blood Magic.
string: 太古の血の魔法の指輪のひとつがどこにあるか分かったぞ

original: It belongs among our kind, not gathering mold in some vagabond's treasure pile.
string: 我々の同族が所有してるんだ。放浪人の宝の山の中でカビを生やしたりなどしてないよ

original: <Alias=Candidate> has been welcomed to the family.
string: <Alias=Candidate>が血を分けた家族となった

original: Very good. Should you visit him again, I suspect you'll find our new sibling appreciates his transformation.
string: 素晴らしい。彼に次会った時、我々の新しい同胞として自分に起こった変化を感謝してる事が分かるだろう

original: Very good. Should you visit her again, I suspect you'll find our new sibling appreciates her transformation.
string: 素晴らしい。彼女に次会った時、我々の新しい同胞として自分に起こった変化を感謝してる事が分かるだろう

original: Rrrraaaaahhhh!
string: イイィィヤァアー！

original: Yyyaaahh!
string: イイヤァー！

original: Grrah!
string: グラァー！

original: Yah!
string: ヤァ！

original: Die!
string: 死ね！

original: Yaahh!
string: ヤァー！

original: Gaaahh...
string: ぐうう…

original: Not... yet...
string: まだ… まだだ…

original: Not... like... this...
string: こんな… ふうには…

original: Gah...
string: ぐう…

original: Unf!
string: フン！

original: Hey, watch it!
string: ちょっと、気をつけて！

original: Hmph.
string: ふふん

original: Hey!
string: ちょっと！

original: Watch it!
string: 気をつけてよ！

original: What are you doing?
string: 何をするの？

original: Agh!
string: ああ！

original: Oof!
string: うわあ！

original: Son of a...
string: こんの…

original: Over here!
string: こっちだよ！

original: Hmm?
string: ふふん？

original: Yes?
string: はい？

original: You need something?
string: 何か必要なものが？

original: What is it?
string: 何？

original: Sorry, what?
string: ごめん、何？

original: What the... get back! Hurry!
string: あれは… 戻って！ 早く！

original: Got him!
string: 倒した！

original: To think... no one's been here in four thousand years...
string: ここに… 四千年もの間来た者がいないと思うと…

original: It's... it's true. It's all true! Come on, let's check it out!
string: 本物だ… まさしく本物だよ！ さあ、確かめよう！

original: Woah...
string: うわあ…

original: Beautiful. That crown... it's everything I could have hoped for.
string: 美しいね。あの王冠… 非の打ちどころがない

original: Beautiful. That staff... it's everything I could have hoped for.
string: 美しいね。あの杖… 非の打ちどころがない

original: Beautiful. That shield... it's everything I could have hoped for.
string: 美しいね。あの盾… 非の打ちどころがない

original: By forging something, of course!
string: もちろん、何かの鋳造によってね！

original: Go ahead. After everything you've done, you should do the honors.
string: さあ。これだけの事をしてくれたのだから、あんたがやるべきだよ

original: How do we do that?
string: そうするには、どうすれば？

original: I... I almost can't believe it. We did it! We actually did it!
string: ああ… 信じられないよ。やった！ 本当にやったんだ！

original: There's only one thing left to do. We have to prove this actually works. That this is the real Aetherium Forge.
string: する事はあと一つだけ。これが実際に動く、真のエセリウムの鋳造器具だと証明しなくちゃならない

original: I can hardly believe it. This is it. We've actually found the Forge! At last!
string: とても信じられない。これだよ。本当に鋳造器具を見つけたんだ！ ついに！

original: What do you make of all this?
string: これは、つまり…？

original: Go ahead, give it a try.
string: さあ、試してみて

original: Look at the device here - the gear in the center is just about the right size. Try putting the shards in and... we'll see what happens.
string: ここの機器を見て… 中心の歯車がちょうどいい大きさだね。破片をはめ込んでみて… どうなるか確かめてみよう

original: Yes, I have them. What now?
string: 持っている。それで？

original: You made it! And you've brought the shards!
string: やったね！ 破片を持ってきてくれたんだ！

original: We still have to find the Forge itself. I had a lead on that, too.
string: 鋳造器具自体を見つけないと。その手掛かりもつかんでいたんだ

original: There's so much to do. I'm going to head out and start tracking things down. We'll meet again, I'm sure of it.
string: やる事は山ほどある。出発して色々探し始めよう。また会おうね、必ずだよ

original: For the first time in a long while, I think I - we - may actually be able to do this. And... and I owe it all to you. Thank you.
string: この長い間で初めて、あたしが… あたし達が… 本当に成し遂げられる気がする。あんたのおかげだね。ありがとう

original: Then what?
string: その後は？

original: I had a map, in my journal. That's where we should start.
string: あたしの日記に地図があったわ。そこから始めるべきだね

original: We have to find the other pieces, of course. There should be, hmm... three more. One for each of the four cities that worked on the Forge.
string: もちろん、他の部分を見つけないと。そうだね、ふふん… あと3つだよ。鋳造器具を手掛けた4つの街それぞれに一つずつ

original: So... what now?
string: で、これからどうする？

original: My life's work. Unraveling one of the great mysteries of the dwarves.
string: あたしの一生の仕事だよ。ドワーフの偉大な謎の一つを解明する事

original: What are you talking about?
string: 何の話をしてるんだ？

original: Let me see it. ...Huh...
string: ちょっと見せて。…ふふん…

original: Look, on the edge here. This has been cut, precisely cut. If you had another piece, about the same size, it would... it would snap right in.
string: ここの縁を見て。正確に切断されている。もし、ほぼ同じ大きさの破片がもう一つあれば… ぴったりはまるはずだよ

original: I saw a drawing of this once. This shard... it's... it's part of a key. A key made of pure Aetherium! The key to the Forge!
string: これの絵を見た事があるよ。この破片は… 鍵の一部だよ。純粋なエセリウムからできた鍵！ 鋳造器具への鍵だ！

original: What? What is this?
string: 何だ？ 何だこれは？

original: So this is it...
string: これだね…

original: Got it!
string: やったね！

original: If all else fails, just take a chance, see what happens. Wouldn't be surprised if half the traps had been sprung by now...
string: 他がすべて失敗したら、いちかばちかやってみて、様子を見て。すでに罠の半分が作動していても不思議じゃない…

original: See if you can find a pattern in the sequence. Most of these locks have a pattern of some kind.
string: 順番にパターンがあるか確かめて。こういう鍵のほとんどは、ある種のパターンがあるよ

original: You might look around a bit. Maybe one of our predecessors still has a clue.
string: 少し見て回ったらどうかな。先に来た者達が手掛かりを残してるかも知れない

original: You could always go back and get my journal, you know.
string: 戻ってあたしの日記を取ってくる事はいつでもできるんだよ

original: Would you want me to? After what happened the last time I tried it?
string: そうしてほしい？ 前回あたしが挑戦した時に起きた事を知った上で？

original: I'll fight anything that can be fought. Beyond that... I don't want your death on my conscience.
string: 戦えるものとは何であろうと戦う。その先は… あんたを決して死なせたくはないよ

original: Are you going to help?
string: 手を貸してくれるか？

original: Beyond that... well, maybe one of our predecessors still has a clue.
string: その先は… そうだね、先に行った者達が手掛かりを残したかも知れない

original: Well, your loss...
string: まったく、残念だよ…

original: Hey! Journal?
string: ねえ！ 日記は？

original: Grab my journal, would you? We're going to need it.
string: あたしの日記を手に入れてくれない？ それが必要になるよ

original: ...this is where I ended up. It was... quite the fall.
string: …あたしの最後の場所だ。すごい落ちっぷりだったな…

original: Any advice?
string: 何か助言でも？

original: Hmm... well, you can pick up where I left off. My notes should still be in my journal, if you can read it.
string: ふふん… あたしの続きから始めればいいんだよ。もし読めれば、日記にまだメモがあるはず

original: Well, my notes were in my journal, but you didn't grab that, did you? Hmph.
string: あたしの日記にメモがあったんだよ、でも手に入れなかったようだね？ ふふん

original: ...Yeah. I thought I was prepared for anything. How can you prepare for a damned earthquake?
string: …ああ。備えは万全だと思っていた。でも地震に対してどう準備できる？

original: And that was just one trap! Look around! Who knows what else this thing is capable of?
string: しかもそれは罠の一つに過ぎなかったんだ！ 見回してごらんよ！ こいつら一体他に何をしてくるかな？

original: You mean... the earthquake?
string: 地震のこと？

original: Well, there's the Falmer, to start with. Deadly rapids. Major earthquakes. Massive chasms. Unstable ground. Lethal falls.
string: そうだね、まずはファルメル。そして命取りの急流。大地震。巨大な裂け目。不安定な地面。死をもたらす滝

original: And then you get to the real danger. We can discuss that when the time comes. If it comes.
string: 真の危険はそこからだよ。その時が来たら話し合おうじゃないか。その時が来れば、だけどね

original: Any dangers I should be aware of?
string: 用心すべき危険は？

original: It wasn't always like this. Best-preserved dwarven city I'd ever laid eyes on. And then... the earthquake hit.
string: ずっとこうだったわけじゃない。かつて見た中で最も保存状態のいいドワーフの都市だった。その後… 地震が起きたんだよ

original: Now... you'd be lucky to find a single room intact.
string: 今は… そのままの部屋が一つ見つかれば幸運だね

original: What happened to this place?
string: ここで何が起きたのか？

original: Now you decide to give up? Fine. I'll be here.
string: あきらめるわけ？ いいよ。あたしはここにいるから

original: No thanks.
string: いや、結構だ

original: Sure.
string: いいだろう

original: I'm not going to talk you out of it, am I? I know, I know. I was just like you, once.
string: やめるよう説得するのは無理そうかな？ 分かるよ。あたしも昔はあんたみたいだった

original: Well, if you want to reach the summit, you're going to need some help. You... want a hand?
string: まあ、辿り着きたければ手助けが必要だよ。手を… 貸そうか？

original: I won't give up that easily.
string: そう簡単にあきらめはしない

original: Get out of my way.
string: 邪魔をするな

original: I can handle myself. (Persuade)
string: 自分のことは自分でやれる(説得)

original: Hmph... maybe so. Then again, I thought I could, too.
string: ふふん… そうかもね。でも、あたしもできると思ったんだよ

original: Sure, that's what they all say.
string: 当然だね、誰もがそう言うよ

original: The name's Katria. I am - was - an adventurer. Raided ruins like this for nigh on twenty years.
string: あたしの名はカトリア。かつては… 冒険者だった。こういう遺跡をほぼ20年間暴いてきたよ

original: I was on the trail of something big. It led me here, and... I didn't make it.
string: ある大物を追っていたんだ。それでここにたどり着いて… 失敗した

original: Who are you?
string: お前は誰だ？

original: What are you still doing here?
string: まだここで何をしているの？

original: Let me guess. You're here for the treasure, aren't you? Just like all the others.
string: 当てて見せようか。宝が目的だね？ 他の皆と同じように

original: Turn back...
string: 引き返して…

original: What can you tell me about Dimhollow Crypt?
string: ディムホロウ墓地について聞かせてほしい

original: Brother Adalvald had been there not long ago. Said he found something of great importance.
string: アダルヴァルド修道士はほんの少し前にそこに行き、何かとても重大なものを発見したと言っていた

original: It must have been important to the vampires as well, for them to risk an open attack on the Vigilants.
string: 番人達に堂々と攻撃を仕掛ける危険を冒したとなると、吸血鬼達にとっても重要なものだったようだ

original: What was this place?
string: この場所は？

original: Are there other Vigilants out there?
string: 他にも番人はいるのか？

original: How did you survive the vampires' attack?
string: 吸血鬼の襲撃を生き延びられたのは？

original: I'll meet you in Dimhollow Crypt. I owe these vampires a debt of vengeance.
string: ディムホロウ墓地で合流しよう。吸血鬼どもに借りを返さないとな

original: I'm ready to be turned.
string: 変わる覚悟ができた

original: I promise to try and make this as painless as possible. Hold still.
string: なるべく痛くないようにいたしますわね。そのまま動かないで…

original: Let's just get it over with.
string: とにかくやってしまおう

original: As you wish.
string: かしこまりました

original: I understand.
string: わかった

original: Good.
string: いい返事ね

original: In that case, I'm glad you're the one doing it.
string: だとしたら、君に頼めたのは幸いだった

original: Let's not waste too much time, then.
string: でしたら時間を無駄にしすぎない方がいいですわね

original: I'm ready.
string: 準備はできてる

original: Turning someone is a very... personal thing for vampires. It's intimate. For us.
string: 誰かを変えるという事は… わたし達吸血鬼にとっては、とても特別な事ですの

original: I don't want you to feel like I'm forcing you into this.
string: 無理強いされていると思わないで下さいましね

original: You're right. Let me think about it.
string: そうだな。もう少し考えてみる

original: I understand. Take your time.
string: 分かりますわ。焦る必要はなくてよ

original: She actually did it... created a portal to the Soul Cairn. Incredible.
string: 母は本当に成し遂げた… ソウル・ケルンに通じる転移門を造り上げたのですわね。信じられませんわ

original: By the blood of my ancestors...
string: ああ、ご先祖様、なんて事ですの……

original: Let's get that portal open.
string: 転移門を開こう

original: All right. Here goes.
string: では始めますわ

original: We won't know until we find her.
string: 彼女を見つけなければ、何とも言えない

original: Yes... yes, you're right. I'm sorry. I just didn't expect anyone to care how I felt about her. Thank you.
string: ええ… その通りですわね。ごめんなさい。わたしの母に対する想いを気にしてくれる方がいらっしゃるなんて。ありがとう

original: Are we ready then?
string: さあ、用意はよろしくて？

original: It sounds like she was pretty selfish.
string: かなり身勝手な人だったようだな

original: She wasn't, always. But I think you're right.
string: 昔は違いましたのよ。でもその通りかも知れませんわね

original: She was practically smirking as we left home. Almost like she was proud of herself.
string: わたし達が家を出る時、母はにやついているようにさえ見えた。勝ち誇ったかのようでしたわ

original: Like she didn't want to just stop my father... she wanted to stick it to him, too.
string: 父を止めるだけでは飽き足りず、思い知らせてやりたかったかのような…

original: I don't know what she was thinking.
string: 何を考えてたんだか

original: Neither do I.
string: わたしもですわ

original: She always seemed happy, before we heard the prophecy. Then it all changed. She became a different person. They both did.
string: 予言を耳にするまではいつでも幸せそうだったのに、すべてが変わってしまった。母はまるで別人になった。両親とも変貌してしまったのです

original: It sounds like she did everything for your sake.
string: すべては君のためにやったんじゃないのか？

original: Possibly. I guess even a vampire mother is still a mother.
string: ですわね。吸血鬼の母親であっても、母親には変わりないのかも知れませんわ

original: She worried about me. About all of us. But she wanted to get me as far away from my father as possible before he really went over the edge.
string: 母はわたしの身を案じましたの。わたし達全員の身を。でも父が我慢の限界に達する前に、わたしを彼からなるべく遠くに離したがっていた

original: What will you do if we find your mother?
string: 母親が見つかったとしたら、どうする？

original: I've been asking myself the same thing since we came back to the castle.
string: お城に戻って以来、同じ事を自問してきましたわ

original: She was so sure of what we did to my father, I couldn't help but go along with her. I never thought of the cost.
string: 父に対してわたし達がした事を、母があまりにも確信をもってやっていたから、ついていくという発想しかありませんでしたわ。代償なんて考えもしなかった

original: I'm ready.
string: 準備はできてる

original: Okay, here goes.
string: さあ、行きますわよ

original: Can I ask you something first?
string: 先に一つ聞いていいか？

original: Of course. What is it?
string: もちろんですわ。どうしまして？

original: The ingredients are in the vessel.
string: 材料は器に入れた

original: Then the rest is up to me.
string: あとはわたし次第というわけですのね

original: Are you ready to go? I'm not entirely sure what this thing is going to do when I add my blood.
string: 準備はよくて？ わたしの血を加えた時に何がどうなるか、確証はございませんわよ

original: No... it's not working!
string: 違う… これでは駄目ですわ！

original: Fools.
string: 愚か者め

original: The bow! Use the bow!
string: 弓ですわ！ 弓を使って！

original: Break his shield! Hurry!
string: 盾を壊して！ 早く！

original: Quick, the bow!
string: 早く弓を！

original: Yeargh!
string: イイヤァ！

original: You were waiting... all this time for someone with my blood to come along.
string: 待っておりましたのね… ずっと、わたしの血を持つ誰かがやってくるのを

original: Well, too bad for you... I intend on keeping it. Let's see if your blood has any power to it!
string: でもお生憎様。これは渡しませんわよ。あなたの血の力がこれにも通用するかどうか、見てみましょうか！

original: A prophecy that lacked a single, final ingredient... the blood of a pure vampire. The blood of a Daughter of Coldharbour.
string: 予言を完成させる、最後の要素… 純粋なる吸血鬼の血液。コールドハーバーの娘の血液だ

original: The blood of a vampire... Auriel's Bow...
string: 吸血鬼の血… アーリエルの弓…

original: It... it was you? You created that prophecy?
string: あれは… あなたでしたの？ あなたがあの予言を創り出したと？

original: Auri-El himself may have been beyond my reach, but his influence on our world wasn't.
string: アーリエルは手の届かぬ存在だが、その力はこの世界に届いていた

original: All I needed was the blood of a vampire and his own weapon, Auriel's Bow.
string: 必要なものは吸血鬼の血液と、その武器であるアーリエルの弓だけだった

original: You want to take revenge... on a god?
string: 復讐がお望みなのかしら… 神に対して？

original: The moment I was infected by one of my own Initiates, Auri-El turned his back on me.
string: 弟子だった新人に感染させられたその瞬間から、アーリエルに見放されたのだ

original: I swore I'd have my revenge, no matter what the cost.
string: どんな犠牲を払ってでも、復讐を果たすと誓ったのだよ

original: You're... you're a vampire?
string: あなたは… 吸血鬼ですの？

original: But Auriel should have protected you...
string: でもアーリエルが守ってくれたはずですわよ…

original: Gelebor and his kind are easily manipulated fools.
string: ギレボルもその同胞も、流されやすい愚か者ばかりだ

original: Look into my eyes, Serana. You tell me what I am.
string: この目を見ろ、セラーナ。私は何者だ？

original: Until the "Betrayed" corrupted you. Yes, yes. We've heard this sad story.
string: “裏切られし者達”に堕落させられるまでは。あらまあ、その悲しいお話ならもう聞きましてよ

original: How dare you. I was the Arch-Curate of Auri-El, girl. I had the ears of a god!
string: 何のつもりだ。私はアーリエルの最高司祭だぞ。この耳は神の耳なのだ！

original: Enough, Vyrthur. Give us the bow!
string: もうよろしいですわ、ヴィルスール。弓をおよこしになって！

original: Well, at least we're getting closer. Let's go.
string: でも、少なくとも近づいてはいますわ。行きましょう

original: I've never been in those tunnels before, but I'd bet they run right under the courtyard and into the tower ruins.
string: このトンネルには入った事がありませんけど、中庭の下を通って塔の廃墟に通じている事は賭けてもよくてよ

original: Very clever, mother. Very clever.
string: 賢明ですわね、お母様。とても賢明ですわ

original: Then he just walled it off.
string: 彼は壁を作って丸ごと封じてしまったのか

original: It appears that way. I suppose he wanted to put the past behind him.
string: そのようですわね。過去を忘れたかったのかも知れない

original: Perhaps if he had spent more time with us, he would have recognized the beauty for himself.
string: もっとわたし達と一緒に過ごしていれば、その美しさを自分で理解できたでしょうに…

original: What happened to the castle courtyard?
string: 城の中庭で何が起きたんだ？

original: If I had to guess, I'd say the moment mother fled the castle, father went on a rampage.
string: わたしが予想するに、母が城から逃げ出した途端、父は乱心したのかも知れませんわ

original: Knowing him, anything at all that reminded him of her was just destroyed.
string: 父の性分を考えると、母を思い出させるあらゆる要素が破壊されたでしょうね

original: Everything's been torn down... the whole place looks... well, dead. It's like we're the first to set foot here in centuries.
string: 何もかもが破壊されてますわ… この場所全体がまるで… 死んでいるようですのよ。何世紀もの間、誰も足を踏み入れてなかったように見えますわね

original: We've made it to the courtyard.
string: 中庭にたどりつきましてよ

original: Oh no...
string: ああ、なんて事かしら…

original: I used to walk through here after evening meals. It was beautiful, once.
string: 夕食のあと、よくここを散歩したものですわ。当時はなんとも美しい場所でしたのよ

original: Wait...
string: お待ちになって…

original: Something's wrong with the moondial here. Some of the crests are missing and the dial is askew.
string: ここの月時計は何かおかしいですわ。クレストがいくつかなくなっていますし、時計自体も傾いてますのよ

original: I didn't even know the crests could be removed. Maybe my mother's trying to tell us something?
string: クレストが取り外せるなんて知りませんでしたわ。ひょっとして母は私達に何かを伝えようとしてるのかしら？

original: This was my mother's garden. It... do you know how beautiful something can be when it's tended by a master for hundreds of years?
string: ここは母の庭園でしたのよ。そうですわね… 名人が何百年も手掛けたものがどれほど美しくなるか、想像がつきまして？

original: She would have hated to see it like this.
string: 母がこの様子を目にしたら悲しんだでしょうね

original: This used to lead into the castle's great hall. It looks like my father had it sealed up.
string: 以前ここは城の大広間に通じておりましたのよ。どうやら父が封印したようですわね

original: What happened to this place?
string: ここで一体何がありましたの？

original: That's why we're headed there?
string: それが、そこに向かっている理由なのか？

original: She had to be up to something in that garden. I'm hoping it's a clue that will tell us where she went.
string: 母はあの庭で何かをしていたはずですわ。それが母の居場所を見つける手掛かりになればいいですわね

original: But then it all changed.
string: でもすべてが変わってしまった、と

original: It was very sudden. It was almost like one day we were a normal family, and then the next I didn't know who they were.
string: 本当に突然でしたの。普通の家族が1日経つと赤の他人同士… そんな感じでしたわ

original: I'd try to visit my mother in the garden, and she'd quickly shoo me away saying she was much too busy.
string: 庭園にいる母のところへ行こうとしましたの。すると彼女は忙しいと言ってわたしをすぐ追い払ったのですわ

original: So you always got along?
string: ずっと仲良かったのか？

original: Like the best of friends. I would never hesitate to share anything with her.
string: 親友みたいな存在でしたわ。母となら何でも話し合えた

original: Were you and Valerica close?
string: ヴァレリカとは親しかったのか？

original: Before my father became obsessed with the prophecy, mother and I spent quite a bit of time together.
string: 父が予言にとりつかれる前は、わたしと母は一緒にいる事が多かった

original: She was very fond of her alchemical garden in the castle courtyard. She taught me quite a bit about cultivating quality reagents.
string: 母はお城の中庭にある錬金術用の庭園がとても好きでしたわ。わたしに質のいい試薬の作り方を色々教えてくれましたのよ

original: But now... we have a clue. Something made by the Forge. Something that can lead us to it.
string: でも今は… 手掛かりがある。鋳造器具で作られた何か。それに私達を導いてくれる何かがね

original: To what end?
string: 何のために？

original: I don't know. Certainly not longevity. Kind of a waste of time for a vampire.
string: 分かりませんわ。長寿の研究ではなさそうですわね。吸血鬼にとっては無用の長物ですし

original: What did she research?
string: 研究の内容は？

original: Looking at the equipment and materials, it looks like she was trying to advance her necromancy.
string: 器具や素材を見る限り、死霊術を掘り下げようとしていたようですわね

original: Your mother maintained quite a laboratory.
string: 彼女の研究室は、かなり本格的みたいだ

original: I had no idea that her laboratory even existed.
string: 研究所があったなんて存じませんでしたわ

original: She had an alchemy setup in her drawing room, but nothing that even comes close to what's here.
string: 客間に錬金術の道具を置いてはいましたけれど、ここにあるものとは比較になりませんのよ

original: Fools? Why do you say that?
string: 愚かな者たち？ どうしてそう思う？

original: Because most of the stories end with the Ideal Masters duping the necromancers, who end up dead or wishing they were dead.
string: 話のほとんどではアイディール・マスター達に出し抜かれた死霊術師達が、死んだり、いっそ死にたいと思ったりする結末でしたから

original: Then how are you sure they even exist?
string: だとしたら、どうしてそいつらが実在すると確信がもてる？

original: I've read stories. Stories about fools that managed to... communicate with them.
string: 色々な話を読みましたわ。彼らとの… 疎通を成功させた愚かな者達の話を

original: You give the Ideal Masters souls, they give you powers to summon the undead. It's all very business-like.
string: アイディール・マスター達に魂を捧げれば、アンデッドを呼び出す力を授けてくれる。まるで商取引のように

original: What exactly are the Ideal Masters?
string: アイディール・マスターとはいったい？

original: Nobody really knows.
string: 誰も本当の事を知りませんわ

original: As far as I've heard, no one's seen them and returned to Tamriel to tell about it.
string: 聞いた限りでは、それらを目にしてタムリエルに戻れた者はいないようですけれども

original: Why was your mother so fascinated by it?
string: 母親がそこまで固執した理由は？

original: Honestly, I don't know. Necromancers are always interested in souls, though, so that probably has some kind of interest.
string: 正直分かりませんけど、死霊術師は誰でも魂をほしがりますから、同様の何かがあるのかも知れませんわね

original: Anything you can tell me about the Soul Cairn?
string: ソウル・ケルンについて聞かせてほしい

original: The Soul Cairn is a tiny sliver of Oblivion, the realm of the daedra.
string: ソウル・ケルンはデイドラの領域であるオブリビオンの、ほんのひとかけらですわ

original: It's ruled by unseen beings known as the Ideal Masters.
string: そこはアイディール・マスターと呼ばれる不可視の存在達が支配する場所ですの

original: Feel free to poke around the fort and take what you need. There isn't much yet, but you're welcome to anything you can use.
string: 好きなだけ砦を散策して、必要なものがあったら持っていってくれ。大したものはないかも知れないが、使えそうなら何だっていい

original: Yes, a crossbow. Best thing for killing vampires. Just take a few shots at those crates over there.
string: ああ、クロスボウだ。吸血鬼退治には最適だよ。あそこにある木箱を狙ってちょっと撃ってみろ

original: Uh, crossbow? I've never...
string: クロスボウかい？ 俺なんか一度も…

original: Don't worry, I think we can make a Dawnguard out of you. Here, take this crossbow and let's see how you shoot.
string: 大丈夫だ。我々が君を立派なドーンガードにしてやろう。ほら、このクロスボウでちょっと腕前を見せてくれ

original: "My pa's axe", Stendarr preserve us.
string: “私の父親の斧”だ。ステンダールが我々を守って下さる

original: Uh, my weapon? I mostly just use my pa's axe, when wolves are attacking the goats or something.
string: 武器？ 親父の斧だよ。ヤギが狼に襲われた時なんかに使うぐらいさ

original: Didn't I tell you to step forward? Hmm... Farm boy, eh? What's your weapon?
string: 前に出ろと言わなかったか？ ふむ… 農民の子か？ お前の武器は何だ？

original: Yes, si... Isran.
string: 分かりました閣下… いえ… イスラン

original: Do I look like a "sir" to you, boy? I'm not a soldier, and you're not joining the army.
string: 私の事を“サー”とでも呼びたいのか、新人君？ 私は兵士ではないし、君が入隊する予定もない

original: I'm, uh... my name is Agmaer, sir.
string: 俺は… いえ、私の名前はアグミルです

original: You there, boy. Stop skulking in the shadows and step up here. What's your name?
string: おい、そこの若いの。影でコソコソするのはやめて姿を見せろ。名前は？

original: I'll have to think about it.
string: 考えさせてくれ

original: While you're thinking about it, the vampires will be gathering strength in the shadows, waiting to strike.
string: 君がそれについて考えている間に、吸血鬼達は闇の中で力を蓄え、襲撃の時を待っている事だろう

original: I'm going to Dimhollow Crypt. Perhaps I can be of some small assistance to you.
string: ディムホロウ墓地に向かう事にする。少しは助力できるかもな

original: I know what you think of us. You think we're soft, that we're cowards. You think our deaths proved our weakness.
string: 考えている事は分かる。我々が弱腰の臆病者で、弱いからこそ死んだのだと

original: Stendarr grant that you do not have to face the same test and be found wanting.
string: そちらが同じ試練にさらされ、力不足が判明しないよう、ステンダールのご加護あれ

original: You Vigilants were never trained for...
string: 君達番人はまったく訓練を受けてないな…

original: Tolan, I don't think that's a good idea.
string: トラン、それはいいアイデアとは思えないが

original: I'll meet you at Dimhollow. It's the least I can do to avenge my fallen comrades.
string: ディムホロウで待ち合わせよう。倒れた仲間達の仇を討つくらいはやらせてほしい

original: That's good enough for me. Go see what the vampires were looking for in this Dimhollow Crypt. With any luck, they'll still be there.
string: 私にとっては好都合だ。吸血鬼どもがディムホロウ墓地で何を探していたのか確かめようじゃないか。運がよければ、奴らはまだそこにいるはずだ

original: Yes, that's it. Dimhollow Crypt. Brother Adalvald was sure it held some long-lost vampire artifact of some kind.
string: ああ、そうとも。ディムホロウ墓地。アダルヴァルド修道士はそこにはるか昔の吸血鬼の秘宝か何かがあると確信していた

original: We didn't listen to him any more than we did Isran. He was at the Hall when it was attacked...
string: イスラン同様、ろくに耳を貸さなかったよ。番人の間が襲われた時に、そこにいた…

original: Tolan, tell him about, what was it, Dimhollow?
string: トラン、彼にあの事を教えてやれ。あの… ディムホロウだったかな？

original: Tolan, tell her about, what was it, Dimhollow?
string: トラン、彼女にあの事を教えてやれ。あの… ディムホロウだったかな？

original: What can I do to help?
string: 何か手伝えることは？

original: I need someone out in the field, taking the fight to the damn vampires, while we're getting the fort back into shape...
string: 我々が砦を再建してる間に、外の世界で吸血鬼達に戦いを挑む者が必要なんだ

original: I was just looking around. What is this place?
string: 見張りでもしているのか？ ここは？

original: Why do I even post guards? This is the headquarters of the Dawnguard. Well, it used to be, a long time ago.
string: なぜ見張りを立てる必要がある？ ここはドーンガードの本部だ。まあ、少なくとも昔はそうだった

original: As you can see, we have some work to do to restore it to its former glory. But maybe you want to help me with that?
string: ご覧の様に、過去の栄光を取り戻すのは大仕事になる。だが君も協力してくれるのだろう？

original: I heard you were looking for vampire hunters.
string: 吸血鬼ハンターを募集していると聞いた

original: You heard right. I'm glad word's finally starting to get around. But that means it won't be long before the vampires start to take notice as well.
string: 君の聞いた話は本当だ。いい噂がやっと広まり始めたようだな。だがそれは同時に、噂が吸血鬼の耳に入るのも時間の問題だという事を意味する

original: I'm here to join the Dawnguard.
string: ドーンガードの一員になりたくて来た

original: Got a fire in your belly to kill vampires, eh? Good for you.
string: 吸血鬼と戦いたくてうずうずしてるのか？ 結構な事だ

original: But look around - there's really not much to join yet. I've only just started rebuilding the order.
string: しかし現状を見てくれ。まだ君を受け入れる準備ができていない。組織の再建を始めてまだ間もないからな

original: Yes, well... I never wanted any of this to happen. I tried to warn all of you... I am sorry, you know.
string: ああ… こんな事は望んでなかった。君達みんなに警告しようとしたんだが…  すまなかった

original: Isran, Carcette is dead. The Hall of the Vigilants... everyone... they're all dead. You were right, we were wrong. Isn't that enough for you?
string: イスラン、カルセッテは死んだ。番人の間で… 全員死んだ。お前が正しく、我々が間違っていた。それ以上何を求める？

original: And now that you've stirred up the vampires against you, you come begging for my protection?
string: 吸血鬼達を自分で怒らせたくせに、私に守ってほしいと言うのか？

original: I remember Keeper Carcette telling me repeatedly that Fort Dawnguard is a crumbling ruin, not worth the expense and manpower to repair.
string: 番人のカルセッテが何度も言ってたな。ドーンガード砦は廃墟寸前だから、人と金を使って修復する価値はないって

original: And now you want to come running to safety with the Dawnguard, is that it?
string: ドーンガードに守ってほしいというわけか？

original: You know why I'm here. The Vigilants are under attack everywhere. The vampires are much more dangerous than we believed.
string: ここに来た理由は分かるだろう。番人達がそこら中で襲われている。吸血鬼らは我々が思っていたよりもはるかに危険な存在だ

original: Why are you here, Tolan? The Vigilants and I were finished with each other a long time ago.
string: なぜここにいるんだ、トラン？ 番人と私の関係はずっと昔に切れたはずだぞ

original: Isran will decide if you've got what it takes. Go on, he's right inside.
string: 使いものになるかどうかはイスランが見極める。入れ。彼は中にいる

original: So who are you? What do you want?
string: 君は誰だ？ 望みは何だ？

original: Well? Ready to join the fight against the damn vampires?
string: 忌々しい吸血鬼達と戦う覚悟はできたのかな？

original: New recruits? Hmm.
string: 新入りだと？ ほう

original: Here to join the Dawnguard? Good.
string: ドーンガードに入りたい？ いい心がけだ

original: Where is everybody? This place looks almost deserted.
string: みんなどこにいるんだろう？ まるで人影がないように見えるけど

original: You've probably killed lots of vampires, huh? I'm sure Isran will sign you right up. Not sure he'll take me. I hope so.
string: 吸血鬼をいっぱい退治したんだね？ きっとイスランに取り立ててもらえるよ。俺もそうなるといいなあ

original: That must be it. Fort Dawnguard... Wow. Bigger than I expected.
string: きっとあれがドーンガード砦だよ… うわあ、思ってたより大きいなあ

original: Hey, uh, don't tell Isran I was afraid to meet him by myself. Not the best first impression for a new vampire hunter, I guess.
string: なあ、俺が1人で会うのを怖がってたって事、イスランには言わないでくれよ。吸血鬼ハンター志願者としちゃ、あんまりいい印象与えないだろうからね

original: Truth is, I'm a little nervous. I've never done anything like this before. I hope you don't mind if I walk up with you.
string: 正直、ちょっとビビってるんだ。何しろこういうのは初めてだから。一緒に行っても構わないかな？

original: Oh, hey there! You here to join the Dawnguard, too?
string: やあ、あんた！ あんたもドーンガードに入るのかい？

original: Sorry, I'm not interested.
string: すまないが、興味はない

original: That's what everybody says, right up until they find their throat being ripped out by a pack of hungry vampires.
string: みんなそう言うんだ。飢えた吸血鬼の一団に喉笛を食い千切られるまではな

original: Killing vampires? Where do I sign up?
string: 吸血鬼退治か。加入するにはどうすれば？

original: Ha. Isran's going to like you. He's up the hill in the fort. He'll decide if you're Dawnguard material.
string: ふっ、イスランに気に入られそうだな。彼は丘の上の砦にいる。ドーンガードにふさわしいかどうか、見てくれるだろう

original: Ha. Isran's going to like you. Go talk to him at Fort Dawnguard, southeast of Riften. He'll decide if you're Dawnguard material.
string: ふっ、イスランに気に入られそうだな。リフテンの南東にあるドーンガード砦にいるから会ってみるといい。ドーンガードにふさわしいかどうか、見てくれるだろう

original: Vigilants? Dawnguard? What are you talking about?
string: 番人だのドーンガードだの、意味がわからない

original: I haven't noticed any vampire menace.
string: 吸血鬼の脅威は特に感じていないが

original: You're not paying attention then. Like most everyone else around here.
string: まわりを見ていないんだな。ここらにいる連中はほとんどがそうだが

original: Haven't you heard that the Hall of the Vigilants was destroyed by vampires? They never took the threat seriously, and now they've paid the price.
string: 番人の間が吸血鬼達に壊滅させられた話は聞いてないのか？ 奴らの脅威を甘く見ていた代償が高くついたな

original: What's the Dawnguard?
string: ドーンガードとは？

original: We're vampire hunters. We search out and destroy those bloodsucking scum wherever we find them.
string: 我々は吸血鬼ハンターを使命としている。あの化け物どもがどこにいようと、探しだして排除する

original: You there. The Dawnguard is looking for anyone willing to fight against the growing vampire menace. What do you say?
string: そこのあんた。ドーンガードは増しつつある吸血鬼の脅威と戦う気のある者は誰でも受け入れている。興味はあるか？

original: Changed your mind, huh? The Dawnguard could use somebody like you.
string: 気が変わったんだな？ あんたならドーンガードの一員として活躍できるかもな

original: Yeah? You change your mind? The Dawnguard could use somebody like you.
string: おっ？ 気が変わったのか？ あんたならドーンガードの一員として活躍できるかもな

original: I'm ready to be soul trapped.
string: 魂縛を受ける用意ができた

original: I promise to make this as painless as possible. Hold still.
string: なるべく痛くないようにいたしますわね。そのまま動かないで…

original: Let's just get this over with.
string: とにかくやってしまおう

original: As you wish.
string: かしこまりました

original: Don't worry about it.
string: 心配いらない

original: Oh. Good.
string: あら。そうですのね

original: I trust you completely.
string: 全面的に信頼している

original: Thank you.
string: ありがとう

original: Let's not waste any more time then.
string: でしたら、そろそろ本題に移らないといけませんわね

original: I'm ready.
string: 準備はできてる

original: I know this is difficult for you. I hope you trust me.
string: 難しい決断なのは分かりますわ。信じてくれるといいのですけれど

original: I'd never do anything that could hurt you.
string: あなたを傷つけるような事はしたくありませんわ

original: You're right. Let me think about it.
string: そうだな。もう少し考えてみる

original: I understand. Take your time.
string: 分かりますわ。焦る必要はなくてよ

original: Soul trap me. I won't feel right as a vampire.
string: 魂縛をかけてほしい。吸血鬼になったら自分に納得ができなくなりそうだ

original: Are you sure? I'm willing to do it, but you need to think it through.
string: 本当ですの？ わたしはよろしいけれど、しっかり考えた方がよくてよ

original: You'll remain mortal, but you'll find yourself weakened within the Soul Cairn.
string: 定命の体は変わりませんけれども、ソウル・ケルン内では力が弱くなってしまうでしょうね

original: Wouldn't that kill me?
string: 死んでしまったりしないのか？

original: My mother taught me a trick or two. I could partially soul trap you, and offer that gem to the Ideal Masters. It might be enough to satisfy them.
string: 母にいくつか教わりましたの。あなたに部分的な魂縛をかけて、その魂石をアイディール・マスター達に捧げる手がございますわ。それで満足してくれるかも知れませんわよ

original: It would make you a bit weaker when we travel through the Soul Cairn, but we might be able to fix that once we're inside. Maybe.
string: ソウル・ケルンを通る際に力が弱まってしまうかも知れませんが、中に入ってから解決方法が見つかるかも知れませんわ。その保証はありませんけど

original: What was the Hall of the Vigilants?
string: 番人の間とは？

original: Dimhollow Crypt. Brother Adalvald thought it contained some long-lost vampire artifact. It seems he was right.
string: ディムホロウ墓地か。あそこにはるか昔の吸血鬼の秘宝があるとアダルヴァルド修道士は考えていたみたいだが、その通りだったようだ

original: The Hall of the Vigilants is in ruins, my brothers and sisters dead or scattered.
string: 番人の間は荒れ果て、仲間達は死んだり散り散りになったりしてしまった

original: The vampires are much more dangerous than we ever dreamed. The Dawnguard is the only hope now.
string: 吸血鬼達は想像よりはるかに大きな脅威だ。残された希望はもはやドーンガードだけ

original: Isran was right all along. We should have listened to his warnings. It's too late for the Vigilants now.
string: イスランの言っていた事は正しかった。彼の警告に耳を貸すべきだった。番人達はもはや手遅れだよ

original: You wouldn't dare. Now shut up and keep on watch.
string: あなたには無理よ。さあ黙って警戒を続けなさい

original: And I have half a mind to tell Lokil of your disloyalty.
string: 半ば、ロキルにお前の不実を伝えたくなってくるよ

original: I wish Lokil would hurry it up. I have half a mind to return to the castle and tell Harkon what a fool he's entrusted this mission to.
string: ロキルが急いでくれないかしら。城に戻ってハルコンに彼がどれほどの間抜けにこの仕事を任せたか教えたいぐらいよ

original: All this talk is making me thirsty. Perhaps another Vigilant will wander in soon.
string: しゃべってばかりで喉が渇いてきた。また番人が迷い込んでこないものか

original: Ha. Those two deserved what they got. Their arrogance had become insufferable.
string: ハッ、あの二人の傲慢ぶりには耐えがたくなっていたわ。当然の報いよ

original: He fought well though. Jeron and Bresoth were no match for him.
string: 奮戦していたがな。ジェロンとブレソスは歯が立たなかった

original: To come in here alone... a fool like all the rest of them.
string: ここに一人で来るのは… 他の皆と同じ愚か者よ

original: Well, well. You made it. Good. Isran's in the fort. He'll get you sorted out.
string: おお、無事に着いたか。イスランは砦にいる。話せば色々分かるはずだ
