original: Was it "Having the adoration of thousands..." No, wait. I could make it "the adoration of tens of thousands."
string: 「数千人の歓呼を受けて」… いや、待った。「数万人」と書いたかも知れない

original: Damn it. How could I be so foolish?
string: クソったれが。おれの大馬鹿野郎が

original: Was it "Between the forces of good and evil."? No, no... that's not it...
string: 「善と悪のはざま」？ 違う、違うぞ… 何だったっけかな…

original: Did I start with my ride on the prison ship, or was it before that?
string: 冒頭は護送船に乗るところからだったか、その前だったかな？

original: "And without any regard for my safety, I fearless charged the enemy!" No, much too dramatic...
string: 「そして、身の危険も顧みず、恐れる事なく敵に立ち向かう！」 いや、ドラマチックすぎるかな…

original: I can't believe I lost those pages.
string: あの原稿を失くすなんて、おれは一体何だってどうして

original: How about a sample? (Persuade)
string: 味見をさせてもらえないか？(説得)

original: Since it's your first time... sure. Find a booth and enjoy.
string: まあ、ここは初めてみたいだし… いいわ。空いてる部屋を見つけて楽しんで

original: Well... so long as you don't tell anyone. Here take it and slip into a booth before someone notices.
string: いいけど… 内緒だからね。ほら、これを持って、他の人に見られないうちに部屋に入って

original: How about you pay for your habit like everybody else. We're not running a charity here.
string: 他の人と同じように、お金を払って楽しんだらどう？ 慈善事業じゃないのよ

original: Be sure to enjoy some of our Redwater Skooma before you leave.
string: レッドウォーターのスクゥーマを試していかなきゃ損するわよ

original: Don't leave, you'd have better dreams here...
string: 帰る前に、いい夢見ていきなさいよ…

original: Fine, suit yourself.
string: そう、ご自由に

original: Ah, welcome, welcome! I don't believe we've seen you here before, have we? You can buy from me, then join any booth you'd like.
string: ああ、いらっしゃい！ ここは初めてでしょう？ まずは買い物をしてね。部屋に入りたいなら、その後よ

original: You seem tense. Join a booth and relax a bit. Or did you need another fix?
string: 緊張してるみたいね。部屋に入ってリラックスしたら。それとも、もう一本イっとく？

original: Go on downstairs. You're bothering me.
string: さっさと下の階に下りろ。目障りだ

original: Hey there, friend. If you're looking for a fix, you're at the right place. Just head on down the trap door.
string: あら、こんにちは。一服していくならここよ。落とし戸から入ってちょうだい

original: I got nothing on me. If you're looking for Skooma, head on downstairs.
string: 私は何も持ってないわ。スクゥーマがほしいなら、下へ行ってよ

original: If you're buying, go on in. Otherwise, shove off.
string: 買い物に来たなら入って。それ以外なら、さっさと消えて

original: You here for the Skooma? Head around inside, there's a trap door that'll lead you in.
string: スクゥーマがほしいのか？ じゃあ横手に回って中に入れ。落とし戸の奥に部屋がある

original: Look, I'm just here to keep watch. What you're looking for is down inside.
string: なあ、俺はただの見張りなんだ。あんたの探してるものは中にある

original: If you're here for business, go ahead. Otherwise, get lost.
string: 仕事があるなら構わないが、そうじゃなきゃ消えな

original: Wha- who... you're that one from Helgen. Barely made it out of there myself. I hurt my back and I- I just need something for the pain.
string: あんたは… ヘルゲンから来た例の人だな。あそこから何とか抜け出せたけど、背中を痛めてね… 痛み止めがほしいんだよ

original: I ain't in the mood to talk. Ohhhh...
string: 今は話をする気分じゃない。ああ…

original: You there, bring me another bottle of skooma... wait, who are you? You look like fun. Pull up a seat friend.
string: そこのあなた、スクゥーマのビンをもう1本… 待った、あなたは誰です？ 面白そうですね。一緒に座りませんか

original: Ohhh... that's good stuff. Believe me friend, I've tried it all and this is the best.
string: ふむう… 上物ですね。冗談抜きであらゆる種類を試しましたが、これが最高です

original: I once paid 3000 gold for this fungus that grows in giants armpits. Couldn't stand up for days, but no where as good as this stuff.
string: 前に、巨人の脇の下に生えるというキノコに3000ゴールド払いましたよ。何日も立ち上がれなくなった上に、味もこれの足元には及びませんでした

original: If my friends could try this Redwater Skooma they might finally understand why I like slumming it with you commoners.
string: 友人連中にこのレッドウォーター・スクゥーマを味見させられれば、私があなた達と共にこうして遊ぶ理由を分かってもらえるのですが…

original: Head on in and behave yourself.
string: 中に入るなら妙な気は起こすなよ？

original: Hey, where are you going. I need those pages!
string: おい、どこへ行くんだ。その原稿が必要なんだ！

original: At this rate, my first volume will be complete. Don't give up.
string: この調子でいけば、第一巻が復元される日も近い。諦めるなよ

original: Thanks again for searching. I don't know what I'd do without my pages.
string: 探してくれてありがとう。原稿がなかったら、どうなっていた事か

original: Now, where was I...
string: さて、続きはどこからだったか…

original: Leaving huh? Good. Maybe I can get some work done.
string: 行くのか？ そうか。これでやっと仕事に集中できるよ

original: Good riddance.
string: 寂しいなんて思っちゃいないんだからな

original: You did it! You have all of my pages!
string: やってくれたか！ 原稿を見つけたんだな！

original: That's over half of the pages found. Keep it up!
string: もう半分以上見つけたのか。いいぞいいぞ！

original: Half the pages, eh? You're getting there.
string: 原稿の半分、とな？ その調子で頑張ってくれ

original: Still over half the pages are missing. Keep trying.
string: まだ原稿は半分残ってる。頑張って探してくれ

original: Any luck finding my pages yet?
string: 原稿は見つかったか？

original: You again? I thought it was clear I was busy.
string: また来たのか？ こう見えておれは忙しいんだぞ

original: Huh? What do you want?
string: ん？ 何しに来たんだ？

original: I'll be off then.
string: それでは、先を急ぐか

original: Oh, wait a moment. Here, I want you to have these before you go.
string: ああっと、待ってくれ。これを持っていってくれないか

original: A pristine copy of my first volume. Only one in print, actually.
string: これぞ第一巻の初版本。印さつされたものは、なんとこの1冊だけ

original: And take this as well. Seeing as Saint Jiub has ascended to pure spiritual form, I won't need it any longer.
string: それと、こいつもくれてやろう。この聖ジウブが真の精霊に姿を変えた以上、もう必要のないものだ

original: So now what?
string: お次は？

original: Now, volume two begins! What else?
string: さあ第二巻だ！ 始めるっきゃないだろ？

original: Here's all of the pages.
string: ページはこれで全部だ

original: Finally! I never thought I'd see these again.
string: やっとか！ もう戻らないかと思ってた

original: These pages meant the world to me. Thank you!
string: この原稿はおれの全てなんだ。ありがとう！

original: So what ended up happening to you?
string: どういう流れで監獄に？

original: They tried me for murder, threw me on a prison ship and sent me to the jail in Vivec City.
string: 殺人容疑で裁判にかけられ、護送船でヴィベク・シティにある監獄に送られたよ

original: Gave me a lot of time to think, that's for sure.
string: ありあまる時間の中で、色々と考えるなどしてみた

original: Rival assassin?
string: 対立関係にある暗殺者？

original: Exactly.
string: その通りでございます、ってね

original: He got to my target first and called the guard to cover his tracks. By the time I got there, the place was on alert.
string: あいつはターゲットを殺すと、衛兵を呼んで自分の痕跡を消そうとした。到着した時には、現場は厳戒態勢だった

original: Walked right into a trap, and didn't even realize it until I was captured.
string: 罠のど真ん中に飛び込んだわけだよ。捕まるまでちっとも気づかなかった

original: How'd you get caught?
string: どうして捕まったんだ？

original: I finally bit off more than I could chew.
string: 調子にのって、とうとうやりすぎちまったわけだ

original: I was paid to assassinate some high-ranking official from House Redoran.
string: おれはレドラン家の高官を暗殺する仕事を引き受けた

original: What I didn't know is someone had hired the Morag Tong to kill him as well.
string: 他の奴が、同じ高官を暗殺するためにモラグ・トングを雇ったとも知らずに

original: What did you do?
string: 何をした？

original: I murdered others for money. And before you think I belonged to some romantic or secretive guild, think again.
string: 金のために人も殺った。何かロマンチックな秘密結社の類に属していたと思うなら、それは大間違い

original: I was simply an addict who needed money for skooma. The stuff wasn't cheap, and murder always seemed to be in demand.
string: 単にスクゥーマをキメてて、そのための金がほしかっただけ。安いものではなかったし、殺し屋はいつの時代も食いっぱぐれないもんだ

original: You said you were in prison?
string: 投獄されていたと？

original: That was a dark time in my life. I did a lot of things I ended up regretting.
string: 人生最悪の時期だった。後悔しか残らない事をいくつもしでかしたもんだよ

original: Maybe that's why I worked so hard to redeem myself once I was freed.
string: 脱獄した後、あれほど熱心に働いたのはその償いのためだろうな

original: Were you successful?
string: うまくいったのか？

original: Indeed I was. I hunted down and killed every last one of them. Took years.
string: その通り。奴らを最後の1匹まで追い詰め、皆殺しにしたのである。何年もかけてな

original: The people of Morrowind were so grateful to have the roads safer again, they took to calling me "Saint Jiub" and then the other names followed.
string: モロウウィンドの人々は、安全に街道を歩けるようになって喜んでくれた。その功績を讃えられ、“聖ジウブ”などと呼ばれるようになったってわけだ

original: What was your campaign against them?
string: 彼らに対する戦いは？

original: After I was freed from prison, I decided to turn my life around. Give something back to the people of Morrowind.
string: 牢屋を出てから、人生を変えようと思い立ったんだ。モロウウィンドの人々のためになる事がしたくてね

original: It became quickly apparent that the best way I could help would be by wiping out the cliff racers.
string: どうすりゃいいかはすぐに分かった。クリフ・レーサーを壊滅させるのが一番だって

original: Winged Menace?
string: 羽根のある敵？

original: Yes. I'm speaking of the Cliff Racer of course. Wretched things.
string: そう。言うまでもなく、クリフ・レーサーの事だ。忌々しい連中だったな

original: They used to criss-cross the skies over Morrowind like vermin. Nasty flying creatures with a habit of sneaking up on the unwary.
string: 奴らは害虫のようにモロウウィンドの空を飛びまわり、不用心な人を襲う事で忌み嫌われていた

original: How did you earn your nicknames?
string: 二つ名の数々の由来は？

original: Ah, yes. Saint Jiub, Jiub the Eradicator, Jiub the Magnificent... I've earned a lot of those titles thanks to my campaign against the Winged Menace.
string: そうだ。聖ジウブ、根絶者ジウブ、偉大なるジウブ… この種の名をほしいままにしたものだ。羽根のある敵との戦いで活躍したおかげでな

original: Where were you captured?
string: どこで捕まったんだ？

original: I had just moved from my ancestral home in Morrowind to the continent of Cyrodiil.
string: 祖先から受け継いだモロウウィンドの土地を離れ、シロディール大陸に渡ってきたばかりの時だ

original: I settled in the city of Kvatch to write my memoirs and to find some peace and quiet.
string: おれはクヴァッチの街に住んで、手記を書きながら静かに暮らそうと思っていた

original: What ended up happening?
string: 結局どうなったんだ？

original: Well, I don't know. Everything seemed fine until that dremora attacked me. I only heard later about the gates from the other souls.
string: さあてね。あのドレモラに襲われるまでは、何の問題もなかったんだ。あとになって、他の連中から門の話を聞いただけだ

original: I can only assume the gates have been closed by now.
string: とうに門は閉じているとは思うけどね

original: Why was Dagon able to do this?
string: デイゴンはどうしてそんなことを？

original: All I heard is that without a Septim sitting on the throne of the Empire, the Dragonfires in a place called the Temple of the One were no longer lit.
string: よくは知らんが、セプティムが玉座にいなければ、最高神の神殿という場所にあるドラゴンファイアが消えるとかいう話を聞いた

original: This meant that we were vulnerable to the forces of Oblivion.
string: そうなりゃ、オブリビオンからの攻撃を防ぐ手段はないわな

original: That was... a bit before my time.
string: それは… しばらく前の話だな

original: Has it been that long? Oh my.
string: そんなに長く？ そりゃあ大変だねえ

original: Well, it started with the followers of Mehrunes Dagon having Emperor Uriel Septim VII assassinated.
string: 事の起こりは、メエルーンズ・デイゴンの信者が皇帝ユリエル・セプティム7世を暗殺した事件だ

original: Without a Septim on the throne of the Empire, Dagon was able to leave Oblivion through the gates and attack.
string: 帝国の玉座にセプティムが不在となった事で、デイゴンは門を通ってオブリビオンから攻撃を仕掛ける事が可能になった

original: Why would a dremora attack you?
string: どうしてドレモラに襲われるんだ？

original: Well, that's a ridiculous question. Everyone traveling through here has said that the Oblivion Gates have been opening all over Tamriel.
string: 愚かな質問だ。ここを通る旅人達は皆、タムリエルのあちこちでオブリビオンの門が開いていると言ってるぞ

original: How many pages did you lose?
string: 失ったページの数は？

original: When I was tossed in here I felt myself falling... and I dropped the pages I had been holding.
string: ここに送られた時、すっ転んだような気がする。その時、持っていた原稿を手放してしまったんだ

original: There were ten of them in all. Find them for me, please, I beg you!
string: 原稿は全部で10枚。探してきてくれ、頼む、お願い！

original: I do, but you can't leave that way.
string: 自分が知ってる方法ではあなたは出られない

original: Maybe I can't leave, but my writings can.
string: 原稿だけなら、何とかなるともさ

original: In order to write the second volume of my opus, I need the notes from my first volume. Otherwise I need to do all of this from memory.
string: 手記の第二巻を執筆するには、第一巻のメモが必要だ。あれがなければ、すべてを記憶から書き起こさねばならない

original: Could I help?
string: 手伝えることはあるか？

original: Perhaps. Do you have a way out of here?
string: かもな。ここから出る方法を知ってるか？

original: You're dead.
string: あなたはもう死んでいる

original: No... all these wasted months, or has it been years? I don't even remember how much time has passed.
string: そんな… 何か月、いや何年、いや、思い出せないほどの時間は無駄だったってのか？

original: Now my work will never see the light of day. My name will be forgotten.
string: あの作品は永遠に日の目を見ない、と。この名も忘れられてしまうってのか

original: Your soul was trapped.
string: 魂を捕らわれたんだ

original: My what? Wait. That means...
string: 何だって？ という事は、つまり…

original: You must be crazy.
string: すっかりおかしくなっているな…

original: Hmph. I tell you what's crazy.
string: ふんだ。本当にイカれた話を教えてやろう

original: How about sitting in your home, minding your own business and then suddenly getting attacked by a dremora and his cronies.
string: 自分の家で用事に集中している時に、ドレモラとその仲間に突然襲われる話だ

original: A dremora captured you?
string: ドレモラに捕まったのか？

original: Well, I assume so. It cast a spell at me from some kind of strange black crystal.
string: 多分な。不気味な黒い水晶みたいなもので呪文をかけられたんだ

original: Next thing I knew, I arrived here.
string: 次に気がついた時には、ここにいた

original: Prison? You mean the Soul Cairn?
string: 監獄？ ソウル・ケルンのことか？

original: Soul what? What in the name of Vivec are you talking about?
string: 魂が何だって？ ヴィベクの名にかけて聞くが、一体何の話だ？

original: All I remember is that damn dremora and his minions bursting into my home and sending me to their prison.
string: 覚えているのは、家に押し入ってきた忌々しいドレモラとその手下によってこの牢屋に送り込まれた事だけだ

original: Who threw you in here?
string: 誰の手でここに送られたんだ？

original: That damn dremora and his minions. They didn't even give me a chance to explain who I was.
string: 忌々しいドレモラとその手下うんぬんの仕業だ。名乗る暇さえ与えられなかった

original: How is your work going so far?
string: 作品の進み具合は？

original: Terrible, simply terrible.
string: 本当、全く最悪だった

original: I was in the midst of writing the second volume and they just threw me into this prison. It's unfair!
string: 第二巻の執筆中だというのに、この牢屋に入れられちまったんだ。ひどい話だよな！

original: Maybe a shorter title is in order?
string: 題名が長すぎるのでは？

original: Maybe you should leave the writing to an expert and stop making foolish suggestions.
string: 文章の事は専門家に任せて、下らない提案はやめたらどうかね

original: You're talking about a book?
string: 本のことか？

original: A book? I'd hardly call a twenty-six volume epic simply a "book."
string: 本だあ？ 26巻もある大作を、単なる“本”などと呼ぶのはよしてくれないか

original: Surely you've heard of "The Rise and Fall of Saint Jiub the Eradicator: Hero of Morrowind and Savior of the Dunmer."
string: 「モロウウィンドの英雄にしてダンマーの救世主、根絶者・聖ジウブの興亡」というありがたい書物だ。聞いた事、あるだろ？

original: Nope, never heard of you.
string: いいや、聞いたことすらない名前だ

original: I can't say that I'm surprised by your answer. Until I get my second volume published, no one will ever know of my achievements.
string: 驚くような事じゃないぞ。手記の第二巻を出版するまで、我が偉業は誰も知らなかったのであるからして

original: Now, what were you saying?
string: で、何の話だったかな？

original: Oh, I see. You've decided to cease pursuing your busy schedule and wish to talk now. How kind.
string: ああ、忙しい中、予定を後回しにして話をしてくれるのか。そりゃどうもね

original: I don't have time for this.
string: そんな暇はない

original: And you think I do? Humph.
string: そうだと思うのか？ ふんだ

original: Oh, this is simply getting infuriating!
string: おう、これ以上は腹に据えかねるな！

original: Let's just start at the beginning...
string: 一番最初から話してくれれば…

original: Very well. I suppose a moment or two of my time couldn't hurt.
string: そうだな。時間はいくらでもある事だし

original: I am Jiub. Some call me Saint Jiub. Others call me Jiub the Eradicator. Perhaps you've heard of me?
string: ジウブだ。聖ジウブや、根絶者ジウブと呼ぶ者もいる。聞いた事あるよな？

original: Opus? What do you mean?
string: 作品とは？

original: "What do I mean," indeed!
string: はいはいまったくごもっとも！

original: If I hadn't lost all of the pages, I wouldn't be in this predicament and we wouldn't be having this conversation.
string: 原稿を丸ごと失ったりしなければ、そもそも困っちゃいないし、こんな話もしなくて済んだんだ

original: What exactly are you doing?
string: 何をしているんだ？

original: How does anyone expect me to write my opus with all of these rude interruptions?
string: 失敬な連中に邪魔されてばかりで、どうやって作品を仕上げればいいんだ？

original: Hello
string: やあ

original: Keep quiet! We're hunting vampires spotted in the area.
string: 静かに！ 近くで目撃された吸血鬼を探してる

original: Actually, now that you mention it...(Attack)
string: 言われてみればその通りだ…(攻撃)

original: Hunters! Take his heart!
string: みんな！ 奴の心臓を狙え！

original: Hello
string: やあ

original: Keep an eye out and let us know if you see any vampires.
string: 警戒して、吸血鬼がもしいたら知らせてくれ

original: No, I haven't seen any.
string: いや、見ていない

original: Well, if you do just let us know. We'll be in this area until we find them.
string: もし見つけたら教えてほしい。見つけるまではこの周辺にいる

original: Hello
string: やあ

original: We're looking for some Vampires that have been reported in the area. Seen any?
string: この一帯にいるらしいという吸血鬼を探している。見かけなかったか？

original: Fellow hunter, we're looking for some Vampires that have been reported in the area. Have you seen any?
string: お仲間か。この一帯にいるらしいという吸血鬼を探している。見かけなかったか？

original: Oh no! What have I done?
string: ああ、とんでもない事を！

original: How so?
string: どうして？

original: This is the most peace and quiet I've had in a lifetime.
string: 生まれてから今まで得る事のできなかった平穏がある

original: There's no one around to disturb me and distract me from my writing. Present company excepted of course.
string: 書き物をしていても邪魔される事がない。ああっと、お前の事を言ってるわけじゃないぞ

original: I don't suppose there's a way to free you.
string: 解放する方法はないんだろうな

original: Considering the state I'm in, I'd say that option vanished a long time ago.
string: 今のこの姿では、そんな望みはとうの昔に消えちまったさ

original: Besides this isn't so bad when you think about it.
string: これはこれで、まあ悪くはないがな

original: What will you do now?
string: これからどうするんだ？

original: Now that the first volume's complete, there's no much left to do but begin work on the second.
string: 第一巻が完成した今、次にする事は第二巻の執筆しかないだろうが

original: There are plenty of other adventures I've had over the years, but you'll just have to read my next work to find out.
string: 他にも多くの冒険を経験しているけど、その話が知りたければ次の作品を読むといいんじゃないかな

original: When you get back to Tamriel, let them know I still exist.
string: タムリエルに戻ったら、ジウブはまだここにいると伝えてくれ

original: Now, where was I...
string: さて、続きはどこからだったか…

original: Only thirty more pages and my next volume will be complete.
string: あと30ページで、次の巻が完成するぞ

original: If you think of any juicy details to add to my work, let me know!
string: 何か面白い物語のネタがあったら、おれに教えてくれよな！

original: I'm still hard at work on the second volume of my epic.
string: 我が冒険物語の第二巻の執筆で忙しいんだ

original: Come to visit this lost soul again?
string: この迷える魂に、まだ何か用か？

original: Back to visit Jiub the Magnificent, eh?
string: またもやこの偉大なるジウブを訪ねて来たりしたのかな？

original: I hope you've read the first volume of my epic by now.
string: 手記の第一巻、もう読んでくれただろうな

original: I miss my homeland, but I can't say that I miss all the noise!
string: 故郷は懐かしいが、あの騒音の中に戻る気はこれっぽっちもないぞ！

original: Didn't work out that way I assume.
string: そうはならなかったようだな

original: The reason I'm standing in front of you as only a whisper of my former self should tell you that.
string: こうして声だけでお前に語りかけているのを見りゃ分かるだろ

original: I never knew what became of Kvatch. I wonder if they were triumphant without me.
string: クヴァッチがどうなったのかも知らない。残った人々は勝てたのかな

original: Is that where you were attacked?
string: そこで襲われたのか？

original: Indeed! One moment I was writing diligently, and the next, my door bursts open.
string: そうなんだよ！ 書き物に集中できると思ったら、次の瞬間には扉を叩く奴がいやがってだね

original: It was a cadre of dremora. The city was under attack.
string: ドレモラの集団だよ。奴らが街を襲撃したんだ

original: I took it upon myself to join the cause and fight the dremora, thinking this would simply be another feather in my cap.
string: それで、人々と共にドレモラと戦う事にした。また1つ手柄を増やせてしまうなあ、と思って

original: And if I want to remain a werewolf?
string: ウェアウルフのままでいたいと言えば？

original: I will banish you from this castle. I will spare your life this once, but after that, you are prey.
string: この城からお前を追放する。今回ばかりは見逃してやるが、その後は獲物とみなす

original: I'm a werewolf. What will happen if I accept your gift?
string: ウェアウルフの身で恩恵を受け入れたらどうなる？

original: Yes, I can smell it on you.
string: そうだな、臭いで分かる

original: The power of my blood will purge that filth and make you whole again.
string: 私の血の力で汚れが浄化され、再び万全な状態に戻れるだろう

original: I'm already a vampire. What more can you offer me?
string: 既に吸血鬼になっているのに、それ以上得るものがあるのか？

original: You contracted a disease, perhaps, but you are no true vampire.
string: 疾病にはかかったかも知れんが、真の吸血鬼ではないな

original: Accept my gift and I promise that you will learn the difference.
string: 我が贈り物を受け取れば、その差が分かると保証しよう

original: Refuse me, and I will banish you from this castle. I will spare your life this once, but after that, you are prey.
string: 断ればこの城からお前を追放する。今回ばかりは見逃してやるが、その後は獲物とみなす

original: You dare walk away from me? In my own hall, before my own court, you dare insult me?
string: 私に背を向けるのか？ 我が城で、我が臣下の前で、私を愚弄するというのか？

original: We have not finished speaking yet. Come back at once.
string: 話は終わっていない。今すぐ戻れ！

original: Why would your wife betray you?
string: どうして妻に裏切られたんだ？

original: You test my patience with these questions.
string: いつまで質問を続ける気なのだ？

original: That is a personal matter, and one I will not discuss.
string: それは個人的な問題だ。話すつもりはない

original: When you greeted Serana, it sounded like you hadn't seen her in a long time.
string: セラーナに会った時、ずいぶん長い間会っていなかった様子だった

original: Serana and her mother disappeared long ago.
string: セラーナとその母親はだいぶ前にいなくなった

original: I commanded every vampire in the court to look for them, but after centuries of searching without success, I lost hope.
string: 配下の吸血鬼総出で行方を探したが、何百年かけて探っても手応えが得られず、私は絶望した

original: In my heart, I know that it was my wife, Valerica, who took my beloved daughter away from me.
string: 私は内心、愛する娘を連れ去ったのは妻のヴァレリカだったと心得ている

original: If I ever see her again, she will pay most dearly for that betrayal.
string: もしまた会う事があれば、裏切りの代償を存分にとってやるとも

original: I heard you mention Serana's mother. What happened to her?
string: 話に出てきたセラーナの母親はどうなったのか？

original: Her name was Valerica. She has been gone for so long now, I can only assume she has left this world, one way or another.
string: 名はヴァレリカだ。最後に見てからかなりの時間が経ったが、何らかの形でこの世を離れたのだろうな

original: I will say only that we did not part on good terms.
string: 別れが温かなものではなかったとだけ言っておこう

original: That make you feel any better?
string: それで気休めになる？

original: I've waited so long for this moment. We found it. At last.
string: この瞬間を本当に長い間待っていた。見つけたんだね。ついに

original: Congratulations. And... thanks, Katria.
string: おめでとう… そしてありがとう、カトリア

original: But... it's hopeless. I died here, just like all the others. Turn back. Turn back before you become the next victim.
string: でも… 絶望的だよ。他の皆と同様、あたしもここで死んだ。さあ帰りな。次の犠牲者になる前に引き返すんだ

original: And that story led you here?
string: その話に基づいてここへ？

original: What treasure?
string: 宝とは？

original: You mentioned a treasure?
string: さっき、宝があると？

original: What were you looking for?
string: 何を探してたんだ？

original: Oh. You read the book, didn't you? "The Aetherium Wars"?
string: ああ。本を読んだんだね？ 「エセリウム戦争」だろう？

original: That was my theory, you know. My research. My life's work. All of it, lost! Stolen by my own damn apprentice!
string: あれはあたしの理論だったんだ。あたしの研究。一生の仕事。それをすべて失った！ 自分の見習いに盗まれたんだよ！

original: That's how I ended up here. I can't rest. Not until I find the Forge, until I can prove that it was my discovery. Mine, not his!
string: それでここに行き着いたんだ。眠りにつく事はできない。鋳造器具を見つけ、それがあたしの発見だと証明できるまで。彼じゃなくあたしの！

original: Your name sounds familiar...
string: 名前に聞き覚えがある気が…

original: My brother in darkness. While it's good to see you, we'll keep up appearances, yes?
string: 闇の兄弟よ。会えてうれしいけれど、平静を装いましょう。いいわね？

original: My sister in darkness. While it's good to see you, we'll keep up appearances, yes?
string: 闇の姉妹よ。会えてうれしいけれど、平静を装いましょう。いいわね？

original: We are blood bound, but we can never be too careful. Never know who might be watching, right?
string: 血の契りを結んでいるにしても、用心するに越した事はないよ。誰に見られてるか分からないからね

original: Blood of the sick. Blood of the weak. Blood of the unsuspecting noble lord. Savor each flavor. Unsuspecting, delicious prey.
string: 病人の血。弱者の血。無防備な貴族の血。それぞれの味を楽しむわ。疑う事を知らない、美味な獲物

original: I keep an eye on their comings and goings. No one suspects poor Cairine. Poor, poor Cairine. Ha!
string: 彼らの行動は見張っているわ。哀れなカイリーンを疑う者はいない。哀れな、哀れなカイリーンを。アハ！

original: The darkness hums and we sing its praises. Sweet melodies. Sweet like the water that flows through their veins.
string: 闇がハミングし、私達はその称賛を歌う。甘い旋律。彼らの血管を流れる水のように甘い

original: I need to find someone named Florentius.
string: フロレンティウスという人物を探している

original: Florentius? Really? I assumed Isran would want nothing to do with him.
string: フロレンティウスだと？ イスランが関わりたがるとは思えないが

original: Where can I find him?
string: 彼はどこにいる？

original: Well, that's the thing. We don't know where he is. Haven't seen him in years.
string: それが問題なの。彼の居場所は分からないわ。もう何年も、姿を見てないの

original: I think he had regular contact with the Vigilants, and I know Isran kept track of them...
string: 番人とは定期的に会ってるはずだし、イスランは足取りを掴んでると思うけど…

original: So maybe you could ask Isran if he knows anything? Just keep in mind that he... well, he might not like the idea.
string: だから、イスランに聞いてみるといいんじゃない？ ただし… 彼はこの考えが気に入らないかも知れないから注意して

original: Who is Florentius?
string: フロレンティウスとは？

original: He's a priest of Arkay. Well, he was. It's... it's complicated.
string: 彼はアーケイの僧侶なの。今は違うけど… 複雑な事情でね

original: He's a little eccentric, but we can trust him and we could definitely use his skills.
string: ちょっと変人だけど、信用できるし、彼の能力は必ず役に立つわ

original: You're worried about what we're up against?
string: 敵が手強すぎると？

original: Yes. These vampires are a new threat, and a truly deadly one.
string: ええ。吸血鬼は新たな脅威であり、その影響力は致命的よ

original: Gunmar and I agree that we're going to need Florentius to help.
string: フロレンティウスの助けが必要という事で、ガンマーとも意見が一致したわ

original: Gunmar and I have a lot of work to do here, so we were hoping that maybe you could track him down.
string: ガンマーも私もここでやる事がたくさんあるから、あなたに彼を探してもらいたいの

original: Do you have a moment? Gunmar and I have been talking and, well, we're slightly worried.
string: ちょっといい？ ガンマーと話してたんだけど、ちょっと心配になってきたの

original: We both realized that if Isran's even allowed us in here, he must be really concerned.
string: 私達がここにいる事をイスランが許すだけでも、かなり悩んでる証拠だわ

original: And if he's that concerned, the situation must be pretty bad. Make sense?
string: それほど悩んでるって事は、状況はかなり悪いに違いない。そうでしょ？

original: What do you do here?
string: ここではどんな役目を？

original: Whatever is required! I am happy to do whatever is asked of me. I only wish to be useful.
string: どんな事でも喜んで！ とにかく役に立ちたいんだ

original: Often I take on tasks that Garan or Feran find distasteful, or... beneath them.
string: ガランやフェランの仕事を肩代わりする事も少なくないよ。二人がその… やりたがらない時にね

original: If I can remain useful, those above me will see fit to keep me here.
string: 役に立つところを見せれば、ずっと置いてくれるだろうからね

original: These vampires are becoming a real menace.
string: この吸血鬼どもは深刻な脅威になりつつある

original: Where're these vampires coming from? We need to wipe them out before things get worse.
string: この吸血鬼どもはどこから来る？ 事態が悪化する前に、奴らを一掃しなければ

original: Dragons breathing fire in the sky. Vampires brazenly attacking people on the street. It's the end of the world I tell you.
string: 空ではドラゴンが火を噴き、街では吸血鬼が厚かましく人々を襲撃している。思うに、これが世界の終わりだ

original: They say if a vampire so much as scratches you, you'll turn into one. That better not be true.
string: 吸血鬼にひっかかれただけで吸血鬼へと変わると言う。真実じゃないといいがな

original: We need to do something about these vampire attacks.
string: この吸血鬼の攻撃を何とかしなければ

original: If I leave the Soul Cairn, can I safely return?
string: ソウル・ケルンを離れた場合、無事にもう一度来ることはできるだろうか？

original: As you've been traveling in the Soul Cairn, your body has become attuned to it.
string: ソウル・ケルンを旅した事で、あなたの身体はかの地に同調したの

original: Let's just say a tiny part of you rubbed off on it, and in its place, a bit of the Soul Cairn filled the void.
string: つまり、あなたのほんの一部がかの地に乗り移って、代わりに、ソウル・ケルンのかけらがその隙間を埋めたのよ

original: You should find no difficulty using the portal any longer.
string: もう転移門の使用に困難を感じる事はないはずよ

original: Your wife is such a soul, and the stars appear cooperative. Now is your chance.
string: 君の奥さんは大した人だ。それに星の巡りも味方している。今がチャンスだな

original: Your husband is such a soul, and the stars appear cooperative. Now is your chance.
string: 君の旦那さんは大した人だ。それに星の巡りも味方している。今がチャンスだな

original: Understood.
string: 分かった

original: Return to me when your part is done. And may you enjoy your second nuptials.
string: やるべき事が済んだら戻ってきてくれ。素敵な2度目の結婚式になりますよう

original: Why am I able to bestow the gift of Harkon's blood?
string: 自分もハルコンの血の恩恵を他人に授けられるのはどうしてか？

original: Can't anyone become a vampire if bitten by one?
string: 噛まれたら誰でも吸血鬼になりうるのでは？

original: What do you mean by allaying fear through vampiric seduction?
string: 吸血鬼の誘惑で恐れを鎮める、というのは？

original: I'm just here for the Elder Scroll.
string: 星霜の書を取りに来た

original: I see. You're simply here to stop the Tyranny of the Sun, despite the cost to Serana. Nothing else matters.
string: なるほど。太陽の専制を阻止するためだけに来たのね。セラーナが犠牲になろうと。他の何も重要ではない

original: The boss said it's some sort of profaned spring. It looks like blood, but it's not the real thing.
string: ボスが言うには、不浄の泉のようなものだって。一見血に見えるけど、実は違うのよ

original: So why don't you just drink the blood from the spring? I mean, that seems easier than running a skooma den...
string: じゃあその泉から血を汲んで飲めばいいじゃないか。スクゥーマ部屋を経営するより簡単だ…

original: Why can't Orthjolf be trusted?
string: オースユルフを信用できない理由は？

original: He claims to serve loyally, but he really covets the throne. He sees himself in charge someday.
string: 彼は忠実に仕えてると言い張るけど、本当は玉座をほしがってるのさ。あわよくばって思ってるんだ

original: His ambition will justify any actions. Put your faith in him, and you will regret it, I promise you.
string: 彼の野望はどんな行動でも正当化するだろう。信頼したら後悔するよ。本当さ

original: Be careful who you trust. Not all of us have the court's best interests at heart.
string: 信頼する相手は慎重に選んだ方がいいよ。宮廷の利益を優先しない者も中にはいるからね

original: Orthjolf, for example. He'll tell you he means well, but believe me, he can't be trusted at all.
string: 例えばオースユルフがそうだ。善人ぶってるけど、実はまったく信用できない。本当だよ

original: Keep that in mind, will you?
string: 今言った事を覚えておいてくれ

original: You'll be a welcome addition to the court, I'm sure.
string: 君はきっと喜んで宮廷に迎え入れられるだろう

original: If I may, let me offer you a piece of advice.
string: ちょっと忠告したいんだけど、いいかな？

original: How do you serve Lord Harkon?
string: ハルコン卿にはどのように仕えているのか？

original: Simple. He says 'kill', I kill.
string: 単純よ。彼が“殺せ”と言い、私が殺す

original: Sometimes he doesn't even have to say it.
string: 言う必要さえない時もあるわ

original: New blood, eh? Let's get something very clear.
string: 新顔ね？ はっきりさせておきましょう

original: I don't care about politics. You want to fight over the throne with the rest of them, go right ahead.
string: 政治には関心がないの。他の者達と玉座を争いたければ、ご自由にどうぞ

original: I feed when I'm hungry, I sleep when I'm tired, and I kill whenever I'm in the mood. Those are the things that are important to me.
string: 空腹な時に食べ、疲れれば眠り、殺したい気分の時にはいつでも殺す。それが私にとって重要な事

original: So let's hear it.
string: では聞かせてもらおうか

original: This vampire showed up while you were away.
string: 君の留守中に吸血鬼が現れた

original: I'm guessing it's the one you found in Dimhollow Crypt. Says it's got something really important to say to you.
string: おそらく君がディムホロウ墓地で見つけた奴だろう。そいついわく、君に重要な話があるそうだ

original: Who are you?
string: お前は誰だ？

original: Taron Dreth, the world's foremost expert in Dwemer metallurgy. Not that you would know anything about that.
string: タロンだ。このタロン・ドレスはドゥーマーの鋳造技術に関しては世界最高の権威なのだよ。君にこんな事を言ってもしょうがないが

original: Who are you?
string: お前は誰だ？

original: Taron Dreth. The world's foremost expert on Dwemer forging techniques. Now answer my question!
string: タロンだ！ タロン・ドレス。ドゥーマーの鋳造技術に関しては世界最高の権威だ。さあ、質問に答えろ！

original: Where did you find it? Tell me!
string: それをどこで見つけた？ 言え！

original: What are you doing here?
string: ここで何をしてるんだ？

original: I'm on my way to Markarth to confer with my colleague, Calcelmo. I've no time to stop and chat.
string: 同僚のカルセルモと会うためにマルカルスに行くところだ。立ち止まっておしゃべりする暇はない

original: No answer? Then I'll take it from your corpse!
string: 答えないのか？ ならお前の死体から奪ってやる！

original: No, I don't think so.
string: いや、違うと思う

original: Then I'll take it from your corpse! Kill him!
string: ならお前の死体から奪ってやる！ 奴の望みを絶て！

original: Then I'll take it from your corpse! Kill her!
string: ならお前の死体から奪ってやる！ 奴の望みを絶て！

original: Guards! Kill him!
string: 傭兵ども！ 奴の頭をねじ切れ！

original: Guards! Kill her!
string: 傭兵ども！ 奴の頭をねじ切れ！

original: Your crown... gods, it's made of Aetherium! Pure Aetherium!
string: お前の王冠は… 何てこった。エセリウム製じゃないか！ 正真正銘のエセリウムだ！

original: Your staff... gods, it's made of Aetherium! Pure Aetherium!
string: お前の装備品は… 何てこった。エセリウム製じゃないか！ 正真正銘のエセリウムだ！

original: Your shield... gods, it's made of Aetherium! Pure Aetherium!
string: お前の盾は… 何てこった。エセリウム製じゃないか！ 正真正銘のエセリウムだ！

original: Katria? No, no that's not possible!
string: カトリア？ 馬鹿な、そんな事があってなるものか！

original: You... you know too much. I can't afford to let you live.
string: お前は… 知りすぎている。生かしてはおけん

original: I had some help. From Katria.
string: 助けてもらった。カトリアに

original: I've heard of you. From Katria.
string: 話は聞いている、カトリアから

original: I made it.
string: 自力で作った

original: What? You... you found the Forge? The Aetherium Forge?
string: 何？ お前が… 見つけただと？ エセリウムの鋳造器具を？

original: Out of our way.
string: 邪魔だ

original: You need anything, talk to Master Dreth.
string: 至高のマスター・ドレスに聞け

original: Stand aside.
string: どけ

original: Really? You had to take the armor? Come on, leave me with a little dignity...
string: 本気？ 鎧を取る必要があったの？ 参ったよ、幻滅しちゃうね…

original: You don't trust Vingalmo?
string: ヴィンガルモを信用できないのか？

original: No, and if you're smart you won't either. I know he's one of your kind and all, but he's only looking out for himself.
string: いいや。お前も同族だからと言って、信用しない方がいい。奴は自分の事しか考えていないからな

original: You'll think you're best of friends, until you find his fangs in your neck.
string: 親友かと思い込んでいたら首筋に牙を突き立てられている、といったところだ

original: Of course not. He's an elf, isn't he?
string: そんなはずないだろう。奴はエルフだぞ？

original: He'll cozy up to you, use his honeyed words to get you to lower your guard, then use you and throw you away when he's done with you.
string: 近づいてきて甘い言葉で油断させ、利用した上で用が済んだら捨て去るつもりだ

original: You watch yourself around him.
string: 奴には気をつけた方がいい

original: Another elf, I see. I'm sure Vingalmo will be sizing you up as we speak, trying to figure if you're friend or foe.
string: またエルフか。こうして話している間にもヴィンガルモが品定めをして、敵か味方かを見極めている事だろうな

original: He'll tell you what a monster I am, that I can't be trusted... You mark my words, it's him you need to worry about.
string: 我（われ）がいかに人でなしで、信用に値しないか… とか言ってくるだろうが、警戒すべきなのは奴の方だからな！

original: If it'll get him closer to being in charge, he'll slit your throat without a moment's thought.
string: 自分が上に立つためには、一瞬のためらいもなくお前の寝首をかきにくるぞ

original: Good to see a new face here. Especially one that isn't attached to an elf.
string: 新顔が訪ねてくるのは嬉しい事だ。エルフの顔じゃないとなれば、なおさらの事

original: Between you and me, there's too many of them. Can't trust the lot of them; never could.
string: ここだけの話、エルフは数が多すぎる。どいつも信用できないし、した事もない

original: Want my advice? Avoid getting wrapped up in Vingalmo's schemes. He's after the throne, and he'll kill anyone that gets in his way.
string: 一つ言っておくと、ヴィンガルモの企てに関わらない方がいい。玉座を狙っていて、邪魔者は誰であろうと殺すような奴だ

original: Where do the thralls come from?
string: 下僕たちの出どころは？

original: All over Skyrim. It's my job to collect them. I try and keep something for everyone. For every taste, I mean.
string: スカイリム全土だ。あいつらを集めるのが仕事だ。幅広い趣味をまかなえるよう、配慮している

original: Sometimes you get one who comes willingly, but most have to be convinced to join us here.
string: 時々好き好んで来るのもいるが、大半は説得しないとここには来たがらない

original: You're new here, so I'll explain this once. You feed from the thralls as much as you like. You kill them, and I'll split you in half.
string: ここは不慣れだろうから、一度だけ説明する。従徒どもの血は好きなだけ飲んでくれていいが、殺したりしたらお前を引き裂いてやるからな

original: You were in the Companions?
string: 同胞団の一員だったのか？

original: Aye, I was. Didn't progress very far. Never did care for their attitude, acting like they're better than everyone else.
string: ええ、そうよ。大して進歩しなかった。彼らの優越感に満ちた態度がずっと嫌だったわ

original: But none of that matters now.
string: でもそんな事はもう関係ない

original: Can you feel it? You're now so much more than you were before.
string: 感じる？ 以前よりはるかに大きな存在になった事を

original: Time was I could barely hold my own in the Companions. Now I could slaughter them all without a second thought.
string: 同胞団にいた頃は自制するのがやっとだった。今なら何のためらいもなく彼ら全員を殺せそうよ

original: And I'm not half the vampire Lord Harkon is. Truth is I'm better with a forge than I am with claws or fangs.
string: それでも吸血鬼としてはハルコン卿の足元にも及ばない。実際、爪と牙を使うよりも鍛冶の方が得意なの

original: What is the vampire doing?
string: その吸血鬼は何をしているのか？

original: Vampires enjoy stalking their prey. Passing among us undetected emboldens them. Makes them feel powerful, untouchable.
string: 吸血鬼は獲物をゆっくり追い詰めるのを楽しんでいる。奴らは気づかれず我々に紛れ込む事で自信をつけ、無敵の力を得たつもりになっているんだ

original: But we'll put a swift end to that.
string: だがそれもすぐに終わりにしてやる

original: Understood.
string: 分かった

original: The light be with you.
string: 光のご加護あれ

original: How can I avoid trouble with the law?
string: 司法とのもめ事を避けるにはどうすれば？

original: You must be clever. Find a way not to be caught or accused of murder.
string: うまくやらないとな。捕まったり、殺人の罪を負わされたりしない手を考えるんだ

original: You'll figure something out. We must be vigilant and self sufficient if we are to defeat these monsters.
string: 何か手があるはずだ。あの化け物どもに勝つには用心深く行動し、我々だけでどうにかする必要がある

original: Can't we inform the Jarl's men of the threat?
string: 首長の部下に警告すべきでは？

original: Alas, the vampire can cloud the minds of those he preys upon. It won't be easy to convince anyone he's other than he appears.
string: 吸血鬼は獲物の精神をくもらせる力をもつ。奴の正体を人に信じさせるのは容易な事ではない

original: The law will require proof that we can't present. And Jarls disapprove of bloodshed they haven't called for themselves.
string: 法は我々では提示できない証拠を求めるだろうし、各首長は自ら命じたもの以外の流血に眉をひそめるものだ

original: Best not to damage our reputation. Let your actions be as discrete as possible.
string: 評判を落とさないよう注意が必要だ。なるべく目立たずに行動するといい

original: Well, that's the second one - we're halfway there. I'll keep looking. See you soon!
string: ああ、あれが二つめだよ… これで半分だね。あたしは探し続けるよ。また後でね！

original: That's, what, your third? All right, only one left to go. I'll meet you there.
string: それは、三つめかな？ いいね、残りは一つだけだよ。そこで会おう

original: That's the last one, isn't it? It's... it's almost time. I'll meet you at the Forge!
string: それが最後の一つだね？ …いよいよだ。じゃあ鋳造器具の所で！

original: Thanks again for all your help.
string: 手助けに本当感謝するよ

original: Hmph. Beat me to it, this time.
string: ふふん。今度は出し抜いてみなよ

original: Have to say, I'm glad that's over.
string: 認めるよ、終わってほっとしたって

original: Could you get this for me? I don't exactly have a lockpick...
string: これをどうにかしてくれる？ 開錠は得意じゃなくてね…

original: Well, go on, take it!
string: さあ、どうぞ。ほら！

original: Don't just stand there! Come on!
string: 突っ立っていないで！ さあ！

original: Come on!
string: かかっておいで！

original: The air here... it feels different. Almost like...
string: ここの空気… 違う感じがするよ。まるで…

original: Damn! What the...
string: しまった！ こんな…

original: Spiders? All right, we can handle this. Come on!
string: スパイダー？ 相手にはできるね。行くよ！

original: Spiders!
string: スパイダーめ！

original: Spheres! On the upper level!
string: スフィアだ！ 上の階に！

original: The steam! Quick, shut it off!
string: 蒸気だ！ 早く、止めて！

original: Do you... hear something?
string: 何か… 聞こえる？

original: What now?
string: 今度は何？

original: It's not working! Try something else!
string: 効果がないよ！ 別の方法を試して！

original: Door's shut tight. I bet those Resonators would open it, though.
string: 扉は密閉されている。でもあの共鳴装置で開くはずだよ

original: Well. After you.
string: さあ。先にどうぞ

original: I don't know. I honestly don't know. After all these years, it's a miracle even this much survived.
string: 分からないよ、全然全く。これほどの歳月を経て、これだけでも残っていたのが奇跡だ

original: Do you think there's more Aetherium somewhere?
string: まだエセリウムがどこかにあるだろうか？

original: There you are. Give me a hand with this door, would you?
string: そこにいたんだね。この扉を手伝ってくれないかな？

original: There you are. Looks like this place has been cleaned out. At least the shard is still here...
string: そこにいたんだね。この場所は空っぽみたいだけど、少なくともまだとっかかりはある…

original: Come on, I think it's over here.
string: ついて来て、こっちだと思うよ

original: We meet again. That was quite the trek.
string: またね。すごい旅だったよ

original: Try... taking it out?
string: 試しに… 取ってみる？

original: I already have another shard.
string: 既に破片をもう1つ持っている

original: I have two of the other shards already.
string: 既に破片をもう2つ持っている

original: I already have the other three shards.
string: 既に残りの破片を3つとも持っている

original: Please, turn back... before it's too late...
string: お願い、引き返して… 手遅れになる前に…

original: Yes.
string: ああ

original: Then behold Auri-El's gift, my child. May it light your path as you seek tranquility within the Inner Sanctum.
string: では、アーリエルの祝福を受けるがいい。最奥聖域へ導く光が、汝と共にあるように

original: Then behold Auri-El's gift, my child. May it speed your journey to the Inner Sanctum.
string: では、アーリエルの祝福を受けるがいい。汝の最奥聖域への旅が滞りなき事を

original: Auri-El bless you, child. For you are a step closer to the Inner Sanctum and everlasting wisdom.
string: アーリエルの祝福は汝と共にある。最奥聖域の深淵なる英知に、また一歩近づいたのだ

original: Then go forth, child. May the enrichment of Auri-El strengthen your resolve as you undertake your journey to the Inner Sanctum.
string: さあ、行くがいい。アーリエルの力が汝の意思をさらに強くし、最奥聖域への道のりを助けるだろう

original: May the blessings of Auri-El protect you as you climb the road to the Inner Sanctum and final enlightenment.
string: アーリエルの祝福が、汝とともにあらん事を。最奥聖域での悟りへの旅路に幸多からん事を

original: Welcome, Initiate. This is the Wayshrine of Illumination.
string: ようこそ、新人よ。ここは光の祠だ

original: Are you prepared to honor the mantras of Auri-El and fill your vessel with His enlightenment?
string: アーリエルの真言を受ける光栄に浴し、その水差しを悟りの水で満たすか？

original: You've reached the Wayshrine of Learning, Initiate.
string: この学びの祠へようこそ、新人よ

original: Are you prepared to honor the mantras of Auri-El and fill your vessel with His enlightenment?
string: アーリエルの真言を受ける光栄に浴し、その水差しを悟りの水で満たすか？

original: You've arrived at the Wayshrine of Resolution.
string: ここは意思の祠だ

original: Are you prepared to honor the mantras of Auri-El and fill your vessel with His enlightenment?
string: アーリエルの真言を受ける光栄に浴し、その水差しを悟りの水で満たすか？

original: You've found the Wayshrine of Radiance, Initiate.
string: ここは輝きの祠だ、新人よ

original: Are you prepared to honor the mantras of Auri-El and fill your vessel with His enlightenment?
string: アーリエルの真言を受ける光栄に浴し、その水差しを悟りの水で満たすか？

original: Welcome, Initiate. This is the Wayshrine of Sight.
string: ようこそ、入信者よ。ここは物見の祠だ

original: Are you prepared to honor the mantras of Auri-El and fill your vessel with His enlightenment?
string: アーリエルの真言を受ける光栄に浴し、その水差しを悟りの水で満たすか？

original: Come forward. You have nothing to fear here.
string: 近くへ来い。恐れる事はない

original: And you were caught in the middle.
string: 間に挟まれてしまったと

original: I was. Honestly, it took me up until now to figure out that my mother was really just as bad as he was.
string: 以前はそうでしたわ。正直に言いますけど、母が父と同じぐらい悪者だというのは今になってようやく分かった事ですのよ

original: He was obsessed with power. She was obsessed with seeing him fail. It was just so... toxic.
string: 父は力にとりつかれていた。母は父が失敗するのをどうしても見たかった。それは… 中毒みたいなものですわね

original: Maybe I could have seen this coming. We could all be better off now.
string: おそらくこうなるのは予測できたはず。そうしたら今こんな目に遭わずに済んだというのに…

original: She doesn't seem too fond of him.
string: 母親が父親を好きだったようには聞こえないな

original: The moment we gave ourselves to Molag Bal, things got really icy between them.
string: わたし達がモラグ・バルに身を捧げた瞬間、両親の関係は冷えきってしまったのですわ

original: They were both drunk with power, and pulling in different directions.
string: 二人とも力に酔いしれていた。そして別々の道を歩み始めた

original: Then he found that prophecy, and... that was it.
string: そんな時に父があの予言を見つけて… それが終わりの始まりでしたの

original: Why did you ever agree to her plan?
string: どうしてそんな計画に同意したんだ？

original: Look, I loved my father, but when he found that prophecy... that became his life. Everything else, even me and my mother... we just became clutter.
string: そう、わたしは父を愛していたけど、予言を見つけてから… 彼にとってそれがすべてになってしまった。他の事はみんな、わたしや母でさえも、どうでもよくなってしまったのです

original: I was close with my mother, but she just kept feeding me her opinions of him, and eventually I started believing them.
string: わたしは母と仲がよかったけれど、母は父の事をどう思っているのかをわたしにすり込み続けましたわ。やがてわたしは母の意見を信じるようになったのです

original: How are you feeling after talking to your mother?
string: 母親と話した感想は？

original: Relieved... I think.
string: 安心いたしましたわ… 多分

original: All those things had been building for a while. You have no idea how long I wanted to say that to her.
string: すべてがしばらくの間ずっと積もって大きくなっていきましたの。どれほど長く母にその事を伝えたかったか、あなたには想像もつかないでしょうね

original: Why not hide it in the Soul Cairn and then return?
string: ソウル・ケルン内に隠して、自分だけ戻らなかったのは？

original: Probably to avoid whatever my father would do to her if he could get his hands on her.
string: 父が母を捕まえたらどうするつもりかは分からないのですけど、とにかくそうなる事態を避けるためかしら

original: Or maybe her plan was to come back, but she was stuck here. We won't know until we find her.
string: それか、母は戻ってくる予定だったけれど、ここで足止めさせられたのかも… 見つけるまでは分かりませんわね

original: And if she doesn't?
string: そうでなければ？

original: Then we find out where she hid it. If she's still alive... well, as alive as she was before. Or is now. Or... you know what I mean.
string: それから母が書を隠した場所を見つけましょう。もし母がまだ生きていましたら… 以前と同じように生きていましたら、あるいはとにかく今生きていましたら、それとも… お分かりになって？

original: Are you sure Valerica has the Elder Scroll?
string: ヴァレリカが星霜の書を持っているのは確実なのか？

original: No, but there's no way she would have left it in Tamriel.
string: いいえ。でも母がそれをタムリエルに置いていったなんてありえませんわ

original: She wanted to get it as far away from my father as possible. I can't imagine a better place.
string: 母はそれを父からできるだけ遠ざけたかったのですから。他にもっといい場所なんて思いつきませんわよ

original: How do the necromancers communicate with them?
string: 死霊術師たちはどうやって疎通を？

original: Well, that's usually the trick. It's possible to do it through a simple portal.
string: 普通はそれでうまくいきますわ。簡単な転移門を通れば十分可能ですの

original: But to finalize the deal, you have to travel here yourself... and most of them never come back.
string: でも契約を仕上げるには、あなた自身の足でここを旅しなければ… そして旅した者はほとんど帰ってまいりませんわ

original: Summon them you mean?
string: 召喚するということか？

original: Exactly. It's a lost art. Most necromancers just raise up whatever bodies are nearby. A simple trick, really. Child's play.
string: そのとおりですわ。まさしく失われた技術。ほとんどの死霊術師は、近くにある死体を何でも甦らせているだけですの。簡単な子供だましです

original: But bringing something from the Soul Cairn gives you something much more powerful.
string: けれどもソウル・ケルンから何かを持ってこられれば、もっと大きな力が手に入る

original: Why would a necromancer want to deal with them?
string: 死霊術師が彼らと取引したがる理由は？

original: Look around you. There are some extremely powerful undead here.
string: 周りをご覧あそばせ。ここにいるのはとてつもなく強力なアンデッドですわよ

original: Even a necromancer as seasoned as my mother would be willing to spend years trying to gain access to them.
string: わたしの母と同じぐらい経験を積んだ死霊術師でも、彼らとお近づきになれるなら喜んで数年間を費やすのでしょう

original: Why are they collecting these souls?
string: どうして魂を集めているんだ？

original: Lots of theories. Some say they feed on them like I feed on blood.
string: 仮説は色々ありますわね。わたしが血をほっするように彼らはそれをほっすると言う人もおりますわ

original: Others think they use them as payment to an even higher power... almost like a currency. A very strange currency.
string: より大きな力への代償として彼らはそれを使うという人もおりますし… まるでお金ですわね。お金にしては奇妙ですけれど

original: Whatever they're doing with them, they've been harvesting for millennia. No telling how many souls are trapped here.
string: いずれにせよ、彼らは数千年もの間それを収穫し続けておりますの。ここにどれほどの魂が捕えられているのかは誰にも分かりませんわ

original: Do you think we'll meet the Ideal Masters?
string: アイディール・マスターに会うことになるのかな？

original: I don't think anyone's ever met the Ideal Masters. I'm not even sure anyone knows what they look like.
string: アイディール・マスターに会った人なんていないと思いますわ。彼らがどんな姿なのかさえ定かではありませんのに

original: They could be underground, flying above us... They might be the ground. I have no idea.
string: 彼らは地下にいるのか、空を飛んでいるのか… 地上にいるのか。何もかも不明ですわ

original: Does anything live here?
string: ここには生き物は住んでいるんだろうか？

original: Look at this place. Do you think anything would want to live here?
string: ご覧になって。こんなところに住みたい生き物がいると思いまして？

original: The only things that can survive here are the Ideal Masters, the undead and the souls themselves. Well, if you want to call that "living."
string: ここで生きていけるのはアイディール・マスターとアンデッド。そして魂だけですから。あら、“生きる”という言い方はちょっと変ですわね

original: Any soul gem?
string: どんな魂石でも？

original: Well, I think it's specifically the black ones. I don't know if the Soul Cairn takes just any leftovers.
string: ええ、特に黒い方に関しては。ソウル・ケルンが残り物なら何でも受け入れるかどうかは分かりませんわね

original: Do you know anything about this place?
string: この場所について知っていることを教えてほしい

original: Just what my mother told me. I've also studied a little bit on my own, but there's not much.
string: 母から教わった事ですわ。自分でも少しばかり勉強しましたけれど、大した知識はございませんの

original: When something is trapped in a soul gem, and then the energy is used for powering an enchantment, the remnants are sent here.
string: 何かが魂石の中に閉じ込められて、そのエネルギーが魔法の強化に使われたら、残り物がここに送られてくるのですわ

original: Maker... it can't be. Serana?!
string: 神よ… まさか。セラーナ！？

original: Wait... I hear something!
string: 待って… 何か聞こえましてよ！

original: It's Durnehviir... he's here! Defend yourselves!
string: ダーネヴィール… 来たわ！ 身を守って！

original: There you are!
string: そこだ！

original: I knew it!
string: やっぱり！

original: Must be gone now.
string: 行ったか

original: Ran off, I suppose.
string: 逃げたのかな

original: Get back here!
string: 戻ってこい！

original: Show yourself!
string: 姿を見せろ！

original: One less monster in the world.
string: これでこの世から化物が1匹消えた

original: And now the feeding begins.
string: さあ、食事の始まりよ

original: That'll teach you.
string: いい教訓になるな

original: Done and done.
string: 片付きましてよ

original: Teamwork, right there.
string: チームワークの勝利ですわ

original: I was sure I heard something.
string: 何か聞こえたぞ

original: Where'd you come from?!
string: どこから来たんだ？

original: You can't hide from us!
string: 隠れても無駄ですわ！

original: There you are, father!
string: 見つけましたわよ、お父様！

original: I knew I heard something!
string: 何か聞こえたぞ！

original: Who's there?
string: 誰だ？

original: I will find you...
string: 見つけてやる…

original: You know you can't win, so all you can do is hide...
string: 勝ち目がない以上、隠れるしかないのだろう…？

original: You can't hide, father!
string: 隠れても無駄ですわ、お父様！

original: Show yourself!
string: 姿を見せろ！

original: There's no hiding from me...
string: 私から隠れられると思うな…

original: Any moment now, I'll find you...
string: すぐに見つけてやる…

original: I know you're here somewhere.
string: ここにいるのは分かっていますの

original: Where did you get to?
string: どこに行きまして？

original: Did you see where he went?
string: 彼がどこに行ったか見まして？

original: Did you see where she went?
string: 彼女がどこに行ったか見まして？

original: Did you see where it went?
string: どこに行ったか見まして？

original: Come now, you think you stand a chance against me?
string: さあ、お前に勝ち目があると思うか？

original: After 400 years, you think you'll be the one to take me down?
string: この400年間で初めて、私を倒す者になれると思うのか？

original: I can't decide which parts of you I'd like to keep for a while...
string: お前のどの部分をしばらくとっておこうか迷っている…

original: I'm going to rend you limb from limb!
string: バラバラに引き裂いてやる！

original: Every last drop of your blood is mine!
string: お前の血は一滴残らず私のものよ！

original: You've no chance against a true vampire!
string: 真の吸血鬼に勝ち目はないわ！

original: Arkay and I will stand triumphant!
string: アーケイと俺に敗北はない！

original: You'll be meeting my friend Arkay very, very soon!
string: あの世でアーケイに会うがいい！

original: You can't beat us!
string: 貴様らには負けないぞ！

original: No one is going to stand in my way!
string: 誰にも邪魔はさせない！

original: Not even the gods will show you mercy!
string: 神でさえお前らには慈悲の心を持つまい！

original: Skyrim will be purged of your filth!
string: スカイリムは不浄なお前達から解放されるのだ！

original: I will not be defeated!
string: 私は負けない！

original: I'm not backing down!
string: 決して退かん！

original: Justice will prevail!
string: 正義は勝つ！

original: I've fought worse than you!
string: 何のこれしき！

original: Give up while you can!
string: あきらめて引くがいい！

original: What have you got?
string: 腕前を見せてご覧なさい

original: Tough day for you!
string: 散々な日にして差し上げますわ！

original: I still remember how to fight!
string: 戦い方ならまだ憶えてますの！

original: I'm not going to die like this!
string: こんなふうに死ぬつもりはありませんのよ！

original: This won't end well for you!
string: ろくな結果になりませんわよ！

original: Back to dust!
string: 塵に還りなさい！

original: How many of you are there?!
string: 一体何人おりますの！？

original: Too slow!
string: 遅くてよ！

original: You fight worse than you smell!
string: 臭いも酷ければ、戦いぶりも酷いですわね！

original: Disgusting creatures.
string: おぞましい化け物達ですわね

original: I'm over here!
string: わたしはこちらよ！

original: Come on, stoneskin!
string: かかっておいでませ、石肌の化け物！

original: This day was always coming!
string: いつかこの日が来ると思っていましたわ！

original: It's time for you to suffer!
string: 今度はお父様が苦しむ番ですわ！

original: This is what your obsession brings you!
string: これがお父様のこだわりの結果ですのよ！

original: Sorry it had to be this way!
string: こうするしかありませんの！

original: I won't fall for your tricks!
string: その手には乗らなくてよ！

original: Your powers are nothing!
string: 通用しませんわよ！

original: I'll bring you down!
string: 叩きのめしますわ！

original: Get it on the ground!
string: それを地面に置きなさい！

original: Kill the beast!
string: あいつを殺して下さい！

original: Get it now while we can!
string: 今のうちに手に入れて下さい！

original: Nooo!
string: 嫌だぁー！

original: Aggh...
string: あああ…

original: Hurrnhh...
string: はああ…

original: Unnnnhhh...
string: ううううう…

original: Not... over... yet...
string: いや… まだだ…

original: Not like this...
string: こんなはずでは…

original: Arrrggghh...
string: ああああ…

original: Hunnnhh...
string: うううう…

original: No, no more!
string: もう嫌だ！

original: Leave me be!
string: 放っといてくれ！

original: That's enough!
string: もうたくさんだ！

original: Nuhn!
string: うぬ！

original: Aggh!
string: ああ！

original: Oof!
string: うわあ！

original: Arrggh!
string: ああああ！

original: Gah!
string: ぐああ！

original: Hunh!
string: ふん！

original: Wagh!
string: うわああ！

original: Unh!
string: あああ！

original: Rrargh!
string: ワァーッ！

original: Hrargh!
string: ハァーッ！

original: Unnff!
string: ウゥッ！

original: Yeeeaarrggh!
string: イィーヤァー！

original: Hhyyaarrgghh!
string: ハイヤァアア！

original: Nnnnyyaarrgghh!
string: ぬおおおお！

original: For the Dawn!
string: 暁のために！

original: Rargh!
string: ラァーッ！

original: Hyargh!
string: ハイヤァー！

original: Yiiee!
string: イェエー！

original: Hunh!
string: ふん！

original: Die!
string: 死ね！

original: You're dead!
string: お前は終わりだ！

original: Come on!
string: かかってこい！

original: Die, monster!
string: 死ね、化物！

original: Filthy vampire!
string: 邪悪な吸血鬼め！

original: Gods curse you!
string: 神罰を受けろ！

original: I can smell your blood!
string: お前の血の匂いがするわ！

original: Bleed!
string: 血を流しなさいな！

original: Yeargh!
string: イイヤァ！

original: I've retrieved the <Alias=Item> from <Alias=Dungeon>.
string: <Alias=Dungeon>から<Alias=Item>を回収した

original: Well done! I said you'd return victorious, Arkay wasn't so sure. Wield it bravely.
string: お見事！ あんたなら勝てると言ったが、アーケイは信じてなかったよ。勇敢な奴だ

original: Nothing you can't handle.
string: 楽勝だろ

original: Understood.
string: 分かった

original: Go with the Light.
string: 光と共に行け

original: Any idea what I'll be up against?
string: どんな脅威に直面するか、わからないか？

original: What's that, Lord? Well, should I tell him?
string: 何ですって？ それは彼に話しても？

original: What's that, Lord? Well, should I tell her?
string: 何ですって？ それは彼女に話しても？

original: Arkay says bandits. Or, wait... no, he says bandits.
string: アーケイは山賊だと言っている。待てよ… いや、やっぱり山賊だ

original: Falmer, if I understand Arkay correctly.
string: アーケイによれば、ファルメルらしい

original: Arkay says you'll be facing forsworn.
string: アーケイによれば、相手はフォースウォーンだ

original: Vampires, perhaps?
string: 吸血鬼とかかな？

original: Arkay says you'll be facing warlocks.
string: アーケイによれば、敵はウォーロックだ

original: What is this artifact?
string: どんな秘宝なんだ？

original: "A powerful warhammer imbued with magic that places warding runes on the ground to obliterate it's wielder's foes."
string: 「魔法で満たされた強力な戦鎚。地面に防御のルーンを描く事により、持つ者の敵を撃破する」

original: Sounds useful.
string: 役に立ちそうだな

original: A magical shield that when blocked with, surrounds it's wielder with a holy aura that harms the undead.
string: 持つ者を聖なるオーラで覆い、それに触れたアンデッドにダメージを与える魔法の盾

original: Might come in handy.
string: 役立ちそうだ

original: An axe imbued with magic fueled by the destruction of the unholy. With every victorious blow against an undead creature, its power grows.
string: この斧にかけられた魔法は、邪悪なものを破壊する事でその強さを増す。アンデッドに打撃を加えるたびに、斧は強くなっていく

original: Arkay warns it's baneful charge abates with each dawn. Something to keep in mind, I suppose.
string: アーケイからの注意だが、高まった攻撃力は夜明けと共に元に戻る。これは覚えておいた方がいいな

original: What can I do to help?
string: 何か手伝えることは？

original: I've been pouring over some of the tomes left here in the keep. Interesting stories, indeed.
string: この書庫に残されていた書物をひっくり返して調べてみた。非常に興味深い話だったよ

original: Seems the previous incarnation of the Dawnguard had, at one time, some interesting toys.
string: かつてのドーンガードの死霊術では、面白いオモチャが作り出されたようだ

original: Arkay and I think it could be a great advantage for us. You should look into retrieving it.
string: アーケイも言っているが、我々の戦力として利用できそうだ。それを手に入れるべきだ

original: There are others here like you?
string: 他にも仲間がここに？

original: Vyrthur and myself are the only two snow elves that remain.
string: スノーエルフの生き残りは私とヴィルスールだけだ

original: You mean the Betrayed.
string: 裏切られし者のことか？

original: Yes. They swarmed the Chantry in vast numbers until we were completely overrun. We never really stood a chance.
string: そうだ。奴らは大群で礼拝所に攻め込み、すべてを破壊し尽くした。我々は為す術もなかった

original: I assume that the Arch-Curate was corrupted by them when they found a way to breach the Inner Sanctum.
string: 奴らは何らかの方法で最奥聖域に侵入した。おそらく最高司祭はその時に奴らの手に落ちたのだろう

original: Is that why you had retained your sight?
string: 視力を失わなかったのはそのためか？

original: Correct. We only numbered perhaps a hundred at the time, so our presence remained a secret to the dwarves and the Nords.
string: その通り。常時100人足らずしかいない我々は、ドワーフやノルドにとって謎に包まれた存在だった

original: Ironically, our undoing came at the hands of our own people.
string: そして皮肉な事に、我々に滅亡をもたらしたのは我々自身に他ならなかったのだ

original: What turned your people into the Betrayed?
string: 同胞たちが裏切られし者に変貌した理由は？

original: I've often asked myself that very same question. The blinding of my race was supposedly accomplished with a toxin.
string: ずっと、同じ事を疑問に思っていた。種族の皆は、毒を使って光を奪われたはずなのだ

original: Certainly not enough to devolve them into the sad and twisted beings they've become.
string: だがそれだけで、あれほどまでに卑しく邪悪な生き物に変わってしまうはずがない

original: Everyone couldn't have possibly agreed to that.
string: 全員が同意したとは信じがたい

original: There were splinter groups that resisted the agreement, and even some that sought alternate alliances.
string: この協定に反対する派閥もあったし、また別の派閥は他の勢力との協定も考えていた

original: But when it was all said and done, those elves were either slaughtered, vanished or gave up and took the dwarves' bargain.
string: だが、彼らも結局は殺されたり、追放されたり、考えを曲げてドワーフの要求に従わされたのだ

original: It appears the Nords won.
string: ノルドらが勝利したようだな

original: In a manner of speaking.
string: そういう言い方もできる

original: We had always maintained an uneasy alliance with the underground-dwelling dwarves, and when faced with extinction we turned to them for help.
string: 我々は地下に住むドワーフとの間に不安定な協定を結び、維持する努力をしてきた。そして滅亡の危機に瀕して、彼らに助けを求めた

original: Surprisingly, they agreed to protect us but demanded a terrible price... the blinding of our race.
string: 彼らは意外にも我々を守る事に同意したが、法外な対価を要求してきた。種族の目から光を奪うというのだ

original: It's symbolic. I don't expect you to understand.
string: 象徴を理解できなくても無理はない

original: All that just to end up dumping it out? Makes no sense to me.
string: それを処分するためだけにこんな大騒ぎを？ まるで理屈に合いませんわ

original: So these Initiates had to lug around a heavy pitcher of water. Marvelous.
string: それであの新入り達は重たい水差しを抱えて歩き回らなければならなかったというわけですのね。素晴らしいですわ

original: How long would they have to do that?
string: 彼らはいつまであんな事を続けなければなりませんの？

original: What's that basin in the center signify?
string: 真ん中にあるあの水盤は何を意味しているのかしら？

original: So, this is snow elf magic. Incredible.
string: するとこれはスノーエルフの魔法ですのね。すごいですわ

original: I think we should part ways.
string: ここで別れた方がいいだろう

original: I'll be with the Dawnguard if you need me.
string: わたしに用がありましたら、ドーンガードの所におりますわ

original: I'll stick around this place if you need me.
string: ここにおりますから、用事がありましたらまた

original: I'll be at Castle Volkihar if you need me.
string: ヴォルキハル城におりますから、用がありましたらおいで下さいませ

original: I'll be around here if you need me.
string: ここにおりますわ、用がありましたらまた

original: All right. I'll meet you back at the castle.
string: 分かりましたわ。城に戻りましたら、またお会いしましょう

original: All right. I'll meet you at Darkfall Cave.
string: そうですわね。ダークフォール洞窟でお会いしましょう

original: All right. I'll meet you at the glade.
string: そうですわね。湿地でお会いしましょう

original: Oh. All right then. You know where to find me.
string: そう。結構ですわよ。わたしの居場所はご存知ですわね

original: Good luck out there. Hopefully I'll see you again soon.
string: 幸運をお祈りしますわ。またお会いできますよう

original: I'm surprised you think you can manage without me, but it's your choice.
string: わたしがいなくても大丈夫だなんて、大した自信ですのね。好きにしてよろしくてよ

original: Oh. All right. Goodbye, then.
string: ああ、そうですの。それでは失礼いたしますわ

original: You can't get rid of me that easily.
string: そう簡単に、わたしはいなくなりませんわよ

original: And go where? You can't just leave me alone whenever you feel like it. I'm coming with you, like it or not.
string: それで、いずこへと？ いつでもわたしを置いていけると思わないで。何と言おうと、ついて行きますわよ

original: I disagree.
string: 賛成できかねますわ

original: Come with me.
string: 一緒に来てほしい

original: Three's a crowd. Get rid of your other friend, and I'm yours.
string: 三人は多すぎますわね。お仲間と別れてきましたら、お供いたしますわ

original: I'm not going to waste my time making sure your friend doesn't get killed. When it's just you and me, we can go.
string: 味方の命を守る事に必死になって、時間を無駄にしたくはありませんの。あなたと二人だけなら、すぐ出発いたしますわ

original: I don't want to step on anyone's toes. Come back to me when you're alone.
string: 人が嫌がる事はいたしませんわ。寂しくなったら、お戻りになられて

original: Not until you get rid of whoever your other friend is.
string: 他の仲間と別れてきてくれましたらね

original: Another adventure.
string: 新たな冒険の始まりですわね

original: Let's make some more stories.
string: わたし達の物語を紡ぎましょう

original: Thought you'd never ask.
string: 誘って下さるとは思いませんでしたわ

original: Whenever you're ready.
string: いつでもよしなに

original: I knew you'd miss me.
string: わたしでなければダメだと分かっておりましたのよ

original: Let's go.
string: 行きましょう

original: Wait here.
string: ここで待て

original: I'll hang back for a bit, but you're not leaving me behind. This is too important.
string: ちょっと離れますけれど、置いて行ったりなさらないで。絶対ですわよ

original: If you think I'm going to let you have all the fun, you're crazy. I'll let you lead ahead, but I'll be keeping an eye on you.
string: 楽しみを独り占めできると思っておいでなら、酔狂にもほどがありますわ。先に行かせてさしあげますけど、ちゃんと見ておりますわよ

original: Sorry, I'm not that easy to get rid of. If you want to run ahead, I won't stop you, but I'll be following.
string: お生憎様、そう簡単には離れませんわ。一人で先に行きたいならご自由に、しっかりついて行きますわよ

original: Oh, you're off on your own for a while? All right.
string: 一人で行きますの？ 今だけならよろしくてよ

original: I'll be here.
string: ここで待っておりますわ

original: If you say so.
string: 分かりましたわ

original: Understood.
string: 分かった

original: Good. I knew I was sending the right man for the job.
string: いいぞ。仕事の人選は間違ってなかったようだな

original: Good. I knew I was sending the right woman for the job.
string: いいぞ。仕事の人選は間違ってなかったようだな

original: So we're pinning the murder on the Dawnguard?
string: ドーンガードに濡れ衣を着せろと？

original: Precisely! The people will put pressure on the Dawnguard who are apparently murdering their fellows without provocation.
string: そのとおり！ 理由もなく市民を殺す事に対して、ドーンガードに対する風向きは強くなるはずだ

original: Their focus will be shifted from us, giving us one less nuisance to deal with.
string: 人々の注目は我々からそれる。面倒がひとつ減るというわけだ

original: What do you mean by a "high profile" target?
string: “目立つ”標的とは？

original: You know, an important member of society. Someone attached to the Jarl's court, a merchant, a bard, a priest, someone with stature.
string: まあ、社会的に重要な人物だな。首長の宮廷の関係者とか、商人、吟遊詩人、司祭などの社会的地位のある者がいい

original: That will make them all more upset to have one of their citizens slain, and under such flimsy pretense.
string: そうすれば仲間を殺された事に対する市民の怒りは倍増する。見え透いた手だがうまくいくだろう

original: Who are the Dawnguard?
string: ドーンガードとは？

original: Understood.
string: 分かった

original: Good.
string: いい返事ね

original: Good.
string: いい返事だ

original: What do you mean by "discreet."
string: “慎重に”とは？

original: What do you think I mean?
string: どういう意味だと思う？

original: Don't make a big scene. Don't get caught.
string: 派手な事はしないで。捕まらないように

original: The corpse is to be the message, not the attack.
string: 死体は攻撃ではなく伝達のために使うのよ

original: What do you mean by "don't draw attention?"
string: 目立つな、というのは？

original: I hope you comprehend killing better than you comprehend speech.
string: おしゃべりより殺しの方を理解してほしいものだな

original: Don't. Get. Caught.
string: 捕まるなという事だ

original: Who are the Dawnguard?
string: ドーンガードとは？

original: And the wayshrines?
string: 祠は？

original: For the time being, they will remain open.
string: しばらくの間は、閉ざされる事はない

original: If remnants of our kind who escaped the betrayal at the hands of the dwarves exist out there, perhaps they will find this place one day.
string: もし、裏切られし者の手を逃れ、ドワーフに助けられた同胞がいたら、いつの日かここを見つけてくれるだろう

original: The wayshrines are part of the Chantry then?
string: 祠は礼拝所の一環ということか？

original: Oh yes. They were an important part of the process here.
string: ああ。ここでの大切な儀式の一部だった

original: They represented the steps the Initiates took on the path to total enlightenment.
string: 新人達がたどる、完全なる悟りへの道程を象徴していたのだ

original: Sadly, the magic used to construct these wonders were lost long before I arrived here.
string: 残念ながら、そうした奇跡の力を持つ建造物は私がここに来るずっと前に失われていたが

original: Most snow elves?
string: 主にスノーエルフが？

original: Our empire had temples to some of the other deities: Trinimac, Syrabane, Jephre and Phynaster rounded out the rest.
string: 我々の帝国には、他の信仰も根づいていた。トリニマック、シラベイン、イェフレ、フィナスタール、挙げればきりがない

original: But those temples paled in comparison to the glory of the Chantry and its wayshrines.
string: だが、それらの聖堂もこの礼拝所と祠に比べれば色あせて見える

original: No... I won't let you ruin centuries of preparations...
string: やめろ… 何世紀もかけた計画を台なしにする気か…

original: This has gone on long enough.
string: 今まで長かった

original: Hmm...
string: ふむ…

original: He's up there, on the balcony. Come on!
string: 彼はバルコニーにいますわ。行きますわよ！

original: What exactly does it do?
string: 何をするものなんだ？

original: That part, I don't know. Once we have it, hopefully it'll be obvious.
string: その部分はよく分かりませんわね。手に入れたら明らかになるかと思いますわ

original: What does it have to do with the sun?
string: 太陽とはどんな関連が？

original: Auriel is one of the elven gods. He's with the rest of them in Aetherius.
string: アーリエルはエルフの神の一人ですわ。彼ら神々はエセリウスにおりますの

original: The way I've heard it, the sun represents the connection from our world to theirs.
string: わたしが聞いた話によると、太陽は我々の世界と彼らの世界のつながりを表していますわ

original: Supposedly, the bow draws its energy from the sun itself, which it why it shows up in that prophecy.
string: おそらく弓はその力を太陽自身から得ておりますのよ。だからあの予言に登場するのですわね

original: What do you know about Auriel's Bow?
string: アーリエルの弓について何か知らないか？

original: Not much. If you read any history, it shows up from time to time, but it's a hard thing to track.
string: そうでもありませんの。歴史の書物には時々出てきますけれど、その行方を追い続けるのが難しいのですわ

original: As far as I know, though, it's never been held by a vampire. That would be a new one.
string: でもわたしの知る限り、吸血鬼の手に落ちた事はありませんわ。それは新しい個体かも知れませんわね

original: (grunt)
string: LOOKUP FAILED!

original: Stay here and guard the farm!
string: 幽鬼作成

original: It's ironic that we're "helping" these priests.
string: 司祭たちに“協力している”のは皮肉な話だ

original: Honestly, I don't think they care what a bunch of vampires would do with Auriel's Bow. They're pretty focused on the past.
string: 正直なところ、吸血鬼達がアーリエルの弓をどうしようが彼らは気にしないと思われますわ。彼らは過去に注目しておりますもの

original: As long as we can get this "Vyrthur" out of the Sanctum, I think they'll be happy to just hand it over.
string: その“ヴィルスール”という輩を聖域の外に出す事ができれば、彼らはきっと喜んでそれを渡してくれるはずですわ

original: Heard anything about a Moth Priest passing through?
string: 聖蚕の僧侶が立ち寄ったとかいう話は？

original: Heard anything about a Moth Priest passing through?
string: 聖蚕の僧侶が立ち寄ったとかいう話は？

original: Follow me, or you'll regret it. (Intimidate)
string: おとなしくついて来ないと、後悔することになるぞ(威圧)

original: Settle down. No need for threats. Lead the way. But I'm warning you, I'm not afraid to fight you if I have to.
string: 落ち着け。脅す必要なんてない。先に行け。ただし、警告しておく。必要があればいつでも戦うぞ

original: I'm no so easily coerced. I've got my eye on you. Try anything, and you will be the one who regrets it.
string: 脅迫は無駄だ。隙は見せない。変な真似をしたら、後悔することになるぞ

original: Come with me. (Persuade)
string: 一緒に来てほしい(説得)

original: Monster? What monster? Don't know what you're game is, but I'll humor for a moment.
string: 怪物？ 怪物って？ 何の話か知らないけど、今は付き合ってやるよ

original: Lead the way. Take me to this "monster" of yours.
string: 案内してちょうだい。その“怪物”のところへ

original: But I'm warning you, do anything funny, and you'll regret it.
string: ただし、警告しておく。変な真似をしたら、後悔することになるぞ

original: I'll take you to the monster you're hunting. (Persuade)
string: 狙っている怪物のところに案内しよう(説得)

original: What are you talking about? I don't know anything about any monsters.
string: 何の話だ？ 怪物なんて知らない

original: I'll take you to the monster you're hunting. (Persuade)
string: 狙っている怪物のところに案内しよう(説得)

original: Fine. If it will get you to leave me alone. Lead the way.
string: 分かったよ。それで放っておいてくれるならな。先導してくれ

original: I want to show you something. It's important. You really must come. (Persuade)
string: 見せたいものがある。大事な話だ。ぜひともついて来てほしい(説得)

original: You've mistaken me for someone who cares about you and your problems. Find someone else.
string: どうしてそんな事を気にかけなきゃいけないんだ。他を当たるんだな

original: I want to show you something. It's important. You really must come. (Persuade)
string: 見せたいものがある。大事な話だ。ぜひともついて来てほしい(説得)

original: Come with me "bard/merchant/pilgrim"
string: “吟遊詩人だろうと商人だろうと巡礼者だろうと”、一緒に来てほしい

original: Come with me, "bard."
string: 一緒に来てほしい、“吟遊詩人”よ

original: Come with me, "merchant."
string: 一緒に来てほしい、“商人”よ

original: Come with me, "pilgrim."
string: 一緒に来てほしい、“巡礼者”よ

original: Why? What do you want?
string: なぜ？ 何が目的なんだ？

original: I beg your pardon, ma'am. I don't know what you're getting at, but whatever it is, it's not appreciated.
string: どういうことだ？ 何が言いたいのか分からないが、とにかく不愉快だ

original: I beg your pardon, sir. I don't know what you're getting at, but whatever it is, it's not appreciated.
string: どういうことだ？ 何が言いたいのか分からないが、とにかく不愉快だ

original: You're no bard/merchant/pilgrim.
string: 吟遊詩人でも商人でも巡礼者でもないだろう

original: You're no bard.
string: 吟遊詩人などではないな

original: You're no merchant.
string: 商人などではないな

original: You're no merchant.
string: 商人などではないな

original: You're no pilgrim.
string: 巡礼者などではないな

original: You're no pilgrim.
string: 巡礼者などではないな

original: You're a "bard" / "merchant" / "pilgrim" ? I doubt it.
string: “吟遊詩人”で“商人”で“巡礼者”なのか？ 疑わしいな

original: A song? I, uh... I seem to have misplaced my lute. Another time perhaps?
string: 歌を？ えっと… リュートをどこかに忘れてきたようだ。また今度でいいか？

original: Play me a song, "bard."
string: 吟遊詩人なら歌の一曲でも聞かせてほしい

original: My wares? I, uh... Oh so sorry, I'm all sold out.
string: 商品を？ あの… 悪いけど、全部売れちゃったんだ

original: Show me your wares, "merchant."
string: 商人なら売り物を見せてほしい

original: Which shrine? Well, I... I'm going to them all. Yes. One at a time. Until I've visited all the shrines to all the gods in Skyrim.
string: 祠？ えーと… 全部回るつもりさ。そう。巡礼なんだ。スカイリムの全ての神の、全ての祠を巡る旅だ

original: To which shrine are you headed, "pilgrim."
string: 次の巡礼はどの祠で？

original: With a sky like that, something bad is coming.
string: あの空の様子では、何か悪い事が訪れるな

original: Watch yourself. The sky is a bad omen.
string: 気をつけて。空が不吉だ

original: The sky is all wrong. What's happening?
string: 空がおかしいわ。何が起きているの？

original: W...Where's the sun?
string: 太陽は… どこ？

original: Look at the sky!
string: 空を見て！

original: It's daytime... Why is it so dark outside?
string: まだ昼間なのに… どうして外が暗い？

original: The sky is so dark. What does it mean?
string: 空がこんなに暗いわ。どういう意味なの？

original: I can't see the sun. Where did it go?
string: 太陽が見えない。どこへ行った？

original: The sun's gone dark. What could be happening now?
string: 太陽が暗くなった。一体何が起こっている？

original: Dragons weren't enough. Now we've lost the sun too?
string: ドラゴンだけでは飽き足らず、今度は太陽まで失うと？

original: What's wrong with the sky?
string: 空はどうしてしまったんだ？

original: Where did the sun go?
string: 太陽はどこへ行ったの？

original: The sky shouldn't look like that...
string: 空の様子がおかしい…

original: Why does the sky look like that?
string: なぜ空があんな風に？

original: This weather seems all wrong to me.
string: この天気はまったくおかしいな

original: By the Divines, what happened to the sky?
string: ああ、神々よ、空はどうなってしまったんだ？

original: Look at the sky... the Divines must be angry with us!
string: 空を見て… 神々が私達に怒っているに違いないわ！

original: What foul magic could put the sun out?
string: どんな卑劣な魔法を使えば太陽を消せるんだ？

original: The sun... it's gone!
string: 太陽が… 消えてる！

original: What's going on? Where did the sun go?
string: どうなってる？ 太陽はどこだ？

original: The day is dark as night! What's happening?
string: 昼が夜みたいに暗い！ 何が起きているんだ？

original: The sun is gone! We're all doomed!
string: 太陽が消えた！ 皆破滅だ！

original: By the Eight... look at the sky!
string: 八大神よ… 空を見ろ！

original: Why is it so dark?
string: なぜこんなに暗いんだ？

original: The tyranny of the sun is over!
string: 太陽の専制は終わりだ！

original: It's our time now.
string: 我々の時代が来た

original: Skyrim is ours!
string: スカイリムは我らのものだ！

original: I'm putting a lot of faith in you. Don't let me down.
string: とても信頼しているのよ。失望させないで

original: Remember, I'm not leaving until Harkon's no longer a threat.
string: 覚えておいて、ハルコンが脅威でなくなるまでは行かないわ

original: Give Harkon my regards... and a dagger to his heart.
string: ハルコンによろしく伝えて… 胸にはダガーを刺してきてちょうだい

original: If anything happens to Serana, I'll have you answer for it.
string: もしセラーナに何か起これば、責任を取ってもらうわ

original: Help yourself to anything you need in my laboratory.
string: 私の研究所で必要なものがあればご自由にどうぞ

original: I've planted some new herbs in the courtyard garden. I hope they'll grow.
string: 新しいハーブをいくつか中庭の庭園に植えたの。育つといいわね

original: It might take decades to restore the castle to its former glory... but I appear to have plenty of time.
string: 城の壮観を取り戻すには何十年もかかりそうよ… でも私には時間がたっぷりあるわ

original: Ah, it's good to be home again.
string: ああ、故郷に戻るのはいいものね

original: I'll return to Castle Volkihar as soon as I'm finished gathering my things.
string: 荷物をまとめ終わったらすぐに、ヴォルキハル城へ戻るわ

original: You appear to have something on your mind. What is it?
string: 何か気になっているようね。何なの？

original: I trust you're keeping my daughter safe.
string: 娘の安全を守っていると信じているわ

original: Good to see you again. It's becoming quite lonely out here.
string: また会えてうれしいわ。ここはずいぶん寂しくなってきたものね

original: No matter how long I've been here, I'll still never get used to this place.
string: どれだけ長くここにいようと、決してこの場所には慣れないわ

original: Slay any vampires lately have we?
string: 最近は吸血鬼を殺してる？

original: What is it now?
string: 今度は何？

original: I hope this is important, I have an experiment I'm working on.
string: 重要な事だといいけれど。取り組み中の実験があるのよ

original: He died by my hand.
string: この手で倒した

original: Then I see nothing preventing my return to Tamriel.
string: では私のタムリエルへの帰還を妨げるものはないわ

original: Allow me to gather some of my things and I'll head back to Castle Volkihar.
string: 荷物をまとめさせて。それからヴォルキハル城へ向かいましょう

original: And from the bottom of my heart, I thank you.
string: そして心の底から、感謝するわ

original: Harkon is dead.
string: ハルコンは死んだ

original: What? Are you certain?
string: 何ですって？ 確かなの？

original: I have five soul husks here.
string: 魂のハスクを5個集めてきた

original: Excellent, here you are.
string: 素晴らしいわ、さあどうぞ

original: Perfect. This should do it.
string: 完璧よ。これで十分でしょう

original: Okay. Hope this helps.
string: いいわよ。これが役立つ事を願うわ

original: All right. Here's the extract.
string: いいでしょう。これがエキスよ

original: How many do you need?
string: いくつ必要なんだ？

original: Hmmm, I'd say five of them would be enough.
string: ふむ、5つあれば十分だと思うわ

original: I could use help with the crystals around here.
string: ここらにある水晶について教えてほしい

original: Absolutely. I've spent a great deal of time perfecting an extract that increases the potency of soul husks.
string: その通り。魂のハスクの能力を増加するエキスを完成させるのに膨大な時間を費やしたわ

original: If you wanted to bring some to me, I'd be happy to provide you some of the extract. It should help resist the draining aura of the crystals.
string: いくつか持ってきてくれれば、喜んでエキスを渡すわ。水晶からオーラが流出するのを抑えられるはずよ

original: What if you're wrong?
string: 間違っているとしたら？

original: I would gladly accept my fate at their hands if it robs Harkon of victory.
string: ハルコンから勝利を奪えるなら、喜んで運命を彼らの手に委ねるわ

original: Have we angered the Ideal Masters?
string: アイディール・マスターを怒らせてしまったのだろうか？

original: Time is almost irrelevant to the Ideal Masters.
string: アイディール・マスターにとって、時間はほぼ無意味よ

original: I doubt very much that they'll hasten to exact revenge for freeing me from the ruins.
string: 私を遺跡から解放した事に対して、急いで報復を求めるとはとても思えないわ

original: And if Harkon were slain?
string: ハルコンを倒せたとすれば？

original: If you think you can accomplish that feat, knowing hundreds before you have tried and failed, then I wish you the best of luck.
string: 数百の者達が挑戦し失敗した事を知った上で、その偉業を達成できると思うのなら、成功を祈るわ

original: But if this miracle were to somehow happen, I would gladly return to Tamriel.
string: でも、もしこの奇跡が何らかの形で起こるなら、喜んでタムリエルへ戻るでしょうね

original: When will you return to Tamriel?
string: タムリエルにはいつ帰るのか？

original: As I've told you before I'm a Daughter of Coldharbour... offspring to Molag Bal.
string: 以前言ったように、私はコールドハーバーの娘… モラグ・バルの子孫よ

original: Knowing that Serana shares that blessing with me, I'm already terrified that Harkon will get his hands on her.
string: セラーナがその祝福を共有している事を知った今、ハルコンが彼女に手を出す事が恐ろしいの

original: Farewell, friend. May the radiance of Auri-El fill your heart with joy.
string: お別れだ、友よ。アーリエルの光がその心を喜びで満たすよう祈ろう

original: Farewell, friend. May the glow of Auri-El shield you from your enemies.
string: さようなら、友よ。アーリエルの光の盾がその身を守るだろう

original: Farewell, friend. May the warmth of Auri-El provide you strength.
string: お別れだ、友よ。アーリエルの火がその身に力を与えるだろう

original: Farewell, friend. May the light of Auri-El illuminate your darkest hours.
string: さようなら、友よ。苦難の時も、アーリエルの光が導いてくれるだろう

original: If there's assistance I can provide, just ask. It's the least I can do.
string: 何かできる事があれば言ってくれ。私にはそんな事しかできないのだ

original: I trust you're faring well?
string: うまくいっているのだろうな？

original: It's good to speak to you again.
string: また会えて嬉しいぞ

original: If there's anything at all I can help you with, please ask.
string: 何かできる事があれば言ってくれ

original: What will you do then?
string: これからどうするつもりなんだ？

original: For the time being I will remain here, on the overlook and continue trying to keep the Sanctum free of the Betrayed.
string: しばらくはこの見張り台に残って、裏切られし者から聖域を守る仕事を続けるつもりだ

original: You're always welcome to return here at any time, of course.
string: 用があればいつでもここに来てくれ

original: Then I've contributed to your kind's extinction.
string: とすると、そちらの一族の絶滅に寄与してしまったことになる

original: There's no need for that kind of talk. I said it was possible.
string: そのような話に意味はない。可能性があると言っただけだ

original: It's also quite possible that there are some other isolated conclaves of snow elves nestled elsewhere on Nirn.
string: ニルンのどこかに他のスノーエルフの秘密教団がある可能性も残っている

original: I'll also assume Vyrthur didn't exactly give you the option to stay your hand.
string: それに、ヴィルスールの状態を見れば、倒す事をためらう余地などなかっただろう

original: What will happen to the Chantry now?
string: 礼拝所はこれからどうなる？

original: While it would fill me with joy to see the Chantry back to its former glory, that time has long since passed.
string: 礼拝所にかつての栄光が戻ったのは喜ばしい事だが、あまりにも長い時間が経ってしまった

original: Now that my brother's dead, it's quite possible I'm the last of our kind.
string: 兄弟が死んだ今、種族の生き残りは私1人かも知れない

original: How do I obtain Sunhallowed Arrows?
string: 太陽神の矢はどうすれば手に入る？

original: I can actually assist you in that regard.
string: それに関しては、任せてくれ

original: If you were to bring me some good quality elven arrows, I could imbue them with the proper incantations and rituals.
string: 質のいいエルフの矢を持ってきてくれたら、正式な呪文と儀式で魔法をかけてやろう

original: I'm afraid I'll need elven arrows if you want me to produce the Sunhallowed Arrows, and it seems you're all out of them at the moment.
string: 太陽神の矢を作るには、エルフの矢が必要だ。残念ながら、見たところ手持ちがないようだな

original: Can you make me some Sunhallowed Arrows?
string: 太陽神の矢を作ってもらえないか？

original: Certainly. I can only do twenty at a time, but I see that won't be a problem in this case.
string: もちろん。一度に作れるのは12本だけだが、その本数なら問題ないな

original: Can you make me some Sunhallowed Arrows?
string: 太陽神の矢を作ってもらえないか？

original: Absolutely. I can only do twenty at a time, so if you want the rest of your arrows blessed, let me know.
string: いいとも。一度に作れるのは12本だけだから、残りの矢にも祝福がほしいならまた言ってくれ

original: Can you make me some Sunhallowed Arrows?
string: 太陽神の矢を作ってもらえないか？

original: Vyrthur said something about using blood?
string: ヴィルスールが血を使うとか言っていた気が

original: Well, using an arrow with the bow that's been dipped in blood may cause it to function differently... corrupting its purpose.
string: 血に浸した矢を使うと、また別の効果がある… 当たった者を腐敗させるのだ

original: That's of course if you're foolish enough to try it.
string: 知恵があれば、試そうとは思わないだろうがな

original: Sounds powerful.
string: 威力がありそうだ

original: That's actually only a fraction of its potential.
string: 実はそれも、弓の持つ力の一部に過ぎない

original: With Sunhallowed Arrows, you would be able to produce a much more spectacular effect... causing bursts of sunlight to envelop your foes.
string: 太陽神の矢を使えば、さらに絶大な効果を発揮するのだ。敵は太陽の炎で焼き尽くされるだろう

original: The sunbursts would certainly hurt anything, but is especially devastating to the undead.
string: 太陽の炎はどんな相手も傷つける事ができるが、特にアンデッドには効果的だ

original: What can it do?
string: 具体的な効果は？
